loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina sells grocery items from her home to earn a living. She has operated her business for three months. She also engages in crop farming to earn additional income. She and her husband work hard together to sustain their family's basic needs.

Josefina would like to increase the quantity and variety of grocery goods she offers in her store, but she has insufficient capital for this investment. She is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000.

Josefina is excited about her loan and is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy a stock of grocery items for her retail store

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 62 years old and from the town of Badian in Cebu. She is married and together with her husband they grow corn and produce coconut wine. This has been their livelihood for three years now, earning them 15,000 PHP per month. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, to be used for her crop and also to buy coconut wine from other coconut farmers to sell at a profit. 

In the future Wilma would like to have other business opportunities so she can live in comfort and abundance in her old age.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and coconut wine

loans.name: Karla Margarita

texts.es: Karla de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 5 años su negocio esta cerca de su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi podrá darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Karla is 37 years old.  She lives in her own home with her life's companion and their two children.  She has been working for 5 years making and selling tortillas.  Her business is by her place of residence and she has many customers.  With the earnings she is able to cover some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn wholesale and lime powder in order to be able to continue with her work since this is her only source of income and in this way she will be able to give her offspring a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and lime powder

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a single woman who has no children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water.

Catherine has operated a beauty salon business for the past four years, operating at the market where passersby and town dwellers are. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, Catherine wants to purchase cosmetics, blow dry and hair chemicals. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, blow dry and hair chemicals

loans.name: Saradini

texts.en:
Saradini is a happy mother of two sons and one daughter. She is 42 years old and hails from Falakata.  Her husband Rabindra, 45 years old, is a cycle van puller by profession. Their elder son work as a mason and the other two are studying in grade 9 and grade 8 respectively.  They live in their own small house in the village of Baro Shoulmari in Alipurduar district.

As the earnings of Saradini's husband and son are inconsistent, she earns a living for the family by rearing cattle. Saradini wants her family to be happy and to have a good life. She has been involved in animal husbandry for a long time. Every morning, she milks the cows and then sells the milk at the market where the demand is high. She derives a good income from this activity.

She now wants to increase her business to cope with the growing price of essential commodities. She doesn't have enough capital to invest in her business. Thus she has turned to Kiva's partner BJS for financial assistance. She is hoping to get some financial support to keep her small business going. She will use the loan to buy another cow.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase another dairy cow to expand her business.

loans.name: Agnella

texts.en:
Agnella is a single woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Agnella operates a stall selling groceries and vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 40,000 KES, Agnella wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, age 22 and unmarried, is a barber. He opened his barber shop recently and reports that it is a good business that provides him with a good income. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city of Rafah. His brother earns a low wage as an employee in the public sector.

Ahmad requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his barber shop, as well as to add some interior decoration. This will make his salon more attractive and bring him more customers.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his barber shop, as well as to add some interior decoration

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a butcher shop for selling chicken meat. He will buy some tools and a refrigerator for his new store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase improvised modern farm tools and equipment for improving her farming activity so as to get better harvest to sell to clients and family use.

loans.name: Rohbar

texts.en:
Rohbar is a confident woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1981. She is living in the district with her family. She is married and has three children. When she was a child they lived poor and in order to feed their family her father went to Russia to earn money. She helped her mother to keep livestock and has experience in agriculture. After graduation from high school she entered medical college to get a higher education. The standard of living was bad. They lived on the money that her father was sending to them and on the money from keeping livestock.

Recently, she is a nurse at a medical clinic and additionally keeps livestock at home. Her husband is in Russia working to earn money for their family. She decided to do business with livestock. She participated in a three-day training provided by IMON to startup clients. She got the necessary information and has a goal to start her new business. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to buy livestock and do business for further opening a farm. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy livestock and do business for further opening a farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of tomatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is grateful that she was granted a 19,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. Aside from her small general store she also has a van for rent. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Aurora dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the possibility of a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Kashi

texts.en:
Kashi is a widowed woman with six children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She operates a khanga (women's cloth wrap) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm implements

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is a hardworking and responsible parent. She is happily married and blessed with four children. Dolores manages her variety store, hog raising and rice field. With the businesses she has, she would like to focus on her variety store since it could give her a daily income. Dolores is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to be used to buy grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, assorted biscuits, detergent soap and seasonings. She hopes that through this amount of loan, she could keep her variety progress and also with her other business involvement.

loans.use: to buy bulk grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, biscuits, detergent soap and seasonings for her variety store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, age 37, works as a food vendor to earn an income. She prepares and sells a variety of food items at her food stall. Her husband is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW), but Evelyn must earn additional income in order to adequately provide for her two children. 

She has requested a loan in order to buy ingredients for additional food dishes to prepare and offer for sale. The increased profits from this investment will allow her to provide for her children's educational needs. 

Evelyn plans to place money into savings for the future use of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for additional food dishes to prepare and offer for sale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, age 25, sells home products to members of her community to earn her income. She has been engaged in this work for three years and earns KES 7,000 per month from her business. She supports a family of three members.

Hellen has applied for her first loan in the amount of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She will use her loan funds to build up her inventory and to secure a permanent stall from which to sell her wares.

She plans to use her anticipated profits to repay the loan and to arrange for permanent premises for her business. 

Her business objective is to achieve higher financial stability.

loans.use: to build up her inventory and to secure a permanent stall from which to sell her wares

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 27 years old, married to Josephine and supports a family of two members.

He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the last five years, earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to service and repair his motorcycle.

His plans are to use the anticipated profits to educate his children as well as repay his loan.

His future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to service and repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Nemer

texts.en:
Nemer is 29, married and has two young daughters. The family lives in Khan Younis, Palestine.

Nemer opened a butcher shop six years ago. Business is good and the family receives a good income from it.

Nemer took a 1,753 USD USD Murabaha loan (an acceptable form of credit under Sharia law) through Kiva's field partner FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more meat for his butcher shop, which will increase his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more meat for his butcher shop

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has operated a transport business for the past four years. He earns a living by transporting customers to their destinations using his motorcycle. He and his wife have four children, and he describes himself as being determined to provide for them as well as he can.

David will use his Kes 50,000 loan funds to service and maintain his motorcycle. 
 
David's goal is to see his business expand and become more successful. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en: Tamar is a 22-year-old married woman. She lives in the Gori district with her husband, three children, her mother, brother and his family. Tamar is unemployed at the moment, stays at home and looks after her children. She wants to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 USD. With the received credit, Tamar will purchase silver jewelry and will resell it at a higher price to generate income. She will get income and will be able to improve the living conditions of her three children.

loans.use: to purchase silver jewelry to resell at a higher price.

loans.name: Bithika

texts.en:
Bithika is 27 years old and lives with her husband Mithun and one young son in a small village in Alipurduar. 

Bithika and her husband are associated with the garment business. They buy varieties of garments like saris, salwar pieces, shirts, pants, scarves etc. according to the seasonal demand from the wholesale market and sell them door-to-door in their neighborhood. Now they want to buy more stock for her business with the aim of expanding the business.

For that reason, Bithika would like to take a loan from BJS to buy a good quantity of clothing to meet her customers' needs. The profits generated from this business will be used to build up her savings and upgrade their financial condition. Her dream is to build a shop of her own in the local market in order to expand their business because it is a very profitable business in their locality.

Bithika is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva as well.

loans.use: To buy more stock of garments to expand her business.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah, 59, is married to Fridah and supports a family of five. For the past twelve years he has been a small-scale farmer and earns approximately 10,000 KES a month.

Jeremiah has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting. His plans are to use the anticipated profits from his farm to develop it as well as start a stable retail business. His hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David sells sheep and sheep's wool to earn his living. He has been involved in this work for the past five years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He describes himself as focused.

David and his wife have five children.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Gis previous loan was repaid successfully.		

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sheep.

loans.use: to buy more sheep

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa owns and operate her variety store. She also offers direct selling products, particularly AVON and Boardwalk. Elsa was glad that her previous loans has been of great impact in improving her businesses. This time she would like to increase the grocery items she offers but she doesn't have enough capital. With regards to this matter, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She hopes to obtain this amount of loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as sugar, seasonings, soft drinks and assorted biscuits for her variety store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pasta, malagkit, spaghetti, seasonings and other ingredients needed

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 39 years old and he supports a family of six members. 

He has been a farmer for the last nine years and earns KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase improved modern farm tools and equipment for improving his farming activity to get a better harvest to sell to clients and for family use.
 
He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase improved modern farm tools and equipment for improving his farming activity to get a better harvest to sell to clients and for family use.

loans.name: Nandtaabe Silgo Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur TINSYANDE est responsable du groupe NANDTAABE SILGO. Il est marié et père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 50 ans et le moins âgé a 30 ans.  Aucun enfant  ne va à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est agriculteur depuis 50 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Il compte acheter avec l’argent octroyé,  01 sac de haricot pour stocker et revendre, 10 poules pour son élevage afin de revendre plus tard, 02 rouleaux  de fils et O1 rouleau de tissu pour sa couture.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour épargner. Il ambitionne  être un grand richard.

NB: Mr est tailleur de formation et l'exerce depuis mais avec notre aide (prêt Kiva- Micro start), il décide d'ajouter d'autres activités telles que: l'élevage et la vente de céréales (acheter stocker et revendre en cas de soudure). Ce qui justifie ses multiples fonction.
texts.en:
Tinsyande is the leader of the Nandtaabe Silgo group. He is married and a father of six children. The eldest child is 50 years old and the youngest is 30 years old. None of his children are in school. Tinsyande takes care of four people.

He has been a farmer for 50 years. He procures his goods from surrounding markets. With this loan, he plans to buy one sac of beans to stock and resell, 10 chickens to raise and resell, two rolls of string, and one roll of fabric for making clothes. 

Tinsyande wants to save his earnings. He hopes to gain social status.

NB: Mr. Tinsyande is a tailor by training, but with our aid (a loan from Kiva Microfinance) he decided to add other activities, including growing and selling cereals and animals (which he buys to stock and resell). This explains his multiple activities.

loans.use: to buy one sac of beans, 10 chickens, two rolls of string, and one roll of fabric

loans.name: Vigilance

texts.en:
Vigilance is a single woman who has no children. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

Vigilance has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years, operating at the market where passersby and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase hair relaxers, lipsticks and hair food for her beauty salon business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hair relaxers, lipsticks and hair food

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single woman who is blessed with a child who goes to school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years Mary has had a dairy. She sells its output to local residents at the market and restaurant operators. Weather is her major challenge.

Mary decided to join Yehu to access their loans. She is applying for a 15,000 KES loan, which she will use to buy feed and medicine for her cows.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her cows.

loans.name: Mujiba

texts.en: Mujiba is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. She is a teacher and has taught secondary school for more than 40 years. She is a teacher of technology. She is well known among teachers and knows her duty best. Basically, she is a pensioner and works in order to live. The amount of her pension is not enough for living. She also pays for the education of her granddaughter at school. She wants to renovate her house with her salary and live in better conditions with her husband and family. However, her savings and salary are not enough to renovate her house. She appealed to IMON asking for help to buy construction supplies and renovate her house. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and renovate her house

loans.name: Maauga

texts.en:
Maauga, age 41, prepares and sells pancakes and ice cakes to earn her living. She sells her wares to local members of her community and has been engaged in this business for three years. 

She and her husband have seven children.

Maauga has been a member of SPBD since 2014. She requested a loan in order to buy necessary items for her business, including cooking oil, yeast, a bag of flour, and baking pans. 

She plans to use her expected profits to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy necessary items for her business, including cooking oil, yeast, a bag of flour, and baking pans

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is an elderly widow from Talairon, Oroquieta. She earns her living by selling seafood items such as shells, fish, and seaweed. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and, as such, enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Josefina wishes to repair her broken-down house. She applied for a loan in order to purchase sticks and "amakan" (bamboo mats) for walling. She hopes to live comfortably as a result of this loan investment.

She reports that she wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase sticks and "amakan" (bamboo mats) with which to repair her broken-down house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rolls of good materials and more sewing equipments.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and is from Bonifacio. 

She and her husband have been farmers, focusing on planting rice, corn, vegetables, and root crops. This is how they earn a living. Josephine earns 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

As a new member of PMPC, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to purchase bags of fertilizer and compost. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her business and to be able to engage in agricultural business ventures.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her business activity and increase her stock to raise more income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 43 years old, married and lives in Liloan, Bonifacio. For the past fifteen years she and her husband have been farmers, mostly of rice. She earns a good income each harvest, which enables her to meet their needs.

Sylvia has recently became a member of PMPC, Kiva's field partner. She is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her rice fields. She hopes to develop the farm and continue to put bread on the table in their home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her rice fields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land to expand his farming activities.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 64 years old and he supports seven family members. He has been practicing knitting for the past 18 years and earns 11,000 KES per month.

Charles has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy second-hand clothes for sale in his business. 

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand his current business.

 His future hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for sale in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Korotoumou's Group

texts.fr: Korotoumou qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, tenant deux pochettes, est membre d’un groupe de 17 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Banantoumou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Korotoumou, âgée de 55 ans, est la mère de 11 enfants âgés de 10 à 38 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. Elle a expliqué que, "l'agriculture est notre source de vie." L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Korotoumou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Korotoumou cultive l'arachide, le riz, sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Korotoumou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison des semences de qualité et des engrais de qualité. Cette année Korotoumou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 50 ans que Korotoumou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Korotoumou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Korotoumou espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Korotoumou, who is in the center of the photo holding two booklets, is a member of a group of 17 farmers registered with myAgro, living and working in the village of Banantoumou in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Korotoumou, aged 55, is the mother of 11 children aged between 10 and 38 years old, of whom two are presently in school. She explains that "agriculture is our source of life." 

Having a traditional foothold of the family in agriculture, principal source of income and food self-sufficiency for the household, caused Korotoumou to practice this activity for 50 years now. She cultivates peanuts and rice on her plot, but like any farmer, she has to deal with difficulties such as the lack of rain, of agricultural tools,  and of high-quality fertilizer. 

Korotoumou is just starting her first year with myAgro, and she registered because of the high quality seeds and fertilizer. This year she is making her payments to buy a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts, so as to increase her yield from her  0.0625 hectare plot. She has been growing peanuts for 50 years for their nutritive value. She explains that peanuts can be eaten as they are by the family and are also used as a base for sauces in cooking. With the expanded yield and the income it brings in, Korotoumou is planning to do small-scale commerce. Finally, she hopes to be able to ensure food self-sufficiency for her family as well as paying for her children's weddings.

loans.use: to acquire a package of OPV (openly pollinated) seeds and fertilizer for growing peanuts so as to expand the productivity of her plot of land

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Bonifacio and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations and to buy farm inputs. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Teresita knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. 

In the future, Teresita hopes to save more money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations and to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, who is in his late 30's, is single with no kids. He has been running a guest house business for six years now.  He does not have a particular time for his guests but does not accept visitors after 11 PM.  He is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Emmanuel's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to keep on maintaining  the guest house by laying tiles, painting the inside, and installing good beds. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  

He used the profit to take care of himself and his loan repayment and to cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to  renovate his guest house by painting the outside and hanging new curtains.  He dreams of putting up to date air condition.

Emmanuel will make sure he pays back his loan at the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to renovate his guest house by painting the outside and hanging new curtains.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is hardworking and never tires of contributing to the support of her family, especially her grandchildren. She makes and sells rice cakes prepared from her own recipe. Business is good, and she continues to spend time perfecting her rice cake recipe.

Tomasa is taking out another 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner PMPC to buy additional ingredients for her rice cakes. With extra ingredients she will be able to serve more customers and accept additional orders.

Tomasa prays that her business will continue to grow. She is working on another snack recipe to increase sales and so benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her rice cakes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase improved, modern farm tools and equipment for improving her farming activity so as to get a better harvest to sell to clients and for family use.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus 40 years old and supports a family of four members. He has been a small-scale farmer for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 13,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and to expand his farming activity. His future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 66 years old, married to Mary and supports a family of four members. 

He has been a retailer selling home products like sugar, salt, soap and other basic necessities, a business he has been doing for the last 10 years earning an income of KES 8,500 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy additional retail home products like sugar, cooking flour, detergent and bread.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and improve his family's health care. 

His future hope is to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional retail home products like sugar, cooking flour, detergent and bread

loans.name: Micheal Talle

texts.en: Micheal Talle is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Mayere Dutse Village. Micheal Talle joined Babban Gona to grow his agricultural business and support his family. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Micheal Talle will have access to the top of the range of farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the average Nigerian farmer's yield. This year, Micheal Talle is very optimistic and aims to harvest 50 bags of maize/hectare. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Michael Talle no longer has to worry about lacking income to pay for his children's school fees and can now ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs fertilisers that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Twenty-seven-year-old Anima is a housewife. She lives at Rabindranagar, a small village in Alipurduar district. Her husband, Subhas, aged 29 years, has a carpentry business that is the only source of income for the family of four. Her sons are students.  

Many years ago, Anima's husband started his carpentry business. He makes beautiful pieces of art, usually furniture for the home. He works 10-12 hours each day. Gradually he is getting recognized in the village for the quality of his work. The customers are impressed by the durability of his furniture and are recommending him to their friends in the area. But his income is scanty to bear all the expenses of the family. He wants to expand his work. Anima wants to help her husband.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase raw materials, basically wood and some necessary tools, for her husband. With the loan, he will be able to have the necessary resources and materials to make pieces of furniture according to the orders he gets. 

Anima dreams of getting ahead and progressing with her family, improving their quality of life and providing better education to her children, but everything depends on the evolution of the business.

Anima is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the carpentry business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is from Oroquieta City, Philippines. She is a widow and has five adult-age children. 

Lucia joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. The co-op supported her by providing the capital to start her retailing business, helping the family survive. Fortunately, she makes promising sales every day and is able to save from it. Lucia keeps on running the business well, to continuously provide for her needs. She believes that having her family as her inspiration, she will keep going and sustain the business. 

Lucia wishes to have safe and comfortable living quarters, with a house constructed with a durable ceiling and walls. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy construction materials for the renovation of her house, like bags of cement and loads of sand and gravel. 

Lucia wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for the renovation of her house, like bags of cement and loads of sand and gravel

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz is 43 year old, married and the father of two kids. Parviz lives with his family in the Agdash region. He is a farmer. Parviz keeps a small cow, raises it, fattens it and then sells the milk. He loves his job very much. Parviz takes care of his cow properly. He wants to build a stall for his cow and keep it there properly. He applied for a 500 AZN loan in order to repair the old cow stall and install a new water pipe. He wants to earn money for his family and provide for them, to keep them well and happy. Please support him.

loans.use: to repair the old cow stall and install a new water pipe

loans.name: Wenediza

texts.en:
Wenediza has been raising hogs for four years now. She is a married woman with 12 dependents. Her youngest child is 20 years old. She lives in San Miguel, Bohol. She needs additional funds for her hog raising business.

She has requested a loan to buy additional piglets. This will improve the quantity of pigs she would be able to raise. In this way, she will be able to augment her earnings and start to do some expansion. She can now start to handle her finances.

She is grateful for the loan she availed, and with that, she is doing her best to successfully handle her livelihood to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 68 years old, supports a family of four members. 

He has been practicing small-scale farming for the last seven years, earning an income of KES 9,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to improve his farming through adoption of modern farming techniques to boost his productivity. 

His plans are to use the anticipated profits to expand his farming activity, as well starting a stable retail business. 

His future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to improve his farming through adoption of modern farming techniques to boost his productivity.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 27 years old and he supports a family of three members. 

He has been practicing small scale farming for the last ten years earning an income of KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

His plans are to use the anticipated profits to educate his children as well as expanding his farming activity. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To improve his farming through adoption of modern farming techniques to boost productivity.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 40 years old and he supports a family with four members. For the last five years, he has been a poultry farmer who earns a monthly income of 5,500 KES. 

Evans is requesting a 25,000 KES loan from VisionFund Kenya to add stock of poultry.

This will be his first loan. Evans will use the profit from his loan to repay his debt and improve his family’s health care. 

His hope is to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: to add stock of poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is a single mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years, her potential customers mostly being ladies. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of hair drier machines for her beauty salon business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of hair drier machines for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina believes that no matter how hard something is, it can be done. Born in 1982 in the Copperbelt Province, Angelina is a nurse who lives in Lusaka. She is a mother of two and runs her own mobile money transfer business to help support her family.

Angelina would like to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders for their support. This is Angelina’s third loan. She requested her first loan back in 2013 to increase the funds that she uses to serve her customers. She has since repaid this loan in full. She accessed her second loan in order to purchase a trading booth. She is making good repayments on this loan.

In the last two years, Angelina has expanded her business and opened more Zoona mobile money transfer outlets. She now operates a total of nine outlets and is happy with this growth.

The biggest challenge facing Angelina’s business is that she does not have enough money for all her nine outlets to provide the best service. She needs additional float so that she does not have to turn away customers at any of her nine locations. She is hopeful that this loan will help her to increase her float levels so that she can provide a better service to her customers.

She intends to reinvest most of the profits in her business so she can continue to grow her float levels and build a good cash-float in her outlets.

loans.use: to serve more people who need to send and receive money by increasing the money that she uses to serve customers.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is a hard-working person, aged 49, who is a resident of Rwebikona. His plantation is in Nyakayojo, Mbarara. He grew up in a family of many children. His father was a good farmer in the area, who educated his children using income from agriculture. Then this man tried to do his father's job, although he is an army officer. He gets a good income from matooke (green plantain) sales, but it's not yet enough, though he has been taking loans from Ugafode to modify the agriculture. This time around is requesting a loan of UGX 2,500,000 for expansion of his farmland through hire of laborers.  He will also buy organic fertilizers to improve yields. He is limited by the income at times but is no longer afraid because he believes with continuous financial support this will be a challenge of the past. He is hard-working and innovative.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Cabidilahi Nour

texts.en:
Cabidlahi is 20 years old and lives in Hargeisa. He is single and studies at Gollis University. Cabdilahi has a small grocery which he started in 2014.
Cabdilahi works at his grocery and studies at University. He uses his income-generating activity to pay the University fees and for his books.

Now Cabdilahi wants to expand his grocery and has requested a loan of $600 from Kaaba MFI. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables and will help to generate greater profits and increase his working capital. In the future, he will be able to expand his grocery.

loans.use: to expand his grocery to increase his income

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: A 33 ans, Afi est une femme mariée et avec ses trois enfants. Afi vit dans le quartier d’Adamavo. Afi est une marchande de bijoux et des boucles d’oreille en se promenant dans les rues de son quartier afin de bien vendre. Afi s’approvisionne une fois par mois dans un marché local. Afi nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des boucles d’oreille, des chaines et des bagues afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Afi is 33 years old, married, and she has three children.  She lives in the Adamavo neighborhood.  Afi works as an itinerant seller in the streets of her neighborhood and she tries to sell as much jewelry and as many earrings as she can.  She buys her merchandise once a month at a local market.  She needs this loan to buy earrings, chains and rings, and to make a profit and take care of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seven dozen earrings, two dozen chains and six rings.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is a hardworking father from Oroquieta.  He has a small coconut farm and also engages in making copra (dried coconut meat used to extract coconut oil), for which he buys whole coconuts.

Domingo has signed up for membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. He applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra, and to pay for the materials in the reconstruction of his coconut dryer.

Domingo hopes to succeed in this business in order to continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts for making copra, and to pay for the materials in the reconstruction of his coconut dryer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, who is 41 years old, owns a bar where he mainly sells Waragi, a local brew, in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married with seven children including dependents, of whom four are attending school. He does farming to supplement his income and has been in business since 2005. 

He will use the loan to buy more Waragi (local brew) to sell. He has a vision of having a well-stocked bar so that he can keep in business and earn more profits, though he is met with the difficulty of a poor transport network hindering his service delivery.

loans.use: to buy more Waragi (local brew) to sell.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Saidu.  He is married and has 2 children aged 8 and 6yrs. He has one additional dependent, her nephew who live with him because of the present state of the country. In 2001, Saidu established his carpentry workshop business. He began his business because he was trained in wood work and he decided to set up his own workshop to be self-reliant. His business is located on the outskirts of the city and his main customers are men and women. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL1000000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5000000. He now requires a new loan in order to buy more materials like sanding sealer, clear leaf board, foam, chair materials for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him to increase his stock level. In the future, Saidu plans to build a bigger factory and employed more workers. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more materials like sanding sealer, clear leaf board to expand his business

loans.name: Flavio Ramon

texts.es:
Flavio tiene 28 años de edad y vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua, con su esposa y sus dos hijos. En su pequeña finca ha logrado producir hasta 175 quintales de café en los últimos ciclos, el cual maneja bajo los criterios de certificación comercio justo. 

Este joven no pudo concluir los estudios de primaria, pero su sueño es que sus hijos puedan llegar a tener estudios técnicos que puedan aplicar en su finca para aprovechar los recursos con los que cuentan.

Para este ciclo, él se ha propuesto incrementar los ingresos que obtiene por la producción de café, y para esto solicita un financiamiento que le permita asegurar la compra y aplicación de insumos que requiere su plantación para lograr una buena cosecha. Te invitamos a colaborar en la construcción del sueño de este joven emprendedor.
texts.en:
Flavio is 28 years old and lives in a rural community in the north of Nicarague with his wife and their two children. On his small farm, he's been able to produce 175 quintals of coffee in the last cycles. He maintains his field under fair trade standards.

This young man wasn't able to finish primary school, but his dream is that his children are able to have technical schooling they'll be able to apply on his farm to leverage the resources at their disposal.

For this cycle, he's proposed increasing the income he earns through coffee production, and seeks a loan for this. This will allow him to secure the purchase and application of inputs that his plantation requires to achieve a good crop. 

We invite you to join in building the dream of this young entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy the inputs his coffee field needs and ensure a good crop.

loans.name: Muthio

texts.en:
Muthio is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Muthio operates a grocery stall at the market, selling vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. A challenge that she faces is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Sogona's Group

texts.fr: Sogona qui se trouve sur la photo etant le plus long avec un echarpe blanc a gauche, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivent et travaillent dans le village de Niaganabougou au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Sogona, âgée de 58 ans, est la mère de 17 enfants âgés de 15 ans, dont 10 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Sogona à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Sogona cultive l'arachide, le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et de terres cultivables. Sogona entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Sogona effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 25 ans que Sogona cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Sogona planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de diversifier ses cultures comme et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Sogona espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Sogona, who is the tall woman with the white scarf on the left, is a member of a group of seven farmers registered with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Niaganabougou in the southwest of Bamako, Mali. Sogona, aged 58, is the mother of 17 children, of whom 10 are presently enrolled in school. The anchor of family tradition lies in agriculture, principal source of income and of food self-sufficiency for the household; agriculture also can provide self-sufficiency for her family and this moved Sogona to work in this domain for thirty years now. 

Sogona grows peanuts and maize on her plot of land but as a farmer she has to cope with difficulties such as a lack of rain, of agricultural tools, and of arable land. Sogona is beginning her first year with myAgro and joined because of the system of payment and the quality seeds, as well as the certainty of the myAgro agents concerning the profit this myAgro method will bring. 

This year Sogoa is making payments to buy a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer for growing maize so as to increase her yield on her plot of  0.125 hectare. Sogona has been growing peanuts for their commercial value for 25 years, since they are a foodstuff she can sell profitably at the market.  With the increase in her harvest and her income, Sogona plans to diversify her crops and be able to do small-scale commerce. Finally, she also hopes to cover school fees for her children and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy herself a package of OPV (openly pollinated) seed and fertilizer for growing maize

loans.name: Nezikokolima Taxi Drivers Group

texts.en:
Sam is a male Ugandan, aged 28, married with three children and a dependent. The children are in school. He is a taxi driver who works all the days of the week to maximize profit so that he can adequately meet his family financial obligations. His clients are passangers that move from the city centre to the city outskirts. 

He started the business when he got employed by a car owner because he needed a source of income. He has over the years saved and as a group, they are aquiring a loan to top to buy Sam a taxi.  

He believes he will be able to increase his income this way, since all the money will be his, unlike when he was paying a taxi owner. He is hard working and focused and appreciated UGAFODE and Kiva support.

loans.use: To buy a taxi for transport purposes.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 60 years old, married, and has a snack vending business in Oroquieta. This is how she supports her family with a meagre income of PHP 3,000 per month.

Recently, Natividad availed herself of a loan to purchase roof sheets, plywood and sticks, and to pay for coco lumber. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase roofing sheets, plywood and sticks, and to pay for coco lumber

loans.name: Casmil

texts.en:
Casmil, 42 years old, is married to Grace and supports a family of four family members. 

He has been in small scale farming for the last 12 years, earning an income of KES 12,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for farming as well as increase stock of animal feeds.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His hope is to gain a relatively higher income regularly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for farming as well as increase stock of animal feeds

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, a widow, has a coconut farm in Aloran and makes good earnings every quarter doing this type of work. This is the primary source of income for her family since she has become widowed.

Emelia makes it a point to prepare the land well for planting more dwarf coconut seedlings and bananas on her farm. This preparation gives her the maximum yield and generates a good income.

Recently, she needed an amount to pay for "holing" the soil and planting the seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Emelia wishes to sustain her business and to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for "holing" the soil and planting the seedlings

loans.name: Pepe Sr.

texts.en:
Pepe Sr. works raising swine in Oroquieta, in the Philippines. This is how he makes a living and supports his family. His lowest point was when he didn't have enough capital for his business. When he joined PMPC, he was truly grateful to access credit to support his business.

He takes his PMPC membership as seriously as he does his hog-raising business. He wants to maintain his membership in good standing so that he can always be eligible for any financing needs.

Pepe Sr. is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for his pigs. His loan will also help him build a concrete pig pen to improve sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is married and lives in Oroquieta. He owns and operates a sari-sari (convenience) store.

Jose has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. He learned about Paglaum MPC and applied for his membership so he could gain access to financial services and insurances.

Jose is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase grocery items to add to his store's inventory and as working capital. He plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to add to his store's inventory, and as working capital

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
This marks Dennis' fourth borrowing to purchase a third motorcycle. 

He repaid his previous loan well, the business is doing well and he currently has employed two people to help him run his business.

He hopes to own several motorbikes in the future.

loans.use: to purchase his third motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming and raise more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize grains for sale to here clients and meet their demands in food supply and to help educate her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to help with pay for her children's education

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 42-year-old, widow and a mother of five children, three of which are going to school, and are currently staying at Mpererwe- a city outskirt. She is a third time borrower hoping to secure a loan of UGX 2,000,000. She intends to use this loan to add stock to her retail business.

Christine operates a retail shop, and she has also started a cosmetics shop for her daughter, who dropped out of school due to lack of school fees.  Her future plan is to expand these two businesses, such that they are in a position to pay school fees for her three school going children.
 
She greatly appreciates the efforts of the funders, especially for supporting single mothers working hard to better the futures of their families. Pictured is Christine with the UGAFODE officer in charge of her loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete her residential house.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila is a 58-year-old married woman and she has 3 kids. She is a hardworking woman and is living in the area where agriculture is the most common business to do.

Nazila has land where she plants berries and sells the harvest in the domestic market. The last harvest was good, but the earned money from this was not enough for her family's needs. 

She decided to process her land now and plant vegetables like onions. She appealed to Aqroinvest and asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to process her land and then to plant vegetables. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to process her land

loans.name: Muhlisa

texts.en:
Muhlisa is a determined woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in a small city with her family. She is a teacher at a secondary school and teaches math with physics. Additionally, for having a higher education, she studies part time at university. She has one child which she takes care of well. 

She and her husband are planning to install plastic windows and doors. She asks a loan from KIVA and IMON to buy and install plastic windows and doors. She awaits KIVA lenders kindness.

loans.use: to buy and install plastic windows and doors

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is 61 years of age and married. She has three children, who are all married. She manages planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables on her own land. Madina has been involved in farming for 17 years. She is the only breadwinner of the family. To meet her family's everyday needs, she is working every day. Her husband and elder son assist her greatly in her horticultural activities. 

To be able to continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Madina again needs a loan of 1100 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She and her family are very thankful to all the lenders for helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to help again sustain her family business

loans.name: Shiela Marie

texts.en:
Shiela Marie is single and started her own small grocery business, which has become profitable, helping to support her parents and family. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls her capital back into the business to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales since she has good salesmanship skills and effort.

Recently she approached Paglaum for some much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 37 years old, married to Caroline and he supports four family members. He has been a dairy farmer for the last eight years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk supply to clients and meet their needs and those of his family after milk sales. 

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for increased milk supply to clients and meet their needs and those of his family after milk sales.

loans.name: Manita

texts.en:
Manita is managing her small eatery business in Talairon, Oroquieta, Philippines. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well, supporting the needs of the family. Manita has local customers and also accepts orders for additional income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to be able to open a new business space for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase improvised modern farm tools and equipment for improving her farming activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds for farming in the area, which will help her to educate her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm tools and farm inputs for a better harvest so as to meet customer and family demands.  She wishes to educate her children

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is aged 47 and happily married with one wife and four children aged 16, 13, 10 and 7. He has no other dependents and all his children are in school. He borrowing UGX 2,000,000 and has been borrowing from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd for over 4 years. He is principally a farmer and mainly does coffee farming and has a banana plantation. He works for 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. He also has a side income of retail trade. He started the business in order to generate income for his family household. The loan purpose is to buy farm inputs such as organic fertilizers and mulches for his plantations.

Most of his clients are the local community in Mitooma District. He started business in 1991. He hopes to own large plantations of coffee and bananas and produce more for sale. He is always faced with challenges of price fluctuations, banana bacterial wilt and high prices for agricultural inputs.  He is a hard working and resilient person.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like organic fertilizers to boost yields.

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr: Fanta qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, portant un t-shirt rouge , est membre d’un groupe de 15 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivent et travaillent dans le village de Niaganabougou au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Fanta, âgée de 46 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 22 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L'amour de l'agriculture a incité Fanta à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 8 ans. Fanta cultive l'arachide, le mil, le niebe sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Fanta entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des formations et techniques agricoles, ainsi que de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Fanta effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 5 ans que Fanta cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Fanta planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée . Enfin Fanta espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la familleainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Fanta, who is in the middle in the photo, wearing a red top,  is a member of a group of 15 farmers registered with myAgro, living and working in the village of Niaganabougou in the southwest of Bamako, Mali. Fanta, aged 46, is the mother of six children, of whom none is presently enrolled in school. The love of agriculture has moved Fanta to work in this field for eight years now. She grows peanuts, millet, and niebe on her plot of land, but like every farmer, she must face difficulties such as the lack of rain, of agricultural tools, and of quality fertilizer. 

Fanta is beginning her first year with myAgro and joined because of the payment system and the training and agricultural techniques, as well as from the perspective of increasing her yield through the services proposed by myAgro. This year, Fanta is making payments to purchase a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts so as to expand the yield of her plot of 0.0625 hectare. 

Fanta has been growing peanuts for five years now for their commercial value, since peanuts are a foodstuff she can sell at the market. With the increase in her yield and income, Fanta plans to expand her cultivated surface. Finally, Fanta would also like to build a house for the family as well as ensuring food self-sufficiency for the family.

loans.use: to acquire an OPV seed and fertilizer package to expand the agricultural productivity of her plot of land.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 30-year-old married woman from a village near Ramallah city. She lives with her husband and five kids; four sons and one daughter. The family wants to open their own business which is a grocery store in the village. this will improve their living conditions.

Iman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to start the family business and buy grocery products. This will increase their income and they can buy all the needed stocks.
 
Iman appears in the photo in the family new grocery store

loans.use: to start the family business and buy grocery products to stock their new store

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 27 years old and he supports a family of five members. He has been a farmer for the last three years and earns KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase improved modern farm tools and equipment for improving his farming activity so as to get a better harvest for sale to clients and for family use. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his agricultural business. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase improved modern farm tools and equipment for improving his farming activity so as to get a better harvest for sale to clients and for family use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize cereal to sell to clients.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 32 years old and supports a family of four members. 

He has been selling shoes to clients in the market for the last three years and earns KES 15,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more shoes and sandals to sell in the market and meet the demand of clients. 

Albert plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his business. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and sandals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk supply

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.en: Musharaf is a bright woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is living in a small town with her family. She is a widow and has one child. Two years ago when her husband died, she began working to support her child. Musharaf works at a medical clinic as a cleaner. Last year, her salary was 300 TJS and it increased this year to 440 TJS. She is living with her mother, who is a pensioner, in a house she is planning to repair. She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to repair her house. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 41 years old, married to Everlyne and supports a family of four members.

He has been a small-scale farmer for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 13,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.
He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and expand his farming activity. 

His future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase improvised modern farm tools and equipment for improving her farming activity so as to get better harvest for sale to clients and family use.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman; she has one child who is still too young to attend school. Mwanamisi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food .
Mwanamisi has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase two sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a tea grower aged 42 years and married with four children, 15, 13, 11, and 9, all schooling. He is a long-time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance and currently is taking a loan of UGX 2,000,000. He started tea growing in 2005 and he supplements it with other agricultural activities such as banana plantations. He works six days a week for 8 hours per day. His business is located in the rural area of Ishaka Bushenyi district and serves people from the neighbouring community. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy fertilizers and mulch for his tea and banana plantations. He is aiming at achieving his dream of being the leading tea farmer in Mashonga Kyamuhunga in Bushenyi District since he anticipates increased yields.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for his tea crop

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a business for the past 10 years, selling food to the neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence goods spoiling and leading to losses.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married mother of one child who is still too young to attend school. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is household consumables.

For over three years she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase potatoes, flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Gninedje's Group

texts.fr: Gninedje qui se trouve sur la photo portant le polo blanc, est membre d’un groupe de 3 agricultrices inscrites à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bokoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Gninedje, âgée de 56 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 3 à 24 ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Gninedje à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Gninedje cultive l'arachide, le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Gninedje entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Gninedje effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Gninedje cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Gninedje planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage. Enfin Gninedje espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Gninedje, who is wearing the white shirt in the photo, is a member of a group of three women farmers enrolled with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Bokoro, southeast of Bamako in Mali. Gninedje is 56 years old and the mother of seven children between the ages of three and 24, four of whom are currently attending school.

The rooting of her family tradition in farming, the household's primary source of income and independent subsistence, has encouraged Gninedje to take part in this business for 40 years now, as well as the independence farming ensures for her family. Gninedje grows ground nuts and corn on her plot of land and, as a farmer, must face challenges such as a lack of rain, farming equipment, and good fertilizer.

Gninedje is beginning her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment plan and quality seeds, as well as the good fertilizer. This year, Gninedje is making payments to purchase a package of myAgro OPV [open-pollinated variety] seeds and fertilizer for her ground nut crop in order to increase crop yields on her .0625 hectare plot of land.

Gninedje has been growing ground nuts for 20 years because of their commercial value; ground nuts are a food that she sells in the market for its profitability. With the increase in her crop yields and her income, Gninedje is planning to raise livestock. She hopes to also be able to cover the school fees of her children, as well as build a house for the family.

loans.use: To obtain a package of OPV [open-pollinated variety] seeds and fertilizer to grow ground nuts.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
43-year-old Gita lives with her husband and son at Alipurduar of West Bengal, India. She and her husband have primary education and her only son studying for a B.A. 1st (Bachelor of Arts). Gita wants to see her son in a respectable position with a good education, thus she always provides every support to her son. 

Jointly with her husband, Gita runs a grocery store. She sells general grocery items like rice, salt, sugar, oil, lentils, biscuits, chocolates, soft drinks, etc. Gita wants to expand her business and buy more items for her store so that she can attract more customers and generate more income for her family. But Gita does not have sufficient capital to invest in her business. 

Thus she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to increase her business. She will use the loan to buy more stock for her grocery shop. She hopes this loan will give a lift to her business as well as her income. Gita is dedicated to making her business successful and providing financial sustenance to her family. She thanks her lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more stock for grocery store.

loans.name: Chaleya

texts.en:
40-year-old Chaleya is a homemaker. Her family consists of three members; herself, her husband and their only son. They could not provide much education to their only son due to their poor financial condition, so he now works as a mason. They live in Boro Sholmari village in Falakata of West Bengal.

At present Chaleya's husband deals in a cow dung manure business. Cow dung is used as farm manure by the cultivators in their village. He does not have any cow, so he purchases cow dung in bulk from village cow owners. He then stores the cow dung in a pit into the ground for avoiding any damage or loss. Then he supplies this to his customers as per their demand. Chaleya also assists her husband in this business. 

According to Chaleya, in the context of the present market situation, the income from the business is hand-to-mouth for her family, so it is very difficult to think of future development. Although there is potential market for her husband's business, finance is a hindrance for them. After the intervention of BJS (Kiva’s partner) in her village, Chaleya saw a ray of hope and she applied for a loan for the development of the business. From the present loan, she has planned to purchase more cow dung to expand the existing business. She hopes this will help her to generate more income to materialize her dream of a better lifestyle for her family.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase cow dung in bulk for her farm manure business.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a farmer who is married and has five children. The family lives in a seven-bedroom house in Bamenda in North-West Region of Cameroon. She has faced many difficulties in life, including the sickness and death of her daughter that was killed by armed robbers.

Doris wants to increase her farm’s profitability so she can better care for her family. She is applying for a 200,000 XAF loan through Kiva’s field partner GHAPE to buy yam seedlings, piglets, chickens and feed. She feels positive about the likely success of this step because she has been farming for a long time. She also knows that her community will benefit from her venture, as it will provide food for her neighbors and manure for local gardeners.

With the profits from this loan Doris will further expand her farm, pay for her children's school fees and put some aside. She would also like to help her son open a workshop, provide medication for her family and build a house.

Doris prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals. She also appreciates that GHAPE members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy yam seedlings, piglets, chickens and feed.

loans.name: Susan Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia Susan  pertenece al banco comunal JUNTOS PODEMOS, la socia continua con el negocio de venta de accesorios de autopartes de autos, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo parabrisas, faros entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de parabrisas entre otros.
texts.en:
Susan belongs to the Juntos Podemos communal bank group. She continues with her business selling car parts and accessories. She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. She continues to sell windshields, headlights and more, and this is the way that she gets her family ahead. 

She asks for the loan to purchase windshields and more.

loans.use: to purchase windshields and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase mamalishe's stock and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of bean cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming through application of modern farming technology especially the use of green-house planting.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 23 years old and supports six family members.
