He has been a farmer for the last year, earning KES 12,000 per month. 

Benjamin has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizer to improve soil fertility, resulting in a better yield to sell in the market. Higher earnings would help his family.

He plans to use gained profits to repay the loan and expand his business. He hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to improve soil fertility, resulting in a better yield to sell in the market.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 25-year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has no children.   In 2010, Mohamed established his boutique (menswear) business. He began his business because he was trained up in business by his parents. With the experience gained, he decided to establish his own business.  His business is located on the outskirts of the city and his main customers are men and women. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Mohamed requires a new loan in order to buy more tshirts, lacoste polos, jeans, and men's underwear for resale. He hopes that this loan will help the business to grow and cater for more customers. In the future, Mohamed plans to become an international investor importing goods for wholesale, and build his own dwelling house. He thanks all Kiva lenders for their support. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more tshirts, lacoste polos, jeans,  and men's underwear for resale.

loans.name: Dhul Group

texts.en:
Sahra Ismail and Amina Aden are both 30 years old; they are not married. 

Sahra and Amina work together, they buy small pieces of land to resell and get profit. Amina, who is the right one is responsible buying and selling the land and she is leader of this small group.

She needs some loan funds to purchase land to increase her income generating activity. She requested from Kaaba a loan of $3,000. Each will get $1,500 and they really expect to expand their working capital to buy and sell larger pieces of land in the future. Selling a small piece of land in Hargeisa is profitable.

For the last two years, Amina and her partner Sahra used to buy and sell small pieces of land in Hargeisa, and getting a $3,000 loan from Kaaba MFI will definitely increase their ability to buy and sell land.

loans.use: to buy larger pieces of land to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbors and people at the marketplace. In addition, she  operates a water-selling business in the community. With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase a water tank for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for her business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia Sonia pertenece al banco comunal JUNTOS PODEMOS, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de artesanía, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua  elaborando botas típicas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cueros.
texts.en:
Sonia is part of the Juntos Podemos communal bank. She continues working in her craft business. She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. She continues making traditional boots. She is a responsible and diligent person, and this is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She asks for the loan to purchase leather.

loans.use: to purchase leather.

loans.name: Setou's Group

texts.fr: Setou qui se trouve sur la photo tenant le drapeau en main, est membre d’un groupe de 4 agricultrices inscritse à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Makana au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Setou, âgée de 40 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 8 à 20 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Setou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 32 ans. Setou cultive l'arachide,maïs sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Setou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Setou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 3 ans que Setou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Setou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage  et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Setou espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Setou, who is holding the flag in the photo, is a member of a group of four women farmers enrolled with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Makana, southeast of Bamako in Mali. Setou is 40 years old and the mother of eight children between the ages of eight and 20, two of whom are currently in school. 

The rooting of her family tradition in farming, the household's primary source of income and independent subsistence, has encouraged Setou to take part in this business for 32 years now, as well as the independence farming ensures for her family. Setou grows ground nuts and corn on her plot of land but, as a farmer, must face challenges such as a lack of rain, farming equipment, and good fertilizer.

Setou is beginning her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment plan and quality seeds, as well as the good fertilizer. This year, Setou is making payments to purchase a packet of myAgro OPV [open-pollinated variety] seeds and fertilizer to grow ground nuts, in order to increase crop yields on her .0625 hectare plot of land.

Setou has been growing ground nuts for their commercial value for three years now; ground nuts are a food that she sells in the market for their profitability. With the increase in her crop yields and her income, Setou is planning to raise livestock and to be able to do business. Setou also hopes to be able to cover the school fees of her children, as well as to ensure the independent subsistence of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a package of OPV [open-pollinated variety] seeds and fertilizer in order to increase the productivity of her plot of land.

loans.name: Nakathanthong Group

texts.en:
Thongsee is excited that the TerraClear filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

Thongsee and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. The water filter Thongsee and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. Thongsee and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease.

After totaling up the costs, Thongsee and her group recognized the substantial financial savings that the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Namarkkeua Group

texts.en:
Chanher is excited the filter is available on an affordable payment plan.  Chanher and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  

The water filter Chanher and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years, but is known to function for up to five years.  Chanher and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease, and after totaling up the costs, Chanher and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS MECEDES DE KATAÑIRAY, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Liz continua con el negocio de  confección de ropa deportiva, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, tijeras entre otros.
texts.en:
Liz is a member of the communal bank Las Mercedes de Katañiray.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.
Liz continues with her business making sports clothing. She is grateful for the loan she has been given and she is committed to paying off her current loans. She is a very responsible and diligent person, this is why she is can continue to support her family. She is asking for a loan to purchase fabric, thread, and scissors, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and scissors, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds for farming for more income gain.

loans.name: Salimata's Group

texts.fr: Salimata qui se trouve sur la photo tenant la pochete de n'gasene, est membre d’un groupe de 07 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui  vivent et travaillent dans le village de Bancoumana au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Salimata, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants, et dont l'un  d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Salimata à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 13 ans. Salimata cultive l'arachide, le riz, le maraichage, le niebe sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, d'engrais de qualité et de semences de qualité . Salimata entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des formations et techniques agricoles, ainsi que de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Salimata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Salimata cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Salimata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme et d'acheter du matériel agricole comme . Enfin Salimata espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Salimata, who is holding the N'ga Sènè packet in the photo, is a member of a group of seven farmers enrolled with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Bancoumana, southeast of Bamako in Mali. Salimata is 50 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom currently attends school.

The rooting of her family tradition in farming, the household's primary source of income and independent subsistence, has encouraged Gninedje to take part in this business for 13 years now, as well as the independence farming ensures for her family. Salimata grows ground nuts, rice, red kidney beans, and does market gardening on her plot of land but, as a farmer, must face challenges such as a lack of farming equipment, good fertilizer, and quality seeds.

Salimata is beginning her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment plan and training in farming techniques, as well as because of the conviction of the myAgro agents in regard to the advantages of the myAgro method. This year, Salimata is making payments to purchase a package of myAgro OPV [open-pollinated variety] seeds and fertilizer for her ground nut crop in order to increase crop yields on her .0625 hectare plot of land.

Salimata has been growing ground nuts for 20 years because of their food production value; ground nuts are directly consumable for the family and are used as a basic sauce in cooking. [She also grows ground nuts for] their commercial value, as ground nuts are a food she sells in the market. With the increase in her crop yields and her income, Salimata is planning to raise livestock and to purchase farming equipment. She hopes to also be able to cover the school fees of her children, as well as build a house for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a package of OPV [open-pollinated variety] seeds and fertilizer in order to grow ground nuts.

loans.name: Salimata's Group

texts.fr: Salimata qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang au centre, portant un foulard blanc et la pochete de n'gasene, est membre d’un groupe de 16 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Siby au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Salimata, âgée de 58 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 23 à 36 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage  de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Salimata à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 43 ans. Salimata cultive l'arachide, le sorgho, le riz  sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, d'engrais de qualité et d'herbicides. Salimata entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des engrais de qualité, ainsi que de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Salimata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 43 ans que Salimata cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Salimata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce et d'acheter du matériel agricole comme . Enfin Salimata espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Salimata, who is in the center of the second row in the photo, wearing a white scarf and holding a N'ga Sènè packet, is a member of a group of 16 farmers enrolled in myAgro. They live and work in the village of Siby, southeast of Bamako in Mali. Salimata is 58 years old and the mother of eight children between the ages of 23 and 36, two of whom currently attend school.

The rooting of her family tradition in farming, the household's primary source of income and independent subsistence, as well as a love of farming, have encouraged Salimata to take part in this business for 43 years now. Salimata grows ground nuts, sorghum, and rice on her plot of land but, as a farmer, must face challenges such as a lack of farming equipment, good fertilizer, and herbicide.

Salimata is beginning her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment plan and quality fertilizer, as well as the conviction of the myAgro agents on the advantages of the myAgro method. This year, Salimata is making payments to purchase a package of myAgro OPV [open-pollinated variety] seeds and fertilizer for her ground nut crop in order to increase crop yields on her .125 hectare plot of land.

Salimata has been growing ground nuts for 43 years for their food production value [because] ground nuts are directly consumable by the family and are used as a basic sauce in cooking. [She also sells ground nuts] because of their commercial value; ground nuts are a food that she sells in the market. With the increase in her crop yields and her income, Salimata is planning to participate in business and to purchase farm equipment. She hopes to also be able to cover the school fees of her children, as well as to ensure her family's independent subsistence.

loans.use: To purchase a package of OPV [open-pollinated variety] seeds and fertilizer to grow ground nuts in order to increase the productivity of her plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac who is 36 years old, is married to Jescah and supports a family of four members.

Isaac has been operating a phone accessories business for the last nine years earning an income of KES 13,000 per month. 

Isaac has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to add to his stock and raise his income to improve his family's living standards.

Isaac plans are to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and stabilize his business activity. 

His future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to add to his stock and raise more income to improve his family's living standards.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a married mother of two kids, who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry farming business, which earns her another source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbors. Her major challenge is high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Nabiyahon

texts.en:
Nabiyahon is a wise woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into a family of farmers. She is a widow and has one child. 

Nabiyahon is a nurse in a medical clinic. However, her husband practiced agriculture. After her husband’s death, he left her farmland to also practice agriculture. 

For three years now, Nabiyahon has been running a farming business, growing agricultural products. Each season she yields a good harvest which she sells in the domestic market. 

For the coming season Nabiyahon has appealed to IMON International and requested help to buy fertilizer and seeds. She hopes to have another good harvest and be able to continue to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Rosa Pascuala

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Rosa; la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de repuestos de segunda motorizados (carros y accesorios), la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de accesorios entre otros.
texts.en:
This member is Rosa; she continues running her business selling motorized second-hand spare parts (cars and accessories). This member is very grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments. She is a responsible and dedicated person and being this way is how she is able to move her family forward.

This member is requesting a loan to buy accessories, among others.

loans.use: buy accessories, among others.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a mother of seven children, and she is at the age of 52. To earn a living she engages in a firewood buy-and-sell business. She wants to give her children a good life, so she aims for a better income, and to have this she must increase her income. 

So she decided to take a loan to buy more wood to sell, so that she can sell it to the market, to have more sales to generate more income. Evelyn’s plan for the future is to save money out from her business.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 41 years old and she supports a family of eight members. She has been a dairy farmer for the last seven years and earns KES 12,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, so as to increase the number of liters of milk supplied to clients. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to educate her children to higher levels of education. Her hope is to be financially stable and start a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of vegetables and tomatoes

loans.name: Francisco Cristino

texts.es:
Francisco es un productor de una comunidad de Jinotega, que aún con pocos recursos logró concluir sus estudios de primaria. Con su esposa tiene 2 hijos, los cuales dice son su fuente de inspiración para trabajar cada día con la esperanza de darles mejores oportunidades que las que él ha tenido.

Para este año, Francisco está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los insumos agrícolas que requieren su cafetal y lograr una mayor cosecha en este ciclo. El está seguro, que dando el mantenimiento adecuado a su plantación podrá tener mejores resultados productivos y mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is a producer in a community in Jinotega, who was able to finish elementary school despite the lack of means. He is married and has two children, who are his inspiration to work every day with the hope of giving them better opportunities than he has been given.

For this year, Francisco is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies to use on his coffee crops to achieve a good harvest this cycle. He is sure that by providing his crops with the proper maintenance, he will achieve better productive results and more income for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies that he will use on his coffee crops to achieve a good harvest.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lucila; la socia continua con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo  diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de gaseosas, arroz, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
This member is part of the communal bank "COMUZONE III”; The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

This member is Lucila; she continues to run her grocery-store business. She is very grateful for the loan and promise sto pay her installments. The member continues to sell different types of products, like rice, sugar and milk, among others, as this is the way she can move her family forward.

This member is requesting a loan to buy soda, rice and sugar, among others.

loans.use: buy soda, rice and sugar, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for farming.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 57 years old, married, and supports a family of five members. He has been practicing farming for the last 25 year, earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Samson has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, to buy herbicides to spray for a high harvest and supply to gain more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to start a retail shop in the area. His future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy herbicides to spray for a high harvest and supply to gain more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Eliza

texts.ru: Элиза, 28 лет, не замужем, 2 детей дошкольного возраста. У нее среднее образование, она с 2010 года занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Элизы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 22 овцы и лошадь. На 1,50 Га земли она выращивает клевер, картофель и кукурузу. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнес деятельности Элизы составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, Элиза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и реализации. Она является участником группы "Элиза", в которой состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита позволят Элизе развить ее бизнес, улучшить благосостояние семьи и купить земельный участок.
texts.en: Eliza is 28 years old, single, and she has two children of preschool age.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture since 2010.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has two cows, 22 sheep and one horse on her farm.  She cultivates clover, potatoes and corn on 1.5 hectares of land.  Thanks to her activity and business, she makes a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS), but this amount of money is not enough for a decent life.  Eliza has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy a few calves for fattening and resale.  She is a member of the "Eliza" group which comprises another two members.  The earnings from her loan will help Eliza to grow her business, to improve her family's well-being and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy some calves for fattening and resale in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 28 years old. He lives with his family in Batumi district. 

Giorgi works at a local supermarket and gets a small monthly income. Giorgi owns another flat in Batumi, which needs to be renovated so he will be able to rent it out. 

The Startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 USD. With the received credit, he will renovate the flat and rent it out seasonally to earn additional income.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out seasonally

loans.name: Satkyn

texts.ru: Саткын 51 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Дополнительным источником дохода является-сельское хозяйство, Саткын более 12 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Саткын трудолюбивая, благодаря ее трудолюбию, ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее упорству она достигла хороших результатов и на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: 2 лошади, 2 коровы с телятами, 20 овец. На 2,50 ГА земли выращивает фасоль для реализации. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Саткын обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Саткын планирует направить на увеличение орошаемых земель.
texts.en: Satkyn is 51 years old, married, and she has three children.  Farming provides an additional source of income for her family; Satkyn has been involved in animal husbandry and crop farming for more than 12 years, having started in this business with 10,000 som (KGS).  Satkyn is hardworking and, thanks to her dedication to her work, she makes a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her determination, she has achieved good results and she currently has two horses, two cows with calves, and twenty sheep on her farm.  She also grows beans for resale on 2.5 hectares of land.  In order to increase her livestock headcount, Satkyn has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow for fattening and resale.  Satkyn is planning to use the earnings from her loan to increase the size of her irrigated land.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Tupazhon

texts.en:
Tupazhon is a hardworking woman. She was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1969. She is living in beautiful, scenic nature town with her family. She is married and has a daughter. She has many years of experience doing business in agriculture. 

In order to continue her business, she appealed to IMON asking for support to buy fertilizer and seeds. She has permanent clients every day in a domestic market and at the land. She is planting agricultural products like vegetables. She hopes to have a good harvest for the next season. She awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Oswal Jhoel

texts.es:
Oswal es un joven muy trabajador, vive actualmente con sus padres en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, una ciudad muy conocida porque existe mucho intercambio comercial ya que es el puente terrestre que une a la sierra con la costa.
Oswal desde que terminó sus estudios comenzó a trabajar, ahora se dedica a la venta de  productos a créditos en una empresa de la ciudad, trabaja desde temprano hasta las cuatro de la tarde. Oswal tiene planificado comenzar a generar ingresos propios, su sueño es criar pollos para empezar en la rama de los negocios, comenta que anteriormente su madre se dedicaba a esta actividad y gracias a esos ingresos ella pudo darles la educación, ahora él quiere seguir, por ello acudió a la Fundación ya que es la única institución que ayuda a personas emprendedoras. Con el crédito el podrá comprar pollitos, balanceado y adecuar un pequeño galpón en su domicilio, tiene ya el espacio pero necesita arreglarlo. 
Oswal gracias a su experiencia en este tipo de negocios aspira que le va a ir muy bien y en un futuro será un buen microempresario, aspira crecer para dar oportunidad a más personas que trabajen con él.
Agradece a la institución y a las personas inversionistas de Kiva que aportan para que sus sueños se cumplan y sean alcanzables.
texts.en:
Oswal is a hard-working young man. Currently, he lives with his parents in the city of Santo Domingo, a city known for its commerce exchange as it's the land bridge that unites the mountains with the coast.

Since Oswal finished his studies, he started to work and now sells products by credit in a company in the city; he works from early morning to 4 in the afternoon. Oswal plans to generate his own income as his dream is to breed chicks, a way to start out in the world of commerce. He tells us that his mother previously worked in this activity and thanks to those earnings she could give them an education. Now, he wants to continue that work. He went to the Foundation as it is the only place that helps entrepreneurs. With the loan, he'll be able to buy chicks, feed and allot a small area in his house; he already has the space, he just needs to fix it up.

Thanks to Oswal's experience in that type of business, he thinks that it will all go well and in the future he'll be a good microempresario. He aspires to grow his business to give opportunities to others to work with him.

He is grateful to the institution and to the Kiva investors whose support helps him reach and realize his dreams.

loans.use: undertake his business breeding chicks in order to economically support his parents.

loans.name: Ruthiana

texts.en:
Ruthiana is a single mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transportation. She operates a food cafe. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase foodstuffs for her cafe. She decided to join Yehu to access a loan to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for her cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of coconuts, bananas and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She is engaged in a sari-sari store business to earn a living. She’s been in this business for four years already, and it has been an earning business for the family.  She can earn PHP 2,000 a month and that helps them with their family’s daily needs. 

But she is still aiming to increase her income for her children’s educational needs, so she took a loan to buy additional goods to sell and be able to increase her store inventory to have more sales to generate more income. For the future, Susan wants to save money for her children’s education needs.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.ru:
Эту женщину зовут Савринисо. Она дома занимается шитьем национальной  женской одежды на заказ. Ей удобно шить на дому. Савринисо добрая и шустрая женщина, которая хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она научилась шить и кроить женскую одежду 4 года назад и по сей день продолжает свое любимое дело.
Савринисо в этом году исполнилось 47 лет. Савринисо проживает в городе Куляб с мужем, детьми и внукам. В швейном деле Савринисо нравится ежедневный доход и общение с новыми людьми. Она берет кредит, для купли швейные принадлежности, чтобы улучшить процесс работы, и привлечь больше клиентов.  Это кредит поможет ей улучшить и расширить деятельность.
texts.en:
This woman is Savriniso. She works in sewing made-to-order national costumes for women. It is convenient for her to sew at home. Savriniso is a kind and nimble woman who handles her work well. She learned to sew and cut women's clothes 4 years ago, and is continuing with her labours of love to this day.

Savriniso will be 47 years old this year. Savriniso lives in Kulyab city with her husband, her children, and her grandchildren. In her sewing business, Savriniso likes having a daily income as well as communicating with new people. She will be taking a loan to buy sewing supplies in order to improve her work process, and to appeal to more clients. This loan will help her to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies in order to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Zhamiila

texts.ru: Жамийла, 46 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Жамийлы средне-специальное образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1999 году, благодаря упорному труду Жамийлы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется корова, 30 овец, а на земельной доле мерою 1,0 Га арендованной и 1,52 Га собственной земли выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамийла обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Жамийла планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zhamiila is 46 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. Zhamiila has secondary special education. In search of supplementary income for her family, she works in animal husbandry and crop cultivation, having started this in 1999. Thanks to Zhamiila's hard work, today, her farm has cows, 30 sheep, and she cultivates beans on 1 hectare of rented land and 1.52 hectares of her own land.

In order to further develop her farm, Zhamiila has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 Som (KGS). This will allow her to buy 10 sheep. Zhamiila plans to invest the revenue from this loan in increasing the number of cattle she has.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep

loans.name: Nancy Cecilia

texts.es:
Nancy es una joven madre de 26 años, vive con su hijita en casa de sus padres. Nancy es muy trabajadora, ella trabajó varios años en un salón de belleza para sacar adelante a su pequeña, realizaba tintes, manicura y cortes; Ahora Nancy comenta que gracias a los años duros de trabajo ella pudo ahorrar sus ingresos, tiene un sueño, de poder tener su negocio propio.
Con los ahorros ella podrá comprar elementos necesarios para el negocio, pero aún le hace falta más capital para poder invertir y abrir su negocio de peluquería y salón de belleza. Con el crédito ella podrá comprar más sillas, vitrinas, tintes y esmaltes, comenta que ya tiene listo el local, ya lo adecuó y pintó para comenzar con su negocio.
Nancy está feliz por la ayuda brindada por todos quienes conforman Kiva, pudo comprar todo lo necesario y ya abrió su negocio, es una microempresaria agradecida, comenta que así podrá pasar más tiempo con su hija y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nancy is a young mother of 26 years. She lives with her little daughter in her parents house. Nancy is hard-working and worked many years in a beauty salon in order to get on in life with her daughter. She provided hair coloring, hair cuts and manicures. Now, Nancy comments that thanks to those years of hard work, she was able to save money; she has a dream: to own her own business.

With her savings, she'll be able to buy the necessary elements for her business, but still, she needs more capital to invest in order to open her hair- and beauty-salon business. With the loan, she'll be able to buy more chairs, showcases, hair color and nail polish. She tells us that she already has the locale ready, having accommodated and painted it.

Nancy is happy for the help provided by the Kiva lenders. With the loan, she'll be able to to buy all she needs and open her business. She is a very grateful microempresario and comments that she will be able to spend more time with her daughter and get on in life.

loans.use: buy chairs, showcases and beauty tools so she can start her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease more land to increase banana production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To lease more land to increase banana production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen is 30 years old, married to Wilfred and blessed with six children. She has been selling clothes for the last two years.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase stocks of clothes for sale in the market. She will earn more income which will enable her to provide for her family's needs.

Her future hopes are to expand her business, open a boutique, and be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of clothes for sale in the market and make more income, which will enable her to provide for her family's needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease more land to increase banana production.

loans.name: Zumratkhon

texts.ru: Зумратхон, 52 года, замужем, есть сын. У Зумратхон - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Зумратхон, на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 9,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зумратхон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота.  Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Zumratkhon is 52 years old and married with one son. Zumratkhon has a higher education, and earns an income for her family through animal husbandry, having started 25 years ago with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zumratkhon's persistent hard work, today she has: 2 cows. Her monthly income consists of around 9,800 som (KGS). For the purpose of the further expansion of her farm, Zumratkhon applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. With income from the loan, she plans to invest in increasing her quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for repairs to her house.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Yosimar De Jesus

texts.es:
A sus 26 años, Yosimar tiene mucha energía y empuje para trabajar en su negocio de venta de carne en el municipio de Sincelejo.
Vive en una humilde casa con su compañera sentimental y con sus 2 hijas (Ver Foto una de de ellas de 2 Años) a quienes enseña el valor de la familia.

Actualmente enfrenta problemas en su negocio como la escases de animales y el clima que afecta su crianza.

Esto intenta contrarrestarlo comprando mayor cantidad de animales y es precisamente ese el motivo por el cual solita un préstamo, pues desea comprar 3 vacas grandes y de esta forma consolidara su negocio para el futuro!
texts.en: At 26 years of age, Yosimar has a lot of energy and motivation to work in his business of selling meat at the municipality of Sincelejo. He lives in a humble house with his domestic partner and their 2 daughters (See on the photo the 2 year old one), whom he teaches the value of family. Currently, he is facing problems with his business, as is the lack of animals and the weather that affects their breeding. He is trying to go against this by buying more animals, and this is precisely why he is requesting a loan because he wants to buy three big cows in order to consolidate his business for the future.

loans.use: to buy 3 big cows in order to consolidate his business for the future.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина жительница города Душанбе. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей. Тахмина в городе живет вместе мамой, папой, мужем и детьми. Она обеспечивает семью, предоставляя услуги портнихи у себя дома. Она принимает заказы на шитье женской одежды. Тахмина этой деятельности занимается уже более 5 лет. Она опытная и серьезная женщина своей работе. В швейном деле ей нравится ежедневный доход, и познакомиться с новыми клиентами.  Тахмина обратилась за кредитом для купли новую швейную машинки, чтобы ускорить процесс работы и ежедневный доход. Это кредит поможет ей расширить деятельность.
texts.en: Tahmina is a resident of Dushanbe. She is 35 years old. She is married and has children. Tahmina lives in the city with her mother, father, husband and children. She provides for her family offering services as a dressmaker from home. She takes orders for the sewing of women's clothes. Tahmina has already been working in this area for more than 5 years. She is experienced and serious about her work. She likes the daily income from sewing and getting to know new clients. Tahmina applied for a loan to purchase a new sewing machine in order to accelerate her workflow and daily income. This loan will allow her to expand her area of work.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Dúo Dios Poderoso Group

texts.es:
Dúo Dios Poderoso
Este dúo está conformado por Juana es originaria de Sumpango, es casada y madre de familia ella se dedica a elaborar delantales típicos así como también a la siembra de verduras, por lo que necesita de otro crédito para poder invertir en su cultivo ya que la temporada de invierno se acerca y es cuando más tiene que cuidar sus cosechas para sacarle ganancias, por lo que nuevamente solicitan otro credito es el segundo crédito que solicita con kiva , además agradece la oportunidad que se le ha brindado ya que en el crédito anterior le fue muy bien trabajando con kiva.
texts.en: "Dios Poderoso" (Powerful God) Duo. This Duo is formed by Juana, native of Sumpango. She is married and has children. She works making typical aprons, as well as growing vegetables. For this, she needs another loan to invest in her crops, because the winter season is approaching and this is when she has to take better care of her harvests in order get earnings. Therefore, she is requesting another loan. It is the second loan she is requesting from Kiva. She is also grateful for the opportunity she has received, because she did very well working with Kiva in her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm tools for farming, to improve her farm operations to grow more produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming through the adoption of modern farming techniques

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, a married woman, has been blessed with two children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Catherine has operated a poultry selling business for over six years. However, disease outbreak has caused losses and challenged her business. With a loan of KSHS 50,000, she will purchase chicks and poultry feed. Joining the microfinance group Yehu to access loans will help her be more successful and boost her income potential.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Ingris Jhoana

texts.es:
Ingris, a sus 26 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, al que ha sacado adelante con arduo esfuerzo y dedicación. 

Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado como comerciante independiente en su propio almacén de ropa; allí trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas y ha logrado generar los ingresos para solventar las necesidades familiares.

Expresa que su interés con el crédito es invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor como blusas, jeans, pantalones de dama, una vitrina, entre otros para abastecerse lo suficiente y poder satisfacer los gustos de su clientela con la variedad que ofrecerá; esto le ayudará a mejorar las ventas  y los ingresos que recibe, además le hará frente a su mayor desafío que es sostenerse frente a la competencia desleal que se presenta en el sector. 

Ingris manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ingris, at 26 years of age, is the mother of 5 children. She has brought them up with great effort and dedication. 

For a long time she has worked as an independent shopkeeper of her own clothing store. She works every day for 10 hours, and she has managed to generate the income to take care of her family's needs. 

She states that her interest in the loan is to invest in the purchase of an assortment of wholesale items like blouses, jeans, women's pants, a display cabinet, among others, to stock up enough to be able to satisfy her customers' tastes with the variety she will offer. This will help her to improve her sales and the income she receives. It will make her face her greatest challenge as well, which is keeping ahead of the unfair competition that exists in the sector. 

Ingris states that her greatest desire is to improve her housing conditions and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of wholesale items like blouses, jeans, women's pants, a display cabinet, among others.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is an honest woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1960. She is living in blossom nature each season and hospitable people are living. She is a widow and has three children. She is a businesswoman. She trades women's clothes in her small store at the center of a city. She exports from the capital of a country and retails in her town. She has permanent clients who order her new collection of clothes. She is planning to buy a new collection of clothes and requested a loan from Kiva and IMON. She hopes to do business and earn money to ensure her family and raise her children. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru:
Фарида из города Худжан. Она разведена с мужем. Ей 31 лет.  У нее двое детей. Детям 5 и 7 лет, они учатся в средней школе. Фарида живет вместе мамой и детьми. 
Фарида бизнес-леди. Она занимается одной видом бизнеса. Фарида привезет товар из Турции.  Она арендует точку, где продает женские одежды, платье, сумки и обуви. Ей в работе помогает ее мама. Фарида уже три года продвигает свой бизнес. Она хочет расширить деятельность и увеличить доход бизнеса. Фарида просит кредит для перевоза ассортимент товаров. Она нуждается на Вашу поддержку. У нее мечта в будущем открыть свою торговую точку.  Фарида нуждается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Farida is from the city of Khujand.  She is 31 years old and divorced from her husband.  She has two children, ages 5 and 7, who are both in school.  Farida lives with her mom and her children.  She is a business woman.  She is involved in one particular type of business; she imports goods from Turkey.  She rents a retail outlet and sells women's clothes, dresses, purses and shoes.  Her mom helps her to run this business, which Farida started three years ago.  She now wants to expand her activity and increase the income she makes from her business.  She is taking a loan to bring in a new inventory and she needs your support.  Her dream is to be able to open her own retail outlet one day.  She is relying on your help.

loans.use: to bring in a new inventory of goods and expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a retail shop business which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and bread. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and bread.

loans.name: Orlando Alberto

texts.es:
Orlando es un joven muy trabajador, responsable, su trabajo es en la Capital viaja semanal, desempeña el cargo de Contador Auxiliar en el Sector Privado, es casado, sus dos hijos son menores de edad el mayor estudia la primaria y el menor aun no estudia ellos lo motivan a salir adelante y luchar cada día para darles lo mejor.  Su mayor desafió es viajar semanal y tener que dejar su familia por ocho día, espera encontrar un trabajo cerca de su casa que le brinde mayor acercamiento a su familia y así ver crecer a sus hijos con mayor dedicación.

Los créditos los ha venido invirtiendo en mejoras a su vivienda, ha repellado las paredes internas, hizo sumidero y ahora solicita este préstamo a Kiva para comprar hierro, cemento, piedras canteras, pega, tubos, llaves, mangueras, ducha, cerámica y otros materiales que ocupara en realizar un baño de concreto, pues el que usa actualmente esta forrado con plásticos y Zing, también necesita terminar las conexiones  del Servicio Higiénico, para darle uso y tener mejores condiciones de higiene en el hogar. 

Desea continuar invirtiendo en su vivienda hará un cuarto, solo con créditos ha podido mejorar las Condiciones en su Vivienda para el bienestar y comodidad de la familia.
texts.en:
Orlando is a young hard worker, responsible. He works in the capital, commuting weekly, as an accountant's assistant in the private sector. He's married and his two children are dependents, one studies primary and the other isn't in school yet; they are his motivation to keep fighting every day to give them the best. HIs biggest challenge is the commute every week, having to leave his family for eight days. He hopes to find work near his house that will allow him to be close to his family so he can watch his children grow with more dedication.

He's been investing his loans in renovating his home, he's finished plastering the internal walls, adding drainage and now he's requesting a loan from Kiva to buy iron, cement, quarry stones, glue, tubes, faucets, hoses, shower, ceramic and other materials that are needed to build a concrete bathroom as the one he uses now is lined with plastic and zinc. He also needs to finish the connections to the sewage to use it and have better hygienic conditions in the home.

He wants to continue investing in his home, he'll make a room. With the loans, he's been able to improve the conditions of his home for the well-being and comfort of his family.

loans.use: install tubes that move water outside and construct a bathtub and toilet.

loans.name: Basibika

texts.en:
Basibika is 55 years old and supports a family of five members. 

She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 17 years earning an income of KES 7,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy advanced fertilizers and certified seedlings for farming.

Her plans are to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her farming activity. 

Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: To improve her farming and earn more income to improve her family's living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell to customers, meeting their demands and those of her family.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 37 years old and he supports a family of four members. 

Richard has been in motorcycle transport services for the last nine years and earns KES 9,000 per month.
 
Richard has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle so as to offer better transport services to his clients. This will help him to meet both client and family needs.
 
Richard plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and start a motorcycle spare parts shop. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair and maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 49 years old, married to Agnes, and he supports nine family members. He has been selling soft drinks in the market for the last 14 years and the business earns him an income of KES 14,000 per month. He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more stocks of soda to sell to clients and earn a living from this.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay the loan and expand his business sector. His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soda to sell to clients and earn a living from this.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put up a stable stall and add more stock.

loans.name: Mansurjon

texts.ru:
Мансурчон  родился и вырос в семье колхозника. Ему 36 лет. Он очень вежливый, добрый и порядочный мужчина.
Женился рано, у него четверо детей. Вместе со своей  семьёй он живёт в деревне. Его единственным источником дохода является животноводство.  Мансурчон  уже несколько лет занимается животноводством, у него уже достаточно большое стадо овец, коров, коз и т. д. 
Но для того чтобы прокормить своё стадо, вырастить для  дальнейшей продажи ему нужны деньги. И поэтому Мансурчон  обратился в МДО Арванд для получения кредита. На деньги полученные в кредит он собирается купить корм для своих животных.
texts.en:
Mansurjon was born and raised in a family of farmers. He is 36 years old. He is a polite, kind and decent man. He married early and has four children. He lives in a village together with his family. 

Mansurjon's only source of income is livestock breeding. He has worked in livestock breeding for some years already, and he already has a sufficiently large herd of sheep, cows, goats and so on. 

To feed his herd and breed them for reselling and for purchasing more heads of cattle, he needs money. Therefore, Mansurjon turned to MDO Arvand to get a loan. For the money received he has decided to purchase livestock feed for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her farming activity to earn more income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам мужчина в возрасте 51 лет.  Он очень вежливый, шустрый и порядочный мужчина.Женился рано, у него трое детей.  Он вместе с семьёй живёт в деревне. Рустам   уже несколько лет занимается животноводством, у него уже большое стадо овец, коров, коз и т. д.
Но для того чтобы прокормить своё стадо, вырастить, чтобы в дальнейшем продать и на вырученные деньги купить ещё ему нужны деньги. И поэтому Рустам  обратился в МДО Арванд для получения кредита. На деньги полученные в кредит он собирается купить корм для своих животных.
texts.en: Rustam is 51 years old.  He is a very polite, smart, and decent man.  He got married when he was quite young and he has three children.  He lives in the countryside with his family.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for a few years already and he has a nice herd which includes cows, sheep, goats etc.  However Rustam needs money to feed his animals, to raise them for further resale and then to buy more livestock.  For this reason he has turned to MDO Arvand and requested a loan.  He is planning to use the money from his loan to buy feed for his livestock.

loans.use: to buy feeds for livestock

loans.name: Banquito Nueva Alianza Group

texts.es: La Sra. Yolanda tiene 40 años de edad, convive con el Sr. Percy con quien tiene 3 hijos que todavía dependen de ellos. Es presidenta de la alcancía comunal “BANQUITO NUEVA ALIANZA” conformada hace más de 7 años por mujeres emprendedoras con ganas de surgir en sus vidas. Yolanda tiene como fuente de trabajo la venta de todo tipo de bebidas que ofrece en su casa, adicionalmente ella también hace servicio de confección, de esta manera ayuda en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El préstamo lo usara en abastecer de diferentes tipos de bebidas para que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes. Su plan a futuro es vender al por mayor sus productos y también alquilar un puesto en donde pueda vender todo tipo de prendas de vestir para mujeres y varones. En la foto grupal la Sra. Yolanda se encuentra de pie en medio de las demás señoras sentadas.
texts.en: Yolanda is 40 years old. She lives with Percy, with whom she has 3 children, who are still dependent of them. She is the president of the communal bank  “BANQUITO NUEVA ALIANZA”, formed more than 7 years ago by enterprising women with wishes to succeed in their lives. Yolanda's work source is selling all types of drinks that she offers in her house. Additionally, she also offers sewing services. This way she helps to improve her family's quality of life. She will use the loan to stock up with different types of drinks to offer her customers. Her future plan is to sell her products wholesale, and also to rent out a place from where she can sell all types of clothes for women and men. On the group photograph, Yolanda is standing in the middle of the other women who are sitting.

loans.use: to buy different types of drinks for their business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize cereals for sale

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus 26 years old, supports a family of 2 members. He has been practicing small scale farming for the last 7 years earning an income of KES9,000 per month. He has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to improve his farming through adoption of modern farming techniques to boost his productivity. 

His plans are to use the anticipated profits to expand his farming activity as well starting a stable retail business . His future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: To improve his farming through adoption of modern farming techniques to boost his productivity.

loans.name: Condrad

texts.en:
Condrad is 49 years old, married to Merceline and he supports five family members. 
He has been in a retail shop for the last 18 years and the business earns him an income of KES 12,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more stocks of goods and products for sale and earn a living from it.

He plans to use gained profits to repay the loan and expand his business sector. 
He hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of goods and products for sale and earn a living from it.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary 40 years old, supports a family of 6 members. 

She has been selling charcoal for the last 10 years earning an income of KES 12,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to increase her sacks of charcoal as stock for sellingl. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to increase her sacks of charcoal as stock and to help educate her children

loans.name: Yobesh

texts.en:
Yobesh is 56 years old and he supports a family of four members. 

He has been a farmer for the last 17 years and earns 12,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting on his farm. His goal is to get a good harvest to supply the market and meet client needs. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children to higher levels of education. His hope is to be financially stable and to start a retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and maize seeds

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is 57 years old, married and supports a family of six members. He has been in the business of animal sales and rope sales for the last 14 years, earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Josephat has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy sheep to sell to gain more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

His future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy sheep to sell to gain more income.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Galadima Mayau Village. Rahila joined Babban Gona to expand her farm and grow her agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Rahila will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Rahila now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her extra earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase grain yields and to educate her children to a higher level

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 42 years old, married to Everline and he supports six family members. 
He has been a farmer for the last 13 years and the business earns him an income of KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing the farm for a better harvest and sell them in the market so as to meet both client and family needs.

He plans to use gained profits to repay the loan and educate his children.He hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing the farm for a better harvest and sell them in the market so as to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells various commodities ranging from biscuits, seasonings, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, soap and beverages. She is married  with one grown dependent. In addition to that, she also grows and sells rice. She has been engaged in that kind of business for 6 years now. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol.

She needs capital to continue operate her farming business. She decided to take a loan to buy fertilizers for the farm. With these, her farm will start to increase its yield and sell more sacks of rice. Her income will augment her finances and she will be able to balance her finances. 

Lilia hopes that she will be productive in managing her both business to improve the family's living condition. She also dreams of purchasing another rice field to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the farm to improve her family condition and save to buy another rice field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plots for farming and to expand her farming activity

loans.name: Maria Jimena

texts.es:
María es una joven madre quien vive junto a su esposo y suegros en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, es una señora muy trabajadora, ella por las mañanas aprovecha su tiempo para ir a visitar a sus clientes ya que su pequeño está en la escuela, vende ropa y calzado por catálogo, es muy conocida ya que es muy responsable con su trabajo.
Su esposo pasa en una finca donde presta servicios de cuidador, ahí le apoyaron para que crie chanchos, cuenta con una pequeña chanchera donde tiene a sus animales. María junto a su esposo solicitaron el crédito para invertir en ambos negocios, en compra de ropa, calzado y balanceado para sus chanchos
María se encuentra agradecida por el apoyo brindado, ya que podrá comprar más mercadería para crecer como microempresaria y así mejorar sus ingresos para seguir dándole la educación a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en: María is a young mother who lives with her husband and parents in-law in the city of Santo Domingo. She is a very hard working woman. In the mornings, she uses her time to visit her customers, because her little son is in school. She sells clothes and footwear by catalog. She is very well known because she is very responsible with her job. Her husband spends time at a farm where he works as a watchman. There, he had help so he would raise pigs. He has a small hog farm where he keeps his animals. Maria and her husband requested a loan to invest in both businesses: to buy clothes, footwear and balanced feed for his pigs. Maria is grateful for the given support, because she will be able to buy more merchandise to grow as a small businesswoman and in this way,  improve her income so she can keep on giving an education to her small son.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear by catalog and to stock up her business in order to grow as a businesswoman.

loans.name: Dúo Irma De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Irma de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Irma quien tiene una estética desde hace varios años. Su sueño es tener un local propio para no pagar renta. Necesita la compra de varios tintes, líquidos especiales, cremas para su negocio y no los tiene, por ello necesita otro préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta, asi generar mas ganancias.
texts.en: The Irma de San Pedro Duo. The person in charge of this group is Irma, who has had a beauty salon for many years. Her dream is to have her own place so she does not have to pay rent. She needs to buy many hair colors, special liquids, creams for her business, and she does not have them. Therefore, she needs another loan to buy what she is missing so she can generate more earnings.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for the beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his farming

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 54 years old. He is married and has five children. He has been in the restaurant business for the last seven years and makes good profits. 

This is his third loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy more assorted utensils for use in the restaurant so that he can provide quality service to his customers who are growing more numerous each day.

loans.use: to buy more utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put up a structure for selling her clothes and add more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for farming

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre amable muy perseverante que vive junto a su hermosa familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 12 y 26 años en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Él tiene 47 años, y para obtener sus ingresos  trabaja como encargado de bodega desde hace 15 años, Pedro ahora necesita comprar pisos y balcones para darle a su casa que construyo los últimos detalles, pero el  últimamente ha tenido un poco de gastos que ahora ya no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 y comprar los pisos y balcones.
El gran sueño de este humilde padre de familia es construirle a cada uno de sus  hijos una casa propia.
texts.en: Pedro is a kind, persevering man, who lives with his beautiful family of six children between the ages of 12 and 26, in a community of Suchitepéquez. He is 47 years old, and in order to get income he has worked for 15 years taking care of a grocery store. Now Pedro needs to buy floors and balconies to give the last details to the house he built, but he has lately had some more expenses, and now he does not have enough money anymore. Therefore, he has made the decision to request a loan of Q 3,500.00 and buy floors and balconies. The biggest dream of this humble family father is to build a house for each of his children.

loans.use: to buy floors and balconies.

loans.name: Gulbarchyn

texts.ru: Гульбарчын успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании.  На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть корова, 10 овец. Также есть надел мерою 1,0 ГА орошаемой земли, где Гульбарчын выращивает арбузы для реализации. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульбарчын обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку клеенки для теплицы, семян, удобрений для выращивания экологически-чистых арбузов. Гульбарчын является лидером группы "Барчын", в которой всего состоит 3 человека. В будущем, Гульбарчын планирует и дальше расширять свою деятельность, чтобы накопить на покупку автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en: Gulbarchyn has successfully repaid her loan. She is thankful to Kiva and everyone who has helped her with financing. At present she has one cow and 10 sheep on her farm. She also has  a plot of land of 1.0 ha [2.5 acres], where Gulbarchyn grows watermelons for sale. In order to develop her loan further, Gulbarchyn has turned to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som [KGS] to buy plastic film for her greenhouses, as well as seeds and fertilizers for growing environmentally clean watermelons. Gulbarchyn is the leader of the Barchyn borrowers' group, which has three members in total. In the future, Gulbarchyn plans to keep developing her business in order to save up for a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and plastic film for building a greenhouse and growing organic watermelons.

loans.name: José Meregildo

texts.es:
José es un joven de 25 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
José es uno de los pocos jóvenes que se atreven soñar en grande y que luchan día con día para  alcanzar sus sueños, él trabaja como administrador comercial para una empresa, él  tiene cuatro años de realizar esta labor.
José gracias a las ganas de superación que tiene, ahora ya tiene su casa  lista, lo único que le hace falta es el techo, pero con lo que el gana ya no se da abasto para poder comprar las láminas, es por tal motivo que solicita un crédito para poder cubrir esta necesidad que tiene.
El grana anhelo de José es terminar de construir su casa, para luego instalar una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes.
texts.en: José is a young 25 year old man. He lives with his parents in a community of Suchitepéquez. Jose is one of the few young men, who dares to dream big, and who struggles day by day to achieve his dreams. He works as a commercial manager for a company. He has worked for four years in this job. Thanks to his motivation to progress, now Jose has already built his house. The only thing he is missing is the roof, but with his salary he does not have enough money to buy the sheets. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to pay for this need he has. His greatest wish is to finish building his house, and later install a grocery store to buy and sell grocery store items.

loans.use: to buy sheets for the roof of his house.

loans.name: Rosmery Ines

texts.es: Rosmery una joven de 25 años egresada de la carrera de contabilidad en la universidad “Mayor de San Marcos”. Actualmente se encuentra realizando sus prácticas profesionales en una empresa para poder obtener su título profesional. Agradece a sus padres por el apoyo y la confianza brindada. Su mayor deseo es tener una empresa. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el pago de su titulación Rosmery agradece a los inversionistas kiva que hicieron posible este crédito.
texts.en: Rosmery is a 25-year-old young woman who has graduated from “Mayor de San Marcos” University with a degree in accounting. She is currently carrying out an internship at a company in order to obtain her professional title. She is thankful to her parents for the support and confidence they have given her. Her greatest wish is to own a business. She is requesting this loan to pay for her professional title and is thankful to the Kiva investors who make this loan possible.

loans.use: to pay for her professional title

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old, married and is blessed with 5 children. She has been practicing farming for the last 7 years.

Josephine has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer and be able to grow more cash crops for sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

Her future hopes and dreams are to buy a large piece of land and do large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy a plot for farming for high harvest and to be able to educate her children

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 29 years old and he supports a family of 5 members. 
He has been a farmer for the last 4 years and it earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase improvised modern farm tools and equipment for improving his farming activity so as to get better harvest for sale to clients and family use. 
He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. 
His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase improvised modern farm tools and equipment for improving his farming activity so as to get better harvest for sale to clients and family use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and certified seeds for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats for meat sale in the area for more income gain, to use to pay for his children's education

loans.name: Razmuhi

texts.en:
Razmuhi lives in Mkhchyan village with her son and husband.    For 15 years, Razmuhi and her husband have cultivated potatoes in two greenhouses near their house. The gathered harvest is sold in local markets and the family is able to have income for living.
 
The greenhouses are now damaged and there is construction needed to bring them to good condition. This is the reason Razmuhi has applied for this loan. 

She asks lenders to support her to pay for greenhouse construction works, and purchase fertilizer and pesticides for land cultivation. 
 This is Razmuhi's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to pay back, and Razmuhi faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her recent hard work, she and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. So Razmuhi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for greenhouse construction works, fertilizer and pesticides for land cultivation

loans.name: Eusebia De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Eusebia de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón desde hace 10 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, gracias a sus ventas es como ella puede salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Doña Eusebia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas semillas de marañón para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Eusebia is 53 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has been making a living by selling cashews for the last 10 years. She sells her products in different markets near her home, and thanks to these sales she is able to continue forward with her home expenses. Eusebia is requesting a loan to buy more cashews, so that she may keep working and have better income.

loans.use: to buy more cashews.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan into the family of workers. She is living in small town with beautiful natural scenery and where generous people are living. She is married and has three children. She does a business of selling and buying eggs, traditional yogurt, almonds, nuts, etc. in domestic market. She buys from farmers and rural places and retails in domestic market. 

She is planning to enlarge her business and earn money to feed her family. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to buy almonds, nuts, traditional yogurt, eggs, etc. to do business. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to buy almonds, nuts, traditional yogurt, eggs, etc. to do business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for farming

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en: Gambo is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Galadima Mayau Village. Gambo joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Gambo suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Gambo has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000 per hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 30 bags of maize this year, Gambo can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields
