loans.name: Gulraftor

texts.en: Gulraftor is a hard-working woman who was born in southern Tajikistan into a family of workers. She is married and has three children. She lives in a remote area with her family. She works at a secondary school in their area, where she is a teacher who is well known among other teachers and friends. She works in order to feed her family and to pay for her sick mother’s treatment at a medical clinic. She needs financial support from Kiva lenders for the treatment that she hopes will make her mother healthy. Gulraftor awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her sick mother's medical treatment.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is 26 years old, married to Florence, and supports a family of 4. 

He has been practicing small scale farming for the last 10 years, earning an income of 10,000 KES per month. 

Job has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to improve his farming through adoption of modern farming techniques, especially greenhouse, to boost his productivity. 

His plans are to use the anticipated profits to educate his children, as well as expanding his farming activity. 

Job's future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to improve his farming, through adoption of modern farming techniques, especially greenhouse, to boost his productivity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a better butchery house for his business, and to attract more customers for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita has been toiling the land and growing rice for more than 10 years. She is married, with 5 grown children, and resides in Trinidad, Bohol. She engages in farming, and sells rice to earn a living.

Margarita has requested a loan in the amount of 16,000 PHP to buy  farm supplies, such as rice seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides. These are essential tools that will generate more yield and augment her income, enabling her to provide nutritious diets for the whole family. She will now be able to set aside some savings for emergency use.

Margarita is very thankful for the funds, and she is determined to expand her farming and improve the family's status of living.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, such as rice seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr: Fanta qui se trouve sur la photo et un foulard blanc, deuxieme femme en partant de la droite, est membre d’un groupe de 10 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Baga au sud de Bamako au Mali. Fanta, âgée de 40 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 7 à 30 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son mariage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Fanta à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 15 ans. Fanta cultive l'arachide, le mais, le riz, le gombo sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Fanta entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Fanta effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 15 ans que Fanta cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Fanta planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Fanta espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Fanta, the one wearing a white headscarf in the photo (the second person from right to left) is a member of a group composed of 10 farmers who have signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Baga, to the south of Bamako in Mali. Fanta is 40 years old and has six children ranging from  7 to 30 years of age, one of whom is in school. Her family has been traditionally engaged in farm work, which is the main source of income and food for the household. She also married a farmer and has been doing farm work for 15 years now. Fanta grows peanuts, corn, rice and okra on her land plot. She faces challenges such as low rainfall and lack of agricultural supplies. 

This is Fanta's second year with myAgro. She renewed her membership in order to be able to increase her yield thanks to the services provided by myAgro. This year Fanta is making payments toward a myAgro package of fertilizers needed  to grow peanuts and increase her yield on a land plot of 0.125 ha [0.3 acres]. Fanta has been growing peanuts for 15 years due to their nutritional value. She explains that peanuts are consumed  by her family direclty and used in sauces for cooking. Peanuts also have commercial value as  Fanta can sell them at the market. With an increase of her yield and her revenues, Fanta hopes to  become a vendor and to ensure her family has sufficient food.

loans.use: to buy a package of fertilizers for growing peanuts and take advantage of agricultural training offered by myAgro.

loans.name: Vilma Haydee

texts.es: Doña Vilma de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y comida, tiene 12años de experiencia en la actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, gracias a sus ventas es como ha podido salir adelante con sus ventas, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos como: chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, frijoles entre otras cosas y asi seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Vilma is 52 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner. She makes a living by selling pupusas and other foods, and has 12 years of experience in her business which she began with her own capital. Thanks to her sales, she is able to get by with her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase the necessary ingredients for the preparation of the foods, such as: chicharrón (fried pork rinds), cheese, corn, and beans, among other things, so she can continue with her sales and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase chicharrón (fried pork rinds), cheese, corn, and beans, among other things,

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es:
El señor Evelio de 60  años de edad, es casado  y tiene casa propia, no tiene  hijos que dependen de él  y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo valle al sur de Honduras.
Don Evelio se dedica desde hace 11 años a la venta de artículos como ventiladores, juegos de olla,  planchas, vajillas y otros artículos para el hogar, es un hombre trabajador con deseos de salir adelante.
Don Evelio está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de juegos de ollas, vajillas, etc. que trae de los Estados Unidos para vender en su negocio es su quinto  préstamo que solicita a Prisma y ha sido un buen cliente.
Uno de sus sueños es mejorar más sus negocios.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2015.
texts.en:
Evelio is 60 years old, is married, has his own home, does not have any children that depend on him and lives in the community of San Lorenzo valley in southern Honduras. For 11 years, Evelio has made a living by selling items such as fans, sets of pots, griddles, flatware and other household items. He is a hardworking man with a desire to succeed. 

Evelio is requesting a loan in order to purchase sets of pots, flatware, etc. brought from the United States to be sold in his business. It is the fifth loan that he has requested from Prisma and has been a good client. One of his dreams is to further improve his business. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April, 2015

loans.use: to buy sets of pots and  flatware for his business.

loans.name: Pedro Francisco

texts.es: Don Pedro de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el posee un negocio de venta de tortillas y venta de maíz y frijoles, la elaboración de las tortillas su esposa es quien el ayuda, tiene 10 años de tener su negocio el cual lo inicio con capital propio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz y frijoles por quintales para seguir con sus ventas y así poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Don Pedro, 60 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and son. He owns a business selling tortillas and also sells corn and beans. His wife is who helps him make the tortillas. He has had his business for 10 years, which he started with his own capital. With what he obtains from his sales, he is able to cover some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy corn and beans by the quintal in order to continue with his sales and in that way obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans by the quintal.

loans.name: Dúo Trabajadores De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Trabajadores de San Mateo
Este dúo está formado por don Juan Isabel él tiene 58 años de edad y se dedica a la agricultura en general, como siembra de hortalizas, zanahoria, remolacha, ejote, arveja, suchini, arveja criolla, guicoyito tierno y sazón, tomate, chile pimiento, en el are a de San Mateo Milpas Altas, desde ya hace muchos años, él está solicitando el crédito para la compra de abono he insecticida para sus cultivos, su mayor deseo es encontrar buena cosecha y poder ingresar buen producto en la cooperativa cuatro pinos, que es el lugar donde el entrega todas sus cosechas, para exportación.
texts.en:
This duo includes Juan Isabel, who is 58 years old and makes a living in general agriculture, like planting leafy vegetables, carrots, beets, green beans, peas, zucchini, creole peas, tender and ripe squash, tomatoes, and hot peppers in the San Mateo Milpas Altas area for many years. 

He is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides for his plants. His main wish is to find a good harvest and be able to bring good products to the cuatro pinos cooperative, the place where he brings all of his harvests to export.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goods to sell in her retail shop so as to meet her family's needs.

loans.name: Arev

texts.en:
Arev is a farmer. She lives in Horom village in the Shirak region with her big family of 7, her parents-in-law, husband, brother and sister-in-law, and two chidlren. 

Arev's whole family is engaged in agriculture. They keep livestock: three cows, calves, a pig, piglets, and hens, as well as cultivating wheat, barley, and potatoes.
 
Arev and her whole family work hard to make income to cover the family's daily needs. Additional income would greatly assist the family. Arev has applied for this loan in order to be able to purchase wheat and barley seeds and fertilizer, and to hire workers to help her with land cultivation.

Because the region where Arev's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate there is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Arev's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for wheat and barley seeds and fertilizer, and to hire workers to help her with land cultivation

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 31 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a su única hija en una comunidad de Sololá.
Miguel para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de almacigo de café, esta labor lo tiene el desde hace 10 años.
Miguel está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar media cuerda de terreno donde él pueda cultivar, pues hasta estos días él no tiene suficiente terreno donde pueda cultivar u mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
El gran sueño de Miguel es poder construir su casa de material Block, y poder comprar una motocicleta.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 31-year-old man, is single and lives with his only daughter in a community in Sololá. In order to earn an income and provide for his family, Miguel makes a living in sales in a coffee plant nursery, which is a job he has done for the past 10 years. 

Miguel is requesting a loan in order to purchase a half-acre of land where he will be able to cultivate, since to this day he does not have sufficient land where he is able to cultivate and improve his household income.

Miguel's greatest dream is to be able to build a house of concrete block and to be able to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: purchase a half-acre of land.

loans.name: Tene's Group

texts.fr: Tene qui se trouve sur la photo, portant le drapeau de myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Baga au sud de Bamako au Mali. Tene, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 12 à 30 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son marriage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Tene à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 10 ans. Tene cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie. Tene entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison du système de paiement et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Tene effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Tene cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Tene planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce, enfin elle espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Tene, who is showing the myAgro flag in the photo, is a member of a group of 11 farmers enrolled in myAgro. They live and work in the village of Baga south of Bamako, in Mali.

50-year-old Tene is the mother of eight children from 12 to 30 years old, two of whom are currently attending school. The family tradition is anchored in the practice of agriculture, which is the main source of income and ensures food self-sufficiency for the household.

Having married a farmer prompted Tene to practice this activity for over ten years. She cultivates groundnuts and rice on her land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain.

Tene is entering her second year with myAgro and renewed her application because of the payment system and the prospect of increasing her crop efficiency through services offered by myAgro.

This year Tene is making payments to buy a package of myAgro fertilizer for groundnut cultivation to increase crop yields on her 0.125 hectare plot (0.31 acres).

For the past ten years Tene has been cultivating groundnuts for its food value, explaining that the groundnut is directly consumable by the family and used as a sauce base in their diet.

With increased yields and income Tene expects to to business, and also hopes to cover her children's school fees.

loans.use: buy a bag of fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts

loans.name: Bintou's Group

texts.fr: Bintou qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang à gauche, couvert d’un foulard noir et blancet montrant la pochette myAgro est membre d’un groupe de 12 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Baga au sud de Bamako au Mali. Bintou, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère d’ 1 enfant âgé de 13 ans, qui est actuellement scolarisé.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son marriage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Bintou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Bintou cultive l'arachide, le sorgho, le gombo, le petit pois de terre sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie. Bintou entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison des engrais de qualité et des formations et techniques agricoles, ainsi que de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Bintou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans que Bintou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Bintou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Bintou espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Bintou, standing on the left in the second row on the photo, wearing a black-and-white scarf and holding a myAgro packet, is a member of a group of 12 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro. They live and work in the village of Baga south of Bamako, in Mali.

50-year-old Bintou is the mother of one 13-year-old child, who currently attends school. The family tradition is anchored in the practice of agriculture, which is the main source of income and ensures food self-sufficiency for the household.

Having married a farmer prompted Bintou to practice this activity for over thirty years. She cultivates groundnuts, sorghum, okra and Bambara peas on her land, but as a crop farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain.

Bintou is entering her second year with myAgro and renewed her application because of the quality of fertilizers, the training in agricultural techniques offered by myAgro, and the prospect of increasing her crop efficiency through services offered by myAgro.

This year Bintou is making payments to buy a package of myAgro fertilizer for groundnut cultivation to increase crop yields on her 0.125 hectare plot (0.31 acres).

For the past thirty years Tene has been cultivating groundnuts for its crop value, explaining that the groundnut is directly consumable by the family and used as a sauce base in their diet.

With increased yields and income Tene expects to begin trading, and also hopes to ensure food self-sufficiency for her family and finance her children's weddings.

loans.use: buy a bag of fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts and benefit from training in agricultural techniques offered by myAgro

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr: Kadiatou qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, portant un foulard noir, est membre d’un groupe de 13 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Kandia au sud de Bamako au Mali. Kadiatou, âgée de 60 ans, est la mère d’ 1 enfant âgé de 25 ans.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Kadiatou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 45 ans. Kadiatou cultive l'arachide, le gombo sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie. Kadiatou entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison des formations et techniques agricoles fournies par l’organisation. Cette année Kadiatou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 45 ans que Kadiatou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Kadiatou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  pour pouvoir encourager d’autres membres du village à faire de même. Enfin Kadiatou espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kadiatou, sitting on the right in the first row of the photo and wearing a black scarf, is a member of a group of 13 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro. They live and work in the village of Kandia south of Bamako, in Mali.

60-year-old Kadiatou is the mother of one 25-year-old child, who currently attends school. The family tradition is anchored in the practice of agriculture, which is the main source of income and ensures food self-sufficiency for the household.

Kadiatou has been practicing this activity for over 45 years. She cultivates groundnuts and okra on her parcel of land, but as a crop farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain.

Kadiatou is entering her third year with myAgro and renewed her application because of the training in agricultural techniques offered by the organisation.

This year Kadiatou is making payments to buy a package of myAgro fertilizer for groundnut cultivation, to increase crop yields on her 0.125 hectare plot (0.31 acres).

For the past 45 years Kadiatou has been cultivating groundnuts for its commercial value, because the groundnut is a food product she sells at the market.

With increased yields and income Kadiatou plans to encourage other villagers to do the same. Finally, she also hopes to build a family home and finance her children's weddings.

loans.use: buy a bag of fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Ángela de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ángela is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her husband.  She has had a small store located in her residence for several years.  She has a lot of customers thanks her good prices and friendly service.

She is applying for a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread, among other products, in order to increase her income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread, among other products

loans.name: Francis Judith

texts.es:
La señora Francis es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica al comercio y su negocio es la venta de joyería, edredones, planchas, licuadoras, hoyas, etc. su negocio lo realiza desde hace 22 años, está ubicado en su casa  de habitación y sus principales clientes son maestros, amas de casa, dueños de algunas pequeñas tiendas que le compran su producto en mayores cantidades.
Doña Francis esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como edredones, planchas, pulseras, anillo, juegos de ollas, etc. para tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes que la visitan diariamente, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su negocio y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
Doña Francis sueña con tener una pequeña tienda en el centro de la ciudad para poder expandir su negocio.

Danli, Honduras – Abril del 2015
texts.en:
Francis is a hard-working woman who makes her living selling jewelry, quilts, irons, blenders, and bowls, among other products.  She has been running this business for 22 years.  It is located in her home and her principal clients are teachers, housewives, and the owners of some small stores who buy her products wholesale.  

Francis is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as quilts, irons, bracelets, rings, and pot and pan sets, so that she can offer more products to her clients who visit her on a daily basis.  She hopes that this investment will allow her to get ahead with her business and continue supporting her family.  

Francis' dream is to have a small store in the center of the city so that she can expand her business.  

Danli, Honduras
April 2015

loans.use: to buy quilts, irons, bracelets, rings, and pot and pan sets for her business

loans.name: Gladis Sagrario

texts.es:
La señora Gladis de 47  años  de edad vive con sus hijos que dependen de ella,  tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de  venta de abarrotería en su negocio vende granos básicos, leches, frescos, pollo, carnes, desodorantes, sandalias, jugos, etc. sus clientes son los amigos y personas que transitan por su negocio.
Doña Gladis esta  solicitando el préstamo para la compra maíz, refrescos, jabón, azúcar, harina, huevos, pan, etc. para surtir su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio y a su vez que esto le permita salir adelante con sus familia, uno de sus sueños es mejorar mas su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Abril del 2015
texts.en:
Gladis is 47 years old and lives with her children who are dependent on her.  She has her own home and she has been making a living selling groceries for 5 years.  Her store sells basic grains, milk, soft drinks, chicken, meat, deodorant, sandals, and juice, among other products.  Her customers are her friends and people who pass by her store.  

Gladis is requesting a loan to buy corn, soft drinks, soap, sugar, flour, eggs, and bread, among other products, to supply her business and provide her customers with better service while allowing her to get ahead with her family.  One of her dreams is to improve her business.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras
April 2015

loans.use: to buy corn, soft drinks, soap, sugar, flour, eggs, and bread, among other products, for her business

loans.name: Nassa's Group

texts.fr: Nassa qui se trouve sur la photo portant un foulard marron autour de son cou, première personne accroupie à gauche, est membre d’un groupe de 12 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Nanguila au sud de Bamako au Mali. Nassa, âgée de 45 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 7 à 30 ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son marriage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Nassa à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 35 ans. Nassa cultive l'arachide, le sorgho, le maraichaige sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Nassa entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison des formations et techniques agricoles et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Nassa effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 35 ans que Nassa cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Nassa planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter du matériel agricole et d'augmenter son epargne. Enfin Nassa espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nassa, the first person crouching on the left and wearing a maroon scarf around her neck, is a member of a group of 12 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro. They live and work in the village of Nanguila south of Bamako, in Mali.

45-year-old Nassa is the mother of seven children from 7 to 30 years of age, of whom five currently attend school. The family tradition is anchored in the practice of agriculture, which is the main source of income and ensures food self-sufficiency for the household.

Having married a farmer prompted Nassa to practice this activity for over 35 years. She cultivates groundnuts, sorghum, and market vegetables on her parcel of land, but as a crop farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain and agricultural equipment.

Nassa is entering her first year with myAgro and applied because of the training in agricultural techniques that were offered, and the prospect of increasing her crop efficiency through services offered by myAgro.

This year Nassa is making payments to buy a package of myAgro seeds and fertilizer for groundnut cultivation, to increase crop yields on her 0.25 hectare plot (0.62 acres).

For the past 35 years Nassa has been cultivating groundnuts for its nutritional value (explaining that the groundnut is directly consumable by the family and used as a sauce base in their diet) and also for its crop value, as she sells this food product at the market.

With increased yields and income Nassa expects to buy agricultural equipment and increase her savings. Finally, she hopes she can ensure food self-sufficiency for her family and finance her children's weddings.

loans.use: buy a package of seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts and benfit from training in agricultural techniques offered by myAgro

loans.name: Jose Balbino

texts.es: Jose de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el posee un taller de carpintería, tiene 5 años de dedicarse al negocio y muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está  solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 39 years old and lives in his own home with his life companion and their 2 children.  He owns a carpenter's workshop.  He has been doing this business for 5 years and many people prefer the quality and good prices that he offers.  He uses the income that he gains from his business to pay for some of the household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business and buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane, and other items so that he can attract more clients and therefore fulfill his goal of improving life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane, and other items

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio el cual es la venta de abarrotería en general, su negocio lo atiende desde su casa de habitación hace 4 años, este se encuentra en un punto estratégico en su barrio por la afluencia de personas que a diario transitan por su colonia.
Doña Hilda sus clientes le prefieren por su buena atención y porque es de las pocas pulpería en la zona que atiende al público desde tempranas horas en la mañana, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de producto como ser: azúcar, manteca, jabón, arroz, refrescos, pollo, manteca, pastas de tomate, papel higiénico, embutidos, etc. para poder ofrecer a sus clientes más variedad de productos y espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su familia.
Doña Hilda sueña con tener su negocio bien surtido, para tener una mayor clientela y así mejorar sus ingresos y a su vez su calidad de vida.

Dnli, Honduras  -Abril del 2015
texts.en:
Hilda is a hard-working woman who owns a grocery store.  She has been running the store from her home for 4 years.  It is situated at a strategic point in the neighborhood because of the affluent people who pass through her community every day.  Her clients prefer her store for the good service that she offers and because it is one of the few grocery stores in the area that is open from early in the morning.  

She is requesting a loan to buy products such as sugar, butter, soap, rice, soft drinks, chicken, tomato paste, toilet paper, and canned goods, in order to offer her clients more variety.  She hopes that this investment will allow her and her family to get ahead.  

Hilda's dream is to have a well-stocked store so that she can bring in more customers and improve her income as well as her quality of life.  

Danli, Honduras
April, 2015

loans.use: to buy sugar, butter, soap, rice, soft drinks, chicken, tomato paste, toilet paper, and canned goods, among other products, for her business

loans.name: Seindja's Group

texts.fr: Seindja qui se trouve sur la photo tient le drapeau de myAgro à droite, et est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Karako au sud de Bamako au Mali. Seindja, âgée de 45 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 12 à 22 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Seindja à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 8 ans. Seindja cultive l'arachide, le maraichage, le gombo, l'haricot sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et de semences de qualité. Seindja entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison du système de paiement et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Seindja effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 31 ans que Seindja cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Seindja planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Seindja espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Seindja, standing on the right in the photo holding a myAgro flag, is a member of a group of 11 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro. They live and work in the village of Karako south of Bamako, in Mali.

45-year-old Seindja is the mother of four children from 12 to 22 years of age, of whom two currently attend school. The family tradition is anchored in the practice of agriculture, which is the main source of income and ensures food self-sufficiency for the household.

Love of agriculture prompted Seindja to practice this activity for over eight years. She cultivates groundnuts, market vegetables, okra and beans on her land, but as a crop farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain, agricultural equipment, and quality seeds.

Seindja is entering her third year with myAgro and renewed her application because of the payment system and the prospect of increasing her crop efficiency through services offered by myAgro.

This year Seindja is making payments to buy a bag of myAgro fertilizer for groundnut cultivation to increase crop yields on her 0.125 hectare plot (0.31 acres).

For the past eight years Seindja has been cultivating groundnuts for its nutritional value (explaining that the groundnut is directly consumable by the family and used as a sauce base in their diet), but also for its value as a cash crop.

With increased yields and income Seindja intends to begin livestock farming and buy agricultural equipment. Finally, she also hopes to manage the children's tuition fees and ensure food self-sufficiency for her family.

loans.use: buy a bag of fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts

loans.name: Armando Augusto

texts.es:
Armando es un muchacho de 31 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Santo Tomas la Unión.
Armando para poder obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa trabaja como maestro de segunda enseñanza media, él tiene 5 años de realizar esta labor, pero también cuenta con un negocio de servicios de internet.
El motivo por el cual el solicita el préstamo es para construir un dormitorio y comprar cemento, block, hierro, pues él quiere contar con su propia casa y no depender más de sus padres.
El gran sueño de Armando es poder construir su casa, y ampliar su negocio de internet.
texts.en:
Armando is young man 31 years of age, single, he lives with his parents in a community of Santo Tomas Union.  Armando, in order to get income and support his parents with the household expenses, works as a high school teacher.  He has  done this job for five years but also has an internet services business.
The reason for the requested loan is to build a bedroom and buy cement, blocks, iron, as he wants to have his own home and no longer depend on his parents.
Armando's great dream is to build a house, and expand your internet business.

loans.use: to purchase of cement, blocks, iron to build your bedroom.

loans.name: Karen Elena

texts.es:
Ella es Karen una tierna y dulce Joven cabeza de familia de tan solo 19 años de edad, ella tiene un pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad (ver foto), el padre de la criaturita los dejo solos y ella como una mujer responsable que es de inmediato dejo sus estudios todo por ponerse a trabajar y generar los recursos para vestir, alimentar, darle una vivienda a su hijo.

Karen tiene como actividad principal la realización de alimentos como almuerzos, snack, desayunos y pasa bocas, los cuales realiza en la cocina de su casa y los entrega a domicilio, trabaja diariamente en un promedio de 6 horas por día.

Su trabaja es todo lo que tiene para generar ingresos, ella es una adolescente que no se olvida de sus sueños de estudiar, ser una profesional, salir con sus amigas, disfrutar su juventud pero mientras tiene que poner empeño en sacar su negocio adelante ya que de ello depende el futuro de su hija y el sosteniente de esta es lo único que tiene en mente.

Karen quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la preparaciones de comidas típicas, como lo son arroz con pollo, frijoles, sancocho, sudado, bandeja típica que son los alimentos más consumidos por sus clientes. 

Tu préstamo ayudara a una joven de 19 año de edad a salir adelante y pelear por el futuro de su hijo de 3 años, vamos anímate apóyala.
texts.en:
Karen is a sweet young head-of-family. She is just 19 years old and has a young son see photo) who is three-years-old. The son’s father left mother and son alone and Karen, being a responsible woman, immediately left her studies in order to put her all into working and earning the necessary money to clothe, feed and house her son.

Karen has a business selling breakfast, lunches and snacks. She prepares them in the kitchen in her house and delivers to people’s home. Karen works some six hours per day.

This business is all Karen has to earn a living. She is still a teenager who has not forgotten her dream of studying, learning a profession, going out with her girlfriends, and enjoying her youth. Nevertheless, for now Karen is putting all her efforts into moving her business forward as her son’s future, her top priority, depends on this. 

Karen is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies for preparing typical meals such as rice and chicken, beans, soups, and "bandeja paisa" (a meat and beans dish native to Colombia). These are the meals most commonly requested by her customers.

Your loan will help this 19-year-old to get ahead and fight for her three-year-old’s future. Come on, and let’s support her!

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing typical meals such as rice and chicken, beans, soups, and "bandeja paisa" (a meat and beans dish native to Colombia).

loans.name: Ferlie

texts.en:
Ferlie is 48 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ferlie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers, a new variety of seed, etc.

Ferlie has been farming vegetables for 20 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ferlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, a new variety of seed, etc

loans.name: Yilda Argentina

texts.es:
Yilda es una madre cariñosa, amorosa, dedicada, trabajadora, es una mujer cabeza de familia que a lo largo de su vida ha sabido valerse por sí misma y logro con sus propios méritos educar, criar, alimentar, vestir a dos hijos, uno de ellos ya con familia y otro adolescente, ella con un negocio humilde de venta de alimentos logra generar los recursos para pagar las cuentas. 

Yilda vende alimentos fritos, como empanadas, pasteles, buñuelos, papas rellenas, palos de queso, panzerotis, la frita en la cocina de su casa y con un horno microondas, una mesa y una pequeña vitrina sale a vender al frente de su casa.

Debido a la competencia que genera el emprendimiento y ganas de trabajar que han adquirido las personas por estos días donde nacieron muchos negocios de ventas de comida, Yilda quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar dos fritadoras quiere iniciar con la venta de papas a la francesa con salchicha, chorizo, con este préstamo diversificara su oferta, tendrá más productos para vender, generara dos empleos, todo está muy bien pensando y quiere ejecutarlo lo más pronto posible.

El sueño de Yilda es poder tener salud por muchos años más para trabajar y seguir haciendo lo que mejor destaca que es sobrepasar adversidades y progresar.
texts.en:
Yilda is an affectionate, loving, sweet, hard-working and dedicated mother. Yilda is a head of family who, throughout her life, has looked after herself and driven herself to get an education and raise, feed, and dress her two children. One of Yilda’s children now has his own family, while the youngest is still a teenager. Yilda has a humble business selling food that allows her to earn an income to pay her bills.

Yilda sells fried foods, such as pasties, pastries, rolls, stuffed potatoes, cheese sticks and more. She fries them in the kitchen in her house and then uses a microwave oven, table and a small display case to sell the foods outside her house.

Owing to competition, and people’s desire to work, many food businesses have opened in the area recently. Yilda is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy two fryers so that she can start to sell sausage and chips and chorizo. Yilda will thus use this loan to diversify her goods and offer more products. She will provide two jobs for others. Yilda has thought this through well and wants to carry out her plan as soon as possible.

Yilda’s dream to keep up her health for many years in order to work and continue doing what best helps her to overcome adversity, and what helps her to progress.

loans.use: to purchase meat, bread, potatoes to sell meals at a circus so she can one day buy a home.

loans.name: Dúo Lluvia De Gracia De Barcenas Group

texts.es: Dúo Lluvia de Gracia de Barcenas Enma es casada tiene 33 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 6 años quien asiste al colegio de su comunidad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, inicio su negocio hace seis años para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio y poder alquilar un local para tener un lugar estable para su negocio.
texts.en: A member of the Dúo Lluvia de Gracia de Barcenas Group, Enma is 33 and married. She has a 6-year-old son who goes to school in their community. She sells clothes, shoes and cosmetics, a business she started 6 years ago in order to help her husband with household costs. She has requested the loan in order to invest in her business, and to rent premises so that her business will have a stable base.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Djeneba's Group

texts.fr: Djeneba qui se trouve sur la photo assise avec la pochete myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Karako au sud de Bamako au Mali. Djeneba, âgée de 51 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 7 à 28 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son marriage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Djeneba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 10 ans. Djeneba cultive l'arachide, le mil, le sorgho, l'haricot sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Djeneba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des engrais de qualité, ainsi que de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Djeneba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Djeneba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Djeneba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre sa surface cultivée et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Elle a mentionné qu’ "elle aimerait bien devenir une commerçante de condiment car elle est malade et s’est plus difficile pour elle de cultiver." Enfin Djeneba espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Djeneba (sitting and carrying the myAgro pouch in the photo) is a member of a group of 8 farmers who are enrolled with myAgro and who live and work in the village of Karako in the south of Bamako in Mali. Djeneba, who is 51 years old, is the mother of 7 children aged between 7 and 28, 3 of whom are currently attending school. Djeneba has been in this line of work for 10 years, inspired partly because farming is a long held family tradition (as the primary source of revenue and source of food self-sufficiency), and partly because she is married to a farmer. Djeneba grows groundnuts, millet, sorghum and beans on her plot of land but, as a farmer, has to face problems such as a lack of rain, a lack of agricultural equipment and a lack of good quality fertiliser. Djeneba is starting her first year with myAgro and enrolled thanks to the payment system and the good quality of the fertiliser, as well as the myAgro agents' conviction about the benefits provided by the myAgro method.

This year, Djeneba will be making payments so that she can buy a packet of myAgro OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertiliser so that she can grow groundnuts and increase the yield on her 0.0625 hectare plot of land. Djeneba has been growing groundnuts for 20 years for their nutritional value, as groundnuts are directly consumable by the family and are used as an ingredient in a basic sauce for food preparation, and because groundnuts produce good yields and good profits. Djeneba plans to use her increase in income to cultivate more produce on her land for resale. She has also mentioned that she would like to become a retailer of condiments because she is ill and farming is becoming more difficult for her. Finally, Djeneba would like to be able to cover her children's educational costs and to ensure her family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: to buy a pack of OPV seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Myriam Gemina

texts.fr:
Myriam est mariée, son mari travaille dans une petite entreprise privée et son salaire est faible pour couvrir les dépenses primaires de la famille.Elle a 3 enfants de 13, 10 ans et 5mois. Les deux premiers vont à l'école actuellement. 
Pour aider son mari à supporter les charges familiales, elle exploite une petite épicerie et ceci depuis 2009.
Avant cette année, elle travaillait en tant que femme de ménage, travail ne lui convenant pas, à cause de ses enfants encore en bas âge.
Depuis cette année, l'exploitation ne cesse pas de s'améliorer, et elle veut encore la développer, c'est pourquoi elle demande un crédit. Son objectif est de pouvoir faire de la vente en gros afin d'en tirer davantage de bénéfices pour qu'elle puisse offrir à sa famille une qualité de vie meilleur.
texts.en:
Myriam is married - her husband works for a small private company and his salary is insufficient to cover the family's basic needs. She has three children - aged 13, 10 and one of 5 months. The eldest two currently go to school.
In order to help her husband with the household budget, she has run a small grocery business since 2009. Prior to this, she worked as a cleaner, but this was not convenient due to the children still being so young.
Since the beginning of the year, the business has been continually growing, and she wants to develop it further - hence her request for a loan. Her objective is to be able to sell wholesale in order to generate additional profits. This will allow her to give her family an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, bottled drinks, biscuits, coffee curry and peppers in cans, sugar and cooking oils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy damask and condiments.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vilma is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Vilma has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of milk, sugar and rice for sale to meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 35 years old and has three children. Leny is married and has one child in school.

Leny is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Leny has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Leny would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for seeds for horticulture farming.

loans.name: Oumar's Group

texts.fr: Oumar qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, tenant la pochete de myAgro , est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Gwelekoro au sud de Bamako au Mali. Oumar, âgé de 49 ans, est le père de 15 enfants âgés de 1 à 25 ans, dont 7 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Oumar à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 7 ans. Il a mentionné qu"il est né et a grandi  dans l'agriculture." Oumar cultive l'arachide, le mais, le sorgho sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Oumar entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrit en raison du système de paiement et des formations et techniques agricoles. Cette année Oumar effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture de maïs  afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle d’ 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans qu’Oumar cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière. Oumar planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Oumar espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Oumar (sitting in the middle in the picture and carrying a myAgro pouch) is a member of a group of 7 farmers who are enrolled with myAgro and who live and work in the village of Gwelekoro in the south of Bamako in Mali. Oumar, who is 49 years old, is the father of 15 children aged between 1 and 25, 7 of whom are currently attending school. Oumar has been in this line of work for 7 years, and was motivated to be a farmer because farming is a long held family tradition (as the primary source of revenue and enabler of food self-sufficiency). He was born and grew up in a farming community. Oumar grows groundnuts, maize and sorghum on his plot of land but, as a farmer, has to face problems such as a lack of rain and a lack of agricultural equipment. Oumar is starting his third year with myAgro and re-enrolled because of the payment system, the training and the agricultural techniques used.

This year, Oumar will be making payments so that he can buy a packet of myAgro fertiliser for maize production and increase the yield from his 1 hectare plot of land. Oumar has been growing groundnuts for 10 years for their nutritional value. Once his output and income has increased, Oumar plans to cultivate more produce on his land and to buy more agricultural equipment. Finally, Oumar would like to be able to cover his children's educational costs and to ensure his family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: to buy a packet of fertiliser.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a Babban Gona farmer from Gidan Kwabo Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. 

Since joining Babban Gona, Yahaya no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to move into a better home. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, increasing his income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a creative woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1990. She lives in a small town with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an emigrant and works to support their family. She has had a business of sewing traditional women's clothes for many years. She has long-time clients every day. 

She is planning to enlarge her business and additionally sell summer clothes. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy summer clothes for women and expand her business. This business would help her to feed her family until her husband earns money. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes for women

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
For 10 years now, Gaudencia has engaged in fishing. She sell fresh fish to the locals in her community. She is a 61-year-old widow with two grown children. Aside from fishing, she also engages in buying and selling rice. She hails from Getafe, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of rice and fishing materials. These will boost her ongoing catch and enable her to buy more sacks of rice. With this, her income will increase and she will be able to handle her finances.

Gaudencia will now start to invest in other possible business ventures to become sustainable and to expand her current sources of income as well.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice and fishing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a stable stall and add to her stock.

loans.name: Seiba's Group

texts.fr: Seiba qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à gauche, tenant la pochete de n'gasene en deuxieme position, est membre d’un groupe de 5 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Gwelekoro au sud de Bamako au Mali. Seiba, âgé de 32 ans, est la mère de 5 enfants âgés de 1 à 14 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Seiba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 10 ans. Elle explique que "depuis le plus bas age elle pratique l'agriculture." Seiba cultive l'arachide, le gombo sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et d'engrais de qualité. Seiba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement et des engrais de qualité, ainsi que de l'avis favorable de son entourage sur l'impact positif de myAgro. Cette année Seiba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 17 ans que Seiba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Seiba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre sa surface cultivée. Enfin Seiba espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Seiba (standing second from the right in the picture and carrying a myAgro pouch) is a member of a group of 5 farmers who are enrolled with myAgro and who live and work in the village of Gwelekoro in the south of Bamako in Mali. Seiba, who is 32 years old, is the mother of 5 children aged between 1 and 14, 3 of whom are currently attending school. Seiba has been in this line of work for 10 years, and was motivated to be a farmer because farming is a long held family tradition (as the primary source of revenue and an enabler of a household's food self-sufficiency) and she wanted to be able to ensure her family's food self-sufficiency. She has been farming since she was very young. Seiba grows groundnuts and okra on her plot of land but, as a farmer, has to face problems such as a lack of rain and a lack of good quality fertiliser.

Seiba is starting her first year with myAgro and enrolled because of the payment system and the good quality fertiliser, as well as the favourable opinion of those around her concerning the positive impact of myAgro. This year, Seiba will be making payments so that she can buy a packet of myAgro fertiliser for groundnut production and increase the yield on her 0.125 hectare plot of land. Seiba has been growing groundnuts for 17 years for their nutritional value, as groundnuts are directly consumable by the family and are used as an ingredient in a basic sauce for food preparation, and because groundnuts produce good yields and good profits. Once her output and income has increased, Seiba plans to increase the amount of land she cultivates. Finally, Seiba would like to be able to cover her children's educational costs and to ensure her family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: to buy a packet of fertiliser for groundnut production and to benefit from the training and agricultural techniques of myAgro.

loans.name: Sadafmo

texts.en: Sadafmo is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan into a family of Agrarians. She is living in a small town with her family. She is a widow and has three children. She has 22 years of experience in doing business in the domestic market. She trades in fruits and vegetables and knows how to communicate with her customers. In order to continue her business and earn money to ensure her family she needs additional goods to sell. She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders, asking for help to get a loan to buy vegetables and fruits. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gidan Kwabo Village. 

Yusuf joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yusuf will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds which will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yusuf now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old married man from Jabalia City. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Mohammad started another business one year ago which is renting wedding supplies like chairs.
 
Mohammad would like to improve his business so he took a USD Murabaha loan. This loan will help him to buy more chairs for his business. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more chairs for his business.

loans.name: Marisol Del Socorro

texts.es:
sra. Marisol es originaria de Managua, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona central de la región,madre soletera con dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales están en primaria, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. lamentablemente estudios solamente la educación secundaria, en la actualidad lucha día a día para salir adelante con sus hijos.
gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante  marisol tiene por actividad económica el servicio de fumigacion en casa de habitación y adineres. el cual desempeña de forma ambulante, tiene diez años de desempeñarse en dicha actividad. la rutina de trabajo de marisol es de una diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios. el objetivo del crédito es invertir en materia prima y en el mantenimiento de las maquinas.  Marisol agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marisol is originally from Managua, which is located in the centre of the region. She is a single mother, and has two young children at elementary school. She is hard-working, responsible, and eager to improve herself. 

Unfortunately, she was unable to continue her education beyond high school, and she struggles daily to support herself and her children. Thanks to her determination to succeed, she provides a fumigation service for homes which gives her an income. She carries out this work on foot, and has been doing it for ten years. Marisol offers her services for around ten hours each day. 

She will use the loan to invest in materials and pay for the maintenance of the machines. Marisol is grateful for the help which Kiva investors provide, and which allows people of limited resources, and poorer countries such as Nicaragua, to succeed.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the fumigation machines.

loans.name: Erkingul

texts.ru: Эркингуль успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 15 овец. Также есть надел мерою 1,0 ГА орошаемой земли, где Эркингуль выращивает арбузы для реализации. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку клеенки для теплицы, удобрений для выращивания экологически-чистых арбузов. Эркингуль является участником группы "Барчын", в которой кроме нее состоит 2 человека. В будущем, Эркингуль планирует и дальше расширять свою деятельность, чтобы накопить на постройку дома.
texts.en: Erkingul successfully repaid her loan; she is grateful to the Kiva Foundation and everyone that helped her by financing it. Today she has 15 sheep on her farm. Additionally Erkingul has a section of irrigated land measuring 1.0 hectares, where she grows watermelons for sale. To further develop her business, she applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy oilcloth for her greenhouse, and fertilizer for growing organic watermelons. Erkingul is a member of the group 'Barchin', which consists of 2 people excluding her. In the future, Erkingul plans to further expand her area of work in order to save for construction work on her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and oilcloth for her greenhouse and growing organic watermelons.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул, 47 лет, замужем, есть дочь. Айнагул имеет среднее образование, по характеру она спокойный и общительный человек. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода, 15 лет назад она начала заниматься разведением скота. Айнагул приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 12 овец. Также есть надел мерою 0,85 ГА орошаемой земли, где Айнагул выращивает арбузы. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и клеенки для выращивания органических арбузов. Она является одним из 3 участников группы "Барчын". В будущем, Айнагул планирует и дальше расширять свою деятельность.
texts.en: Ainagul is 47 years old, and married with one daughter. Ainagul has a secondary education, and by nature she is a calm and sociable person. 15 years ago, in search of an additional source of income, she started breeding cattle. Ainagul invested all of her energy into developing her business, and today she has 2 cows and 12 sheep on her farm. Additionally, Ainagul has a section of irrigated land measuring 0.85 hectares, where she grows watermelons. In order to further develop her business, she turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer and oilcloth for growing organic watermelon. She is one of three members of the group 'Barchin'. In the future, Ainagul plans to further expand her area of work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and oilcloth for a greenhouse and growing organic watermelons.

loans.name: Akdana

texts.ru: Акдана, 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Акдана занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Акданы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Акдана обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для откорма и продажи. Доходы от кредита Акдана планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en: Akdana is 33 years old, married, and is raising three children together with her husband. She has a secondary education, and works in animal husbandry to earn an income for her family. Thanks to Akdana's persistent hard work, she currently has one cow and four sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farm, Akdana turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase two cows for fattening and resale. With earnings from the loan, Akdana plans to invest in further increasing her amount of domestic animals, and plans to save funds to construct a new shelter for her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Evenecer Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal  Evenecer, está conformado por ocho integrantes siete mujeres  y un hombre, madres y padres responsables de veinte hijos todos menores de edad, son originario del sauce, lugar que se caracteriza por ser productores de leche, cuajada, queso. Todos se conocen entre sí y tiene diferentes actividades económica el luchan para sacar adelante y hacer crecer sus respectivos negocios, y poder brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Sobeida y tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de cerdos en pie. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, el cual dedica unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de un lote de cerdos en pie. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Evenecer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The loan group Evenecer is comprised of 8 members, 7 women and 1 man. They are mothers and fathers and are responsible for 20 children, all of them minors. They are from Sauce, a place that is known for its dairy products, curds and cheese. They all know one another and they have various economic activities with which they fight to move forward  and grow their respective businesses so that they can offer their children a better future. 
Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Sobeida and her business is buying and selling live pigs. Her business is located at her home and she spends 8 hours a day working at it. The goal of the loan is to have working capital and to supply her business by buying a batch of live pigs so that, in the near future, she will have better profits. The Evenecer group is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people who have scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy and sell live pigs.

loans.name: Mahbubahon

texts.ru: Махбубухон, 42 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 20 лет занимается разведением скота, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря неустанному труду и выдержке Махбубухон, в хозяйстве у нее имеется: корова, 2 овцы. На 0,20 Га земли выращивает картофель для реализации. В целях увеличения ее бизнеса Махбубухон обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом на покупку семян и удобрений для выращивания экологически-чистого картофеля. На доходы от кредита Махбубухон планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а также приобрести автомобиль.
texts.en: Mahbubahon is 42 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a secondary education, and for 20 years has been breeding cattle, having started the business with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Mahbubahon's indefatigable hard work and self-control, she now has one cow and two sheep on the farm. She grows potatoes for sale on 0.20 hectares of land. In order to improve her business, Mahbubahon turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for growing organic potatoes. With income from the loan, Mahbubahon plans to increase her total number of cattle, and also to acquire a car.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for growing organic potatoes.

loans.name: Darlis

texts.es:
Darlis es una joven emprendedora y dinámica de 21 años de edad, estudiante universitaria y comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace unos meses comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y compañeros de la universidad, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor como desodorantes, cremas, lociones, entre otros, brindando mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.
Trabaja sola todos los días durante 8 horas.

Darlis tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar y sabe que con los prestamistas de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar puede lograr todo eso y más.
texts.en:
Darlis is a young and dynamic entrepreneur. She is 21 years old, studies at the university, and has her own business. Some months ago she began selling merchandise to her family members, friends, and classmates at the university, with the goal of generating income to support her household and pay for her studies. 
The loan that she is requesting is a support to strengthen her business. She will use it to buy deodorants, creams, lotions, and other items wholesale so that she can offer a greater variety of products and better service to her customers. This will make her business more profitable. 
She works every day for 8 hours.
Darlis has the firm goal of moving ahead with her economic project - she wants to become a successful business woman and to guarantee a better quality of life and wellbeing for her family group. She knows that, with the Kiva lenders and Corporación Interactuar, she can achieve all this and more.

loans.use: to buy deodorants, creams, lotions, and other items wholesale.

loans.name: Anabela

texts.es: La señora Anabella de 28 años quien se dedica desde hace tiempo a la venta de productos onmilafe y venta de zapatos y cosméticos ella actualmente solicita su crédito para compra de lencería y ropa para dama y otra parte lo invertirá en compra de productos onmilafe ella espera que con este crédito ella pueda abrir en su casa una venta de productos cosmeticos ya que es un producto que se vende y las personas la buscan con frecuencia es por eso que ella desea brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes ella espera su ayuda ya que este es su 3er crédito y han podido ayudarla en su negocio que ba en crecimiento.
texts.en: Anabella, 28 years old, has worked for some time selling Omnilife products and selling shoes and cosmetics. She is currently asking for her loan to purchase lingerie and women's clothing and she will invest another part in the purchase of Omnilife products. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to begin selling cosmetic products from her house since that is a product that she sells and the people look for frequently. For this reason she wants to offer better service to her customers. He hopes for your help since this is her third loan and you have been able to help her in her business that is growing.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1960. She is living in a small village with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a constructor and works seasonally. 

She has 20 years of experience doing business in agriculture. She plants agricultural products and keeps livestock. She is a careful and responsible mother. 

Her daughter is sick and needs some pharmacy treatment. Halima requested a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy medicine for her daughter. 

She hopes to be supported and have a healthy and well daughter.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her daughter

loans.name: Kanyshai

texts.ru: Канышай, 51 год, замужем, многодетная мать 2 детей, дети взрослые,живут отдельно. У Канышай среднее образование, много лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 0,34 Га земли, где она выращивает морковь на продажу. Также торгует мукой, основные клиенты- односельчане. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Канышай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 2,000 долларов (USD) на покупку муки для торговли. Доходы от кредита позволят Канышай развить ее бизнес и накопить на постройку магазина, так как на сегодняшний день она продает муку с машины.
texts.en: Kanyshai is 51 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her children are adults, and live away from home. Kanyshai has a secondary education, and has worked in agriculture for many years. She has 0.34 hectares of land on her farm, where she grows carrots for sale. Additionally, she sells flour, and her main customers are villagers. In order to further develop her business, Kanyshai turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 2,000 dollars (USD) to purchase flour for resale. Using income from the loan, Kanyshai will develop her business and save for the construction of a shop, since she currently sells flour from a car.

loans.use: to buy flour for resale, in order to increase her profit and open a private shop.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, de 31 años, desea iniciar con un negocio de construcción y reformas de viviendas en el municipio de La Dorada, negocio que empezara el afán de sostener a sus hijos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

En el momento en que nació su última hija, encontró su motivación para trabajar incansablemente y así ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.
Hoy en día sus hijos tienen 5 y 2 años y se han convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas y materiales de construcción para iniciar con una obra a todo costo que le generar buenos ingresos, estos materiales serian arena, ladrillos, cemento, entre otros.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener a sus hijos y a su esposa brindándoles una mejor oportunidad de progreso.
Apoya a CArlos con un préstamo para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
31 year old Carlos wants to start his own business doing construction and home remodeling in the town of La Dorada. He is starting this business in an effort to support his children and offer them a better quality of life. 
At the moment when his youngest daughter was born, he found his motivation to work tirelessly and offer her the best for her life and development. Today, his children are 5 and 2 years old and have become this hardworking man's happiness.
He is requesting a loan to buy tools and construction materials so that he can start with a construction job that will generate a good profit. These materials will be sand, bricks, cement, and other things.
With this loan, he will be able to support his children and his wife, offering them a better opportunity to progress.
Support Carlos with a loan so that he can continue his business!

loans.use: to buy tools and construction materials, these materials will be sand, bricks, cement, and other things.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Las Mariposas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal las Mariposas está conformada por once integrantes diez mujeres y un hombre padre y madre responsable con  veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad, los cuales son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser personas responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal.
