Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Marina y tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, jabón, azúcar, queso, hielo, fósforos, jugos etc. Ella dedica a su negocio  unas doce horas diarias, para mantener una buena atención a sus clientes y que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El objetivo es invertir en capital de trabajo. Las Mariposas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The loan group Las Mariposas (The Butterflies) is comprised of 11 members, 10 women and 1 man. They are mothers and a father and are responsible for 20 children. They are from Sauce, a place in the north of the region that is know for its responsible, hardworking people who want to improve themselves. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, the group members weren't able to go to school and had to work from a very young age to help with the household expenses.
Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Marina and her source of income is a grocery store, a small store where she sells items of food in small quantities such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, soap, sugar, cheese, ice, matches, juices, etc. She works at her business some 12 hours a day so that she can give her customers good service and so that, in the not too distant future, she can make greater income. Her goal is to use the loan has business capital. The members of Las Mariposas are grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people who have scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in the grocery store with products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs,  oil, soap, juices, cookies, coffee, bread, cheese, matches.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a veranda for his house.

loans.name: Cesar Mateo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III.
El socio continua dedicándose  al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio continua haciendo crecer y engordar a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Comozone III communal bank group.

The member continues to work in his business raising animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. The member is a responsible and diligent person. The member continues to raise and fatten his animals to later sell them to his customers who ask for them. The member wants to be able to continue working so that in this way to continue supporting his family.

The member asks for the loan to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gidan Kwabo Village. Iliya joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Iliya will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilisers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Iliya now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase this farmer’s yields

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 23-year-old single man from Khanyounis city, Palestine. He has been transporting goods using his car for the past three years. Nidal buys the products wholesale and resells them for a small profit margin. 
Nidal has taken out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy more products to resell.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa thanks her lenders for their unwavering support. Because of the loan that she was granted recently, she was able to accomplish buying more supplies of merchandise products for her sari-sari (variety store). This has indeed aided the household's basic expenses and helped in attracting more customers as well. 

To continue what she had started, she would like to request another 20,000 PHP that she would use to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell for her business. Your small act of generosity now can be a good head start for Luisa's dream of expanding her business and giving a better life for her family. 

She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: José Luís Baltazar

texts.es:
José, de 25 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen un hijo de un año y medio de edad.

José, tiene dos años de dedicarse a la agricultura, desde que se casó decidió dedicarse a la agricultura porque no tenía un trabajo estable, actualmente trabaja en el terreno de su padre, su hermano fue quien le enseño a trabajar en la agricultura, el terreno está cerca de su casa,  su pareja a veces le ayuda con las tareas agrícolas, pero también hace charamuscas en su casa para vender y cuando hay elotes hace tamales para vender y así contribuye para los gastos de la casa.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para pagar mano de obra que le ayude a preparar el terreno donde va cultivar, porque José se hirió y por el momento no puede trabajar.- Con la ayuda del crédito podrá estar listo para sembrar; este año se ha propuesto sembrar más, porque necesita cubrir las necesidades de su hijo.

José, sueña con que su hijo un día sea maestro y les enseñe a las demás personas que al igual que él, no pudieron asistir a una escuela y no saben leer ni escribir.
texts.en:
25 year old José did not have the opportunity to go to school. He is married and his partner works as a maid. They have a son who is a year and a half old. 
José has been working as a farmer for 2 years. When he got married he decided to work in agriculture because he didn't have stable work. Currently, he works the land with his father. His brother taught him how to be a farmer. The land is very close to his house. His partner sometimes helps him with agricultural tasks but she also makes charamuscas (a type of frozen juice snack) at home and sells them. When there is corn, she also makes tamales to sell and so contributes to paying the household expenses. 
The loan that she is requesting will be used to pay for labor to help José prepare the land where he farms because he was injured and, for the moment, can't work. With the help of the loan, he will be ready to sow his crops. This year he aims to sow more crops as he needs to cover his son's needs. 
José dreams that his son will be a teacher one day and will teach people like him, who weren't able to go to school and don't know how to read or write.

loans.use: to pay for labor to help him prepare the land where he farms.

loans.name: Lassine's Group

texts.fr: Lassine qui se trouve sur la photo assis à droite avec la casquette et la pochete de myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Digato au sud de Bamako au Mali. Lassine, âgé de 46 ans, est le père de 10 enfants âgés de 1 à 20 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. Il a expliqué que, "les autres ont abandonné l'école." L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture qui lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Lassine à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 17 ans. Il a mentionné qu’ "il est né et a grandi  dans l'agriculture." Lassine cultive l'arachide, le mais, le sorgho sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie. Il précise que"depuis qu'il a adheré à myAgro il n'a plus de probleme d'engrais." Lassine entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrit en raison du système de paiement et des engrais de qualité. Il  pense  que, "la formation myAgro et les mesures de parcelle lui plaisent beaucoup." Cette année Lassine effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture de maïs  afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle d’ 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 15 ans que Lassine cultive le mais pour sa rentabilité productive.  Lassine planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre sa surface cultivée et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Il a qu’il a la volonté de faire « grandir son champ pour avoir plus de rendement et vendre le surplus." Enfin Lassine espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Lassine (sitting on the right in the picture, wearing a baseball cap and carrying a myAgro pouch) is a member of a group of 7 farmers who are enrolled with myAgro and who live and work in the village of Digato, in the south of Bamako in Mali. Lassine, who is 46 years old, is the father of 10 children aged between 1 and 20, 1 of whom currently attends school. The others have dropped out. Lassine has been in this line of work for 17 years, and was motivated to be a farmer because farming is a long held family tradition (it is the primary source of revenue and enables a household's food self-sufficiency) and he wanted to be able to ensure his family's food self-sufficiency. He was born and grew up in a farming community. Lassine grows groundnuts, maize and sorghum on his plot of land but, as a farmer, has to face problems such as a lack of rain. He has not had any problems with his fertiliser since joining myAgro.

Lassine is starting his third year with myAgro and re-enrolled because of the payment system and the good quality fertiliser. He really likes the myAgro training and the size of the plots of land. This year, Lassine will be making payments to buy a packet of myAgro fertiliser for maize production so that he can increase the yield on his 1 hectare plot of land. Lassine has been growing maize for 15 years because of its good yield. Once his output and income have increased, Lassine plans to increase the amount of land he cultivates and to buy more agricultural equipment. He would like to extend his land so that he can get more yield and sell the surplus. Finally, Lassine would like to be able to cover his children's educational costs and to build a house for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser for maize production.

loans.name: De Confianza Los Cerritos Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal  de Confianza los Cerritos está conformada por quince integrantes trece mujeres y dos hombres, madres y padres de familias responsables de veinte hijos, algunos menores de edad, los cuales están estudiando, son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de le región  y se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Todos se conoce entre si  y se apoyan en sus diferentes actividades económicas. 
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Lilliam y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, jabón, jugos, fósforos, gaseosas, hielo, galletas etc. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y aumentar su clientela y mantener su negocio,  y que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. De Confianza los Cerritos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a persona de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The De Confianza los Cerritos communal bank group is made up of fifteen members, thirteen women and two men, mothers and fathers responsible for 20 children, some of them minors, who are students. They are from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern zone of the region and are characterized as being hard-working, responsible and with desire to improve themselves. All know each other and support each other in their different economic activities. 

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Lilliam and she has a grocery store as her economic activity, a small store where she sells food such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, juice, matches, soft drinks, ice, cookies, etc. The business is located in her home. She works in her business twelve hours each day, selling her products. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and expand her customer base and maintain her business, and that in a not-so-distant future she can get better income. De Confianza los Cerritos is grateful for the help the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a respectable means of work.

loans.use: to purchase food such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, juices, matches, soft drinks, ice, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III.
La socia  Elena sigue dedicándose a  su negocio de venta de llantas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solcitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas entre otros.
La socia  se compromete a  pagar sus cuotas puntuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Member Elena belongs to the communal bank COMUZONE III.  She continues to work in her business selling tires. She is a responsible and hardworking woman and continues to sell her goods to her customers who request them, being that this is the way she provides for her family.

The member is requesting a loan to purchase tires, among other items. She commits to making her loan payments on time and in a very responsible manner.

loans.use: to purchase tires, among other items.

loans.name: Caserio Chuacruz 1 Group

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 37 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda hija de 17 años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Catarina (es la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, cuenta con un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes, ella tiene 4 años de tener este negocio.
Catarina es una mujer con la visión de superación, y muy optimista con el objetivo de hacer crecer su negocio está solicitando un crédito junto a un grupo de personas que tienen la iniciativa de prosperar día con día, ella invertirá el crédito  en su tienda comprado una variedad de mercaderías como arroz, frijol, golosinas, dulces.
El gran anhelo de Catarina es comprar un carro para movilizarse mejor con los productos de la tienda.
texts.en:
Catarina is a 37-year-old woman, married, and has a lovely daughter who is 17 years old. They live in a community in Sololá.

Catarina (the first on the left in the photo), with the desire to get income and support her husband with the household expenses, has a small business buying and selling groceries. She has had this business for 4 years.

Catarina is a woman with the vision of improving herself, and is very optimistic.  With the objective of growing her business, she is asking for a loan along with a group of people who have the initiative to prosper day by day. She will invest the loan in her store, purchasing a variety of merchandise such as rice, beans, sweets, and candies.

Catarina's great desire is to purchase a car to get around better with the store products.

loans.use: to buy and sell groceries such as rice, beans, sweets, and candies.

loans.name: Alhasan

texts.en: Alhasan is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kwabo Wambai village in Nigeria. Alhasan joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, he suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000 per hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize this year, Alhasan can now ensure that his children receive a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to buy improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Djeneba's Group

texts.fr: Djeneba qui se trouve sur la photo assise à gauche avec la pochette de myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 5 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Digato au sud de Bamako au Mali. Djeneba, âgée de 40 ans, est la mère de 9 enfants âgés de 2 à 22 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture qui lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Djeneba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 14 ans. Djeneba cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Djeneba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des engrais de qualité. Cette année Djeneba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 15 ans que Djeneba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Elle a expliqué que, "vu la grandeur de la famille, elle n'arrive pas à vendre son arachide." Djeneba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'étendre la surface cultivée. Enfin Djeneba espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Djeneba (sitting on the left in the picture, carrying a myAgro pouch) is a member of a group of 5 farmers who are enrolled with myAgro and who live and work in the village of Digato, in the south of Bamako in Mali. Djeneba, who is 40 years old, is the mother of 9 children aged between 2 and 22, 3 of whom currently attend school. Djeneba has been in this line of work for 14 years, and was motivated to be a farmer because farming is a long held family tradition (it is the primary source of revenue and enables a household's food self-sufficiency) and she wanted to be able to ensure her family's food self-sufficiency. Djeneba grows groundnuts rice on her plot of land but, as a farmer, has to face problems like a lack of rain, a lack of agricultural equipment and a lack of good quality fertiliser.

Djeneba is starting her first year with myAgro and enrolled because of the payment system and the good quality fertiliser. This year, Djeneba will be making payments for a package of myAgro OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertiliser for groundnut production, so that she can increase the yield on her 0.0625 hectare plot of land. Djeneba has been growing groundnuts for 15 years for their nutritional value, as groundnuts are directly consumable by the family and are used as an ingredient in a basic sauce used for food preparation, and because groundnuts produce good yields and good profits. Because of the size of her family, she does not have any surplus groundnuts to sell. Once her output and income have increased, Djeneba plans to raise livestock and to increase the amount of land she cultivates. Finally, Djeneba would like to be able to cover her children's educational costs and to ensure her family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: to buy a packet of OPV seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Ma. Tessie

texts.en:
A warm appreciation and gratefulness flows in Tessie's heart for the assistance she received from her previous loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She used the loan to buy more supplies of medicines and vitamin products for her drug store, which gave her additional income for her family. 

But Tessie still longs to further grow her business. This is why Tessie is asking to take out a loan worth 25,000 PHP that she will use to buy more stocks of medicines such as capsules, vitamins and syrups. 

With hope and faith, she believes that one day she will see her daughter become a successful professional. For now, she is working very hard to make that dream come true. She meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Mirbala

texts.en:
Mirbala is 53 years old. He's the father of three adult children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. He is a kind and hardworking man. In his brother's opinion, Mirbala  is very outgoing and welcoming.They live in the Agsu region. He couldn’t   get a higher education and because of that he decided to start his own business. For that he chose farming. He is growing fruits and vegetables in his own yard. Mirbala has two years of experience in this field.

But his  situation is very hard. He needs to raise fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes a problem for him. Because of this problem, the productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover the family’s needs. 

He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase the productivity again, and the family’s income will rise.

His goal is to continue working to support his children in all that they need, particularly to help those that are studying in univercity. Please support  him.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden weekly

loans.name: Gyulum

texts.en:
Gyulum and her family live in Arevshat village, which is in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and three-year-old granddaughter. 

Gyulum is farmer with 20 years experience of running a farm. Her farm is big and beautiful, so Gyulum and her husband work hard to sustain it. Specifically, they keep livestock (13 calves, 6 cows, 4 sheep, 3 pigs, 7 piglets and 10 hens) as well as cultivate wheat, barley, potatoes and grass as a forage for the livestock. Agriculture is the only source of the family's income and they work hard to develop it. 

Gyulum has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase potatoes, barley seeds and fertilizer to develop her farming business. Because the region where Gyulum's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. 

Gyulum's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potatoes, barley seeds and fertilizer needed for land cultivation

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Lizelda

texts.en:
This is Lizelda. She is 33 years old and currently resides with her husband, Ruel, in Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than four years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Lizelda would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 20,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Lizelda hopes to maintain an increasing profit from her business and then eventually save for the renovation of her store. Then if God will allow, she dreams to have her own supermarket someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operations.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Asylkan

texts.ru: Асылкан, 34 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование - высшее. Уже много лет она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Асылкан достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Асылкан имеется 1,0 Га земли,где она выращивает арбузы, а также 2 коровы и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку рассады и удобрений для выращивания экологичных арбузов. Доходы от кредита Асылкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Asylkan is 34 and married with four children. She has a higher education and has been working in agriculture and animal husbandry for many years. Thanks to her hard work and tireless effort, she has achieved great success in the development of her farm and now receives a monthly income of 20,000 KGS. She currently has 1 hectare of land on her farm where she grows watermelon, as well as two cows and 10 sheep.

With the goal of further developing her business, Asylkan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase seedlings and fertilizers so she can grow organic watermelon. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and purchasing a car.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers to cultivate her land so she can grow organic watermelon

loans.name: Ngoli

texts.en:
Ngoli is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Baby Gail

texts.en:
Baby Gail is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Caloocan City, Philippines. She is 37 years old and has three children. She is married to Renante, who helps to provide for the needs of the family. She operates a junk shop and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures. In addition to this, she also makes rugs for an additional source of income.

Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, and papers. They sell these items to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries and factories. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

Baby Gail is taking out a PHP 30,000 loan which she will incorporate into her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors.

She dreams of being successful someday with her business. She wants only for her children to grow in a good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy scraps and other recyclable materials from junk collectors.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Success will always follow if you have determination and hope. 

Here is Mary Jane, a woman driven with eagerness to work hard for her family. She is already 40 years of age and currently resides at Caloocan City, Philippines. What she basically does right now is manage a small welding shop in their community. Her husband, Rudy, serves as the main welder of the shop. Working hand in hand, they survive daily expenses through what they generate from the shop. 

Now, she would like a loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy needed materials for welding and for improving the shop itself. This will greatly help the family to gain a higher income than usual, which will hopefully make them a little better than usual. This can only happen through your tender hearts that are willing to help. 

Her dreams are simple. She just wants her children to complete college, her business to suddenly expand, and to help other people someday like how you are helping her. She truly hopes for your affirmative response regarding the matter. 

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy needed materials for welding and for improving the shop itself.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
In the Philippines, sari-sari stores are everywhere. Sari-sari (a term used for variety) store sells different kinds of products from biscuits, candies, canned goods, noodles, products used for personal hygiene and the like which are involved in every individual’s daily living. This is considered as one of the most common businesses built by ordinary people since it provides commodities for people. 

With this fact, Susan was enticed to get in touch with this kind of craft. She is 42 years old, married to a baker named Eusebio, and a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. By now, they are working with determination to pursue the needs of their family. The income they get from the store helps them for their daily expenditures. 

However, what profits they get from the business are sometimes insufficient. At times, she finds it hard to maintain supplies of various products due to financial incapability. This is why she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan that she will utilize to buy additional products for her inventory. With more products displayed in her store, she can ably have a greater increase in her income. 

In due time, she hopes that her business will grow with a boost in sales. Through this, she can earn and save money for a house someday if God will allow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise products for her inventory.

loans.name: Constence

texts.en:
Constence is married and has four children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated  a poultry farming business which earns her a source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbors. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for her business.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy local soap.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1980. She lives with her family. She is married and has one child. She is a teacher at a secondary school. She teaches the initial class. She is well known among students and teachers. She knows her duty very well and attentively takes care of each student at her classes. She needs to prepare and legalize her house documents. She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to legalize and prepare her house documents. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to legalize and prepare her house documents.

loans.name: Cingiz

texts.en: Cingiz is 55 years old, married and the father of four children. He began working as a merchant a year ago but now he is growing fruits and vegetables in his own yard. Cingiz has 3 years of experience in this field, thanks to his elder brother, but his situation is very hard. He needs to raise fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes a problem for him. Because of this problem, the productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover the family’s needs. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase the productivity again, and the family’s income will rise.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden weekly.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Junk, who can believe that there is still money in junk? While many people find it useless, Adela, 54 years old, still finds it as a way to generate a living. Aside from this, she also has a piggery business where she gets additional income for their family necessities. 

Since, trash is not well-managed in the country and is just thrown anywhere along the sidewalks and riverbanks, street dwellers usually collect such things that are still recyclable like copper, papers, plastics and metals. After collecting, their next destination is to the junk shop where they sell such for a corresponding price depending on the material. Usually, metals cost higher. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries and factories.
 
However, stable income from this kind of business is hardly predictable. Sometimes, the revolving fund that the junk shop operators use is not enough. This is why Adela is taking out a loan worth PHP 22,000 to add to her current revolving fund and also for improving the shop. 

With her husband, Emilio, they are truly hopeful that someday their lives will get better and that their children will finish their studies and build decent lives on their own. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week and to strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add to her current revolving fund and to improve the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and galvanized sheet metal to reconstruct the hallway of his house.

loans.name: Dúo Prosperos Group

texts.es: Dúo Prosperos: este grupo esta conformado por la señora Keren Adalis de 22 años de edad, ella tiene una venta de sandalias y productos toper, ella inicio su venta hace un año, y en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito ya que nececita comprar mas mercaderia para aumentar sus ventas ya que sus clientes le han echo pedidos y no tiene capital para invertir, desde ya les agradese por su ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en: The Prosperos Duo: This group includes Keren Adalis, who is 22 years old. She has a business selling sandals and plastic products. She started her business a year ago. At this time she is asking for this loan because she needs to buy more merchandise to increase sales. Her customers have ordered things from her and she has no capital to invest. She thanks you now for your help with her business.

loans.use: To buy sandals and plastic products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make and sell furniture.

loans.name: Zhamila

texts.ru: Жамила, 59 лет, вдова, есть 3 детей. У нее высшее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1986 года занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Жамилы есть 4 коровы, 12 овец. На участке мерою 0,30 Га собственной и 0,50 Га арендованной земли, где она выращивает ячмень. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 15,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Жамила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса хочет улучшить благосостояние семьи и  накопить на свадьбу сына и образование старшей дочери.
texts.en:
Zhamila is 59 years old, a widow, and has three children. She has higher education. As a main source of income for her family, she has worked with agriculture since 1986, after having started her business with 5,000 som (KGS). Zhamila has four cows and twelve sheep on her farm. She grows barley on 0.30 hectares of own land and 0.50 hectares of rented land. 

Zhamila's monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). This money is not enough for a decent life. Therefore, with an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase two steers to fatten and resell. 

Zhamila plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business. She would also like to improve the family's well-being and save money for her son's wedding and her eldest daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase two steers for fattening up and reselling, in order to increase her income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers so as to increase farm produce and get more crop products to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”LOS ANGELES”..
La socia  Lucia          alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose a  su negocio de venta de productos de salud, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracia s al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de productos para la salud.
La socia  se compromete a  pagar sus cuotas puntuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank Los Angeles.
The member Lucia alternates her daily activities, working in her business of selling health products. She gets along well in her business. It goes well because of the determination with which she approaches her business everyday.  She sells her merchandise to her clients that request it and this is how she is able to get her family ahead. 
She is requesting the loan to buy health products. She promises to make her payments punctually and with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy health products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
La socia Mary pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue dedicándose a   su negocio de venta de pescados y pollos, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea seguir trabajando para así de esta manera continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pescados entre otros.
texts.en:
Mary is a member of the "LOS ANGELES" communal bank which is located in the Department of Cusco. 

Mary is continuing to work at her business selling fish and chickens. She has been running the business for a while now and it brings her personal satisfaction. Mary is a responsible and diligent person and she wants to continue working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy fish, among other things.

loans.use: buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Yulduzkhon

texts.ru: Юлдузхон, 46 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Она ведет собственное дело- торгует продуктами питания, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, стартовав 5 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Юлдузхон, в ее бизнесе есть товар в обороте на сумму 80,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Юлдузхон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте за счет покупки продуктов питания (чая, макарон, масла, сахара, риса и т.д.). Доходы от кредита Юлдузхон планирует вложить в приобретение собственного торгового места, так как на сегодняшний день она арендует помещение для торговли.
texts.en:
Yulduzkhon is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has her own business, selling food products. This is a main source of income for her family, after she started it five years ago. Thanks to Yulduzkhon's persistent work, her business has inventory worth 80,000 som (KGS). The monthly income is around 19,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Yulduzkhon turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase the inventory through purchasing food products (tea, pasta, oil, sugar, rice etc.). Yulduzkhon plans to invest the income from her loan in purchasing her own store space, as she currently rents premises for her business.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of food products in her shop, in order to increase her profit and buy her own store space

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”.
La socia continua   dedicándose  a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería  sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia  se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche,golosinas entre otros.
texts.en: Marcelina belongs to the “LOS ANGELES” communal bank. She continues to work in her  grocery store business. She is a responsible and persevering person. She continues to sell her merchandise to the clients who request it, this being the way she gets her family ahead. She is grateful for the loan granted and promises to comply with the established payments. She is requesting the loan to buy milk and sweets amongst others.

loans.use: to buy milk and sweets amongst others.

loans.name: Jyldyzgul

texts.ru: Жылдызкул, успешно погасила кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодня есть 4 коровы, 3 лошади, 45 овец. На 0,98 Га земли выращивает люцерну. Благодаря упорному труду, Жылдызкул на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль 22,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 жеребцов. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Jyldyzgul successfully repaid her previous loan, after having used it as intended. She thanks Kiva and all those who helped her with the financing. She currently has four cows, three horses and 45 sheep on her farm. She grows alfalfa on 0.98 hectares of land. Thanks to persistent work, Jyldyzgul currently has an income of 22,000 som (KGS) per month.

With an aim to further develop her business, she again turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase four stallions. Jyldyzgul plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase four stallions in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Elnura

texts.ru: Эльнура, 30 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее - среднее образование, 11 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Эльнуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 7 коров, 26 овец, также есть 3,0 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает люцерну и ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Экологически чистая и вкусная сельскохозяйственная продукция Эльнуры пользуется большим спросом, принося ежемесячный доход около 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка для откорма. Доходы от кредита помогут Эльнуре развить ее бизнес и накопить средства на покупку весенне-летней одежды для детей.
texts.en:
Elnura is 30 years old, married and the mother of four children. She has secondary education and has worked with agriculture for 11 years. Thanks to Elnura's persistent work, her farm currently has seven cows, 26 sheep and also 3.0 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows alfalfa and barley for own use and sale. Elnura's ecological and tasty produce are in high demand, bringing in a monthly income around 9,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase a bull for breeding. The income from the loan will help Elnura develop her business and save money for purchasing spring and summer clothing for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a steer for breeding

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 44 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 8 y 22 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahuala.
Juan para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la albañilería, él tiene 25 años de realizar esta labor, pero para mejorar sus ingresos trabaja también como piloto automovilístico.
Juan desde hace algún tiempo ha visto una de las necesidades prioritarias que es la compra  de unas cuerdas de terreno, pues ellos no cuentan con terrenos suficientes, es por ello que solicita un préstamo para poder aprovechar un terreno que le están ofreciendo que mide 28 x 28  varas con cultivo de café y banano.
Juan sueña con poder construir una casa de bock y comprar otro mototaxi.
texts.en:
Juan is a 44 year old father of a family. He is married and has a beautiful family with 5 children between the ages of 8 and 22 years old. This humble family lives in a community in Nahuala. Juan works as a bricklayer in order to get his income and support his family. He has 25 years experience in this work and to improve his income he also works as an automobile driver.

A long time ago Juan realized that one of his necessary priorities was the purchase of some land as they do not have sufficient land. So he is requesting a loan to be able to take advantage of a plot of land that is being sold that measures 28 varas by 28 varas (a local measurement) with coffee and banana crops on it. Juan dreams of being able to build a cinder block house and buy another motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land 28 varas by 28 varas to grow coffee and bananas.

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.ru: Мавчигул очень рада за Вашу поддержку. Она успешно погасила предыдущий кредит. Сейчас у Мавчигул все идет прекрасно. Она продает детские одежды, полотенца, носки и детские футболки. К сожалению, у нее нет определенная торговая точка, и она ходит по улицам и по дамам, чтобы продавать вещей. Это бизнес является основной, потому что путем этой бизнесе она зарабатывает. Мавчигул больше старается, чтобы зарабатывать и прокормить детей. Мавчигул хочет расширить бизнес и увеличить доход. Она просит кредит для купли одежды на продажу. У Мавчигул мечта открыть свою торговую точку  и иметь больше разную одежду. Мавчигул верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mavjigul is very happy for your support. She successfully repaid her previous loan. Currently, everything is going well for her. 

Mavjigul sells children's clothing, towels, socks and children's t-shirts. Unfortunately, she does not have a specific sales point, and she walks the streets and from house to house in order to sell her goods. This business is important because she earns money from it. Mavjigul strives hard to earn money and feed her children.

Mavjigul would like to expand her business and increase her income. She requests a loan to purchase clothing for selling. Mavjigul dreams of opening her own store and have a larger assortment of clothing. She trusts in you and your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for selling, to expand her business and increase her income

loans.name: Dúo Luz De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Luz de San Pedro El Dúo está integrado por doña Ana Cristina de 22 años y tiene una hija y se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado, venta de cosméticos desde hace 8 años ella solicita su crédito para poder comprar ropa interior ya que actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y niña como blusas, pantalones, suéter y poder surtir mejor y tener variedad en sus productos a la hora de salir a ofrecer su mercadería ya que su venta es ambulante sus metas es poder abrir un pequeño local en su casa y ofrecer más sus productos para sus clientes, y poder construir su casa ya que es muy pequeño el espacio donde ella vive.
texts.en: Ana Cristina is a member of the Dúo Luz de San Pedro group.  She is 22 years old and has a daughter.  She has worked selling clothing, shoes, and cosmetics for the past 8 years.  She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase undergarments since she currently sells clothing for women and girls such as blouses, pants, sweaters and she would like to be able to stock more and have a better variety of products, when she is getting ready to leave to sell her merchandise since she sells on foot.  Her goals are to be able to open a small store in her home and offer more products for her customers and to be able to build a house since the space she lives in now is very small.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Marleni pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue con su negocio de venta de productos naturales, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales entre otros.
texts.en: Marleni belongs to the “LOS ANGELES” communal bank which is located in the city of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. She continues with her business of selling natural products. She has been in the business for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. She is a responsible and persevering person, this being the way she gets her family ahead. She is requesting the loan to buy natural products amongst others.

loans.use: to buy natural products amongst others.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA est mariée et mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes et chaussures depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés en ville.
Elle veut s’acheter  50 chaussures et 20pièces de pagnes.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour s’acheter  un hangar et ajouter d’autres activités. Mme ambitionne toujours pouvoir voyager elle-même à Lomé, Cotonou pour acheter ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Aminata is married and the mother of 4 children. The eldest is 25 years old and the youngest, 7. 4 of her children attend school. She supports 6 people.

Aminata has been selling pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing) and shoes for 6 years. She gets her supplies at the markets in town. She would like to use her profits to buy a shed and start other activities. She would still like to be able to travel to Lomé and Cotonou herself in order to buy her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes and 20 pagnes.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis tiene 53 años de edad, vive con dos hijos, uno estudia y la mayor le ayuda a su padre en las tareas del hogar, juntos habitan  en una pequeña casa en la ciudad de Santo Domingo. 
Luis desde muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio, actualmente él los días martes y jueves visita a las ferias ganaderas de la ciudad, donde compra y vende chanchos, en los otros días de la semana Luis desde muy temprano sale a recorrer en su triciclo a vender plátano en tiendas y restaurantes del sector, comenta que gracias a estos negocios él ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, darles la educación a sus hijos y poder comprar su casita.
Luis con el dinero va a comprar más chanchos ya que este negocio le deja más ganancias para solventar los gastos del hogar. Se siente feliz ya que gracias al crédito él podrá seguir aumentando su capital y mejorar sus ventas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Luis is 53 years old and lives with his two children. A son goes to school and the eldest, a daughter, helps her father with the household tasks. They live together in a small house in the city of Santo Domingo. 

From an early age Luis has engaged in commerce. Currently, on Tuesdays and Thursdays he visits the cattle markets in the city where he buys and sells pigs. On the other days of the week he goes out early to travel around on his tricycle selling plantains to stores and restaurants in the area. He says that thanks to these businesses he has been able to support his family, provide them with an education, and buy their small house. 

With the money, Luis is going to buy more pigs as this business generates more income for meeting the household expenses. He feels happy, as thanks to  the loan will be able to continue increasing his working capital and improve his sales so that he can succeed in life.

loans.use: To buy more pigs, as they are an excellent source of income. He will increase his working capital and move forward in life with his children.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Augusta pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para sus clientes que le solictan, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, leche entre otros.
texts.en: This partner is Mrs. Augusta, who belongs to the community bank "LOS ANGELES."  The bank is located in the Cuzco district, in the province of Cuzco and the department of Cuzco.  She continues with her grocery store business.  This partner is a responsible and hard-working person, and she continues selling rice, sugar, and milk, among other things her customers request, and this is the way she helps her family get ahead.  She is requesting this loan to purchase rice and milk among other things.

loans.use: to purchase rice and milk among other things.

loans.name: Zuura

texts.ru: Зуура, 53 года, замужем, мама 2 детей. Образование у Зууры- среднее. Она начала заниматься сельским хозяйством в 2002 году. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет: 14 коров и лошадей, 65 овец. Также Зуура выращивает картофель и люцерну для реализации на участке мерою 4,20 Га. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS). Зуура в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в расширение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Zuura is 53 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has secondary education. She started working with farming in 2002. Currently her farm has 14 cows and horses and 65 sheep. Zuura also grows potatoes and alfalfa for selling at a plot of land of 4.2 hectares. Her monthly income is up to 25,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Zuura turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. She plans to invest the income from her loan in expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with three children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Nancy has operated a butcher business for the past four years selling to the community and passersby. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan Nancy is requesting, she wants to purchase more goats to slaughter for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get access to the loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to slaughter for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of sachet water to sell and increase her income

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en:
Dyna is a 50-year-old working woman. She is shown in the photo with her son. 

After Dyna married, she felt that she should help her husband to improve their financial condition, so she started a business trading cloth in her locality. 

Dyna believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children through their education. She is famous among her neighbours for her collections and has a good client list. 

Dyna has taken out a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth in different colours to increase sales and earn substantial profits. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth in different colours to increase sales and earn substantial profits.

loans.name: Aishagul

texts.ru: Айшагул, 32 года, замужем, мать 3 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. У Айшагул- высшее образование, она знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. Айшагул знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей продуктами питания, стартовав 2 года назад, ранее работала учителем. Благодаря упорному труду Айшагул, ее ежемесячный доход составляет 21,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айшагул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте, за счет покупки продуктов питания, также установит камеру видео наблюдения. Доходы от кредита Айшагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса, она также мечтает приобрести собственное жилье.
texts.en:
Aishagul is 32 years old, married and the mother of three children of school and preschool age. Aishagul has higher education. She knows what she wants and achieves everything by herself. Aishagul knows how to budget and use money in the right way to reach her goals. 

As a main income for her family, Aishagul works with selling food products, after having started 2 years ago. Earlier she worked as a teacher. Thanks to Aishagul's persistent work, her monthly income is 21,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Aishagul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase the turnover through purchasing more food products. She will also install video surveillance. 

Aishagul plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business. She also dreams of purchasing her own home.

loans.use: to purchase food products to increase her turnover, and to install video surveillance

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”.
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de productos para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar para su negocio.
texts.en: The member belongs to the “LOS ANGELES” communal bank. She continues working in her grocery store. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments according to the established times. She continues to sell different types of products in her business such as rice, sugar and milk amongst others, this being her way to continue to support her family. She is requesting the loan to buy rice and sugar for her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar for his business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Thanks for your unwavering support of Merly. Because of the loan that you granted her recently, she was able to accomplish her goal to buy more supplies of merchandise products for her sari-sari (variety store). This has indeed aided the household's basic expenses and helped in attracting more customers as well. 

To continue what she started, Merly would like to avail another 15,000 PHP that she would use to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell in her business. Your small act of generosity now can be a good head start for Merly's dream of expanding her business, giving a better life for her family and providing all the needs of her children to finish their studies. 

Merly meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркул, 41 год, замужем, есть дети, все вместе они занимаются сельским хозяйством. Образование у Анаркул высшее, она работает директором школы. Анаркул добилась очень хороших результатов, у нее есть корова. Также на 3,0 ГА поливной земли, она выращивает картофель, фасоль. Ежедневно Анаркул реализует молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец на 50,000 сом (KGS), остальная часть средств будет направлена на полеводство. На прибыль от кредита Анаркул планирует увеличить своё хозяйство и построить дома забор.
texts.en:
Anarkul is 41 years old, married and has children. Together they work with agriculture. Anarkul has higher education. She works as a school principal. Anarkul has achieved very good results and now has a cow and 3.0 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows potatoes and haricots. She sells milk every day. The monthly income is around 19,000 som (KGS).

To further develop her business, Anarkul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep for 50,000 som (KGS). The remaining funds will be used for cultivating her land. Anarkul plans to use the income from the loan to improve her business and build a fence for her house.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening up and reselling, and to cultivate her land

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул, 24 года, не замужем, детей нет. У нее неоконченное высшее образование, по характеру, ответственная, доброжелательная, вежливая. Айгул занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Айгул ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 5 овец, 7 коз. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса и хочет накопить на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en:
Aigul is 24 years old. She is not married and does not have any children. She has an unfinished higher education. As a person she is responsible, friendly and polite.

Aigul works with agriculture. Thanks to her persistent work her business currently brings in around 10,000 som (KGS) per month. She has two cows, five sheep and seven goats on her farm.

With an aim to further develop her business, Aigul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for breeding. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business. She would also like to save money for purchasing furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for breeding in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 42-year-old, married woman and mother of five children. One of her sons is also shown in the photo with her. 

Her husband started a van-driving business, some time ago. He owns one van and needs some financial help. Therefore, Gulshan has availed herself of a Murabaha of 30,000 PKR, for her husband. He utilized this amount to pay for repairs and maintenance costs of the van. Gulshan hopes that her husband’s business will prosper in the future.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of her husband's van.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида, 42 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование у нее среднее, общий трудовой стаж около 16 лет. Аида занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. На 1,05 Га земли выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячную прибыль составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). Аида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и 10 овец.  Аида является участником группы "Ак-Тилек 2013", всего в группе 3 человека. Свои доходы Аида планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Aida is 42 years old, married and has three children. She has secondary education and has around 16 years of work experience. Aida works with farming. She has two cows and ten sheep on her farm. She grows haricots on 1.05 hectares of land. The monthly income is around 12,000 som (KGS).

Aida turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow and ten sheep. Aida is a member of the group "Ak-Tilek 2013". There are three members in the group. Aida plans to invest her income in further improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and ten sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un padre de familia de 28 años de edad, es soltero tiene una linda hija que se encuentra aún bajo el cuidado de la mama, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Para Francisco no hay nada más importante que su familia, es por eso que para generar sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de pollo, esta actividad lo tiene el dese hace cinco años.
Francisco solicita un préstamo para poder remodelar el gallinero porque con el paso de los años se ha ido deteriorando, y necesita hacer una ampliación de su gallinero para que pueda comprar más pollos el comprara laminas, madera y clavos.
El gran sueño de Francisco es contar con otros dos gallineros para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 28 years old, single, and has a beautiful daughter who is cared for by her mother.  They live in the community of Sololá.  For Francisco, there is nothing more important than his family.  They are why he has worked buying and selling chickens for five years.

Francisco is requesting a loan to be able to renovate his chicken coop.  With the passing of time, it has deteriorated, and he needs to expand it to be able to purchase more chickens.  He will use the loan to purchase metal sheeting, wood, and nails.

Francisco's dream is to build two more chicken coops to improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, wood, and nails to remodel a chicken coop.

loans.name: Sata's Group

texts.fr: Sata qui se trouve sur la photo tenant les deux pochetes en main, est membre d’un groupe de 10 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Semana au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Sata, âgée de 47 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 8 à 20 ans, et dont l'1 d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Sata à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Sata cultive l'arachide, le maïs sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Sata entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Sata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Sata cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Sata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Sata espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants .
texts.en:
Sata (carrying two pouches in the picture) is a member of a group of 10 farmers who are enrolled with myAgro and who live and work in the village of Semana, in the south east of Bamako in Mali. Sata, who is 47 years old, is the mother of 4 children aged between 8 and 20, one of whom currently attends school. Sata has been in this line of work for 20 years, and was motivated to be a farmer because farming is a long held family tradition (it is the primary source of revenue and enables a household's food self-sufficiency) and she wanted to be able to ensure her family's food self-sufficiency. Sata grows groundnuts and maize on her plot of land but, as a farmer, has to face problems like a lack of rain, a lack of agricultural equipment and a lack of good quality fertiliser.

Sata is starting her first year with myAgro and enrolled because of the payment system and the good quality seeds and fertiliser. This year, Sata will be making payments for a package of myAgro OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertiliser for groundnut production, so that she can increase the yield on her 0.0625 hectare plot of land. Sata has been growing groundnuts for 20 years because of their commercial value, as groundnuts are one of the foodstuffs that she sells at the market. Sata plans, thanks to an increase in output and income, to keep doing business. Finally, Sata would like to be able to cover her children's educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy a package of OPV seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 45-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 4 children; one of her sons is also shown in the photo. She has been operating a business buying and selling cattle for many years with her husband. She earns a good income that covers her everyday expenses. To improve her business, Samina is taking a Murabaha loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase more cattle to resell in the market and therefore provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market and therefore provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build another bedroom in her home.

loans.name: Gie Fass Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Fass Diom de l’association ALLAW regroupe cinq personnes pécheurs ou mareyeurs, vivant dans le même quartier, rassemblés pour bénéficier d’un financement de l’IMCEC. 
La présidente, madame Nogoye, s’active dans le mareyage et cela depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont l’ainé, âgé de 28 ans et la cadette de 17 ans. 
Chaque jour, madame Nogoye démarre sa journée à 8h et la termine à 18h de l’après-midi. Elle se procure le poisson à partir des piroguiers, qu’elle revend sur la plage et à sa clientèle dans son quartier. Elle rentre chaque jour avec un bénéfice minimum de dix milles francs. Cet argent qui lui permet de soutenir ses enfants dans leurs entreprises ; c’est d’ailleurs son souci majeur qui la motive toujours dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Gie Fass Diom group of the ALLAW association groups together 5 people who are fishers or fish sellers. They live in the same district and got together so that they would be able to benefit from a UIMCEC loan.

The leader of the group, Nogoye, has been a fish seller for 15 years. She is married and the mother of 3 children, the eldest of whom is 28 years old and the youngest, 17. Nogoye starts each workday at 8 am and finishes at 6 pm. She gets her fish from the pirogue fishermen and resells it on the beach and to customers in her district. She gets home each day with a minimum profit of 10 000 francs. This money enables her to support her children in their businesses; this is indeed her main concern and what motivates her to keep working.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wheelbarrows to transport and supply bricks to construction sites and to better support his family.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
