La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Natividad alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, menestras carnes  para su negocio.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Los Angeles” (“The Angels”). The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Natividad alternates her daily activities, dedicating herself to the business of selling food. She has spent a good amount of time dedicated to this business, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in everyday. She wants to be able to continue working, so that she can continue helping her family.

She requests the loan to buy rice, oil, vegetable soups, and meat for her business.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her repayments according to the set schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, vegetable soup, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 35-year-old, married woman. She has three children. The man shown in the photo is her husband. She has been running a business of buying and selling livestock. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. The business is providing Nasreen and her husband with enough income to support their family. However, she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenses, including food, health, and clothing. In order to increase her earnings, Nasreen has taken a Murabaha loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy more baby goats to sell to grow the business. This will help improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats to sell to grow her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and workers to repair the sink in her home.

loans.name: Gul Naz

texts.en: Gul Naz is a 29-year-old, married woman. She has three children; one of her children is also shown in the photo. She has been running a business buying and selling livestock. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Her business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenses, including food, health, and clothing. In order to increase her earnings, Gul Naz has taken a Murabaha loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy more baby goats to sell to expand the business. This will help improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats to sell to grow her business, which will help improve her family’s living standards.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: El grupo “RENACER” está conformada por mujeres trabajadoras y responsables dedicadas al comercio minoristas. Fiorella tiene 39 años de edad es casada con 04 hijos educando.  Ella implemento su restaurant en cual trabaja hace varios años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sillas y mesas nuevas para dar a buena atención a sus clientes. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su restaurant. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Fiorella es la tercera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
The Renacer group is made up of hardworking and responsible women who all have small businesses.  

Fiorella is 39 years old, married, and has four children attending school.  She has owned a restaurant for many years.  She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of new tables and chairs to give her customers a better experience.  Her greatest hope is to expand her restaurant.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan provided.  Fiorella is the third person on the left side.

loans.use: to purchase new tables and chairs.

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es: José de 20 años de edad, llegó a Barranquilla a iniciar su propio negocio de venta de cerdo.  En su pueblo natal San Juan de Nepomuceno,  ubicado en el departamento de Bolívar en compañía de su padre se dedicó a ésta actividad desde muy joven, hoy en día sus relaciones comerciales se mantiene con proveedores y familiares de su pueblo a quienes cancela sus compras de contado.  José ofrece carne de cerdo a restaurantes y habitantes del barrio en el que reside,  ubicados en la localidad de Riomar dos veces por semana y ha logrado incrementar su clientela gracias a los referidos de sus clientes.  José ofrece facilidad de pago a algunos clientes, sin embargo su capital es escaso para poder cumplir con todos los pedidos, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en carne de cerdo.  Esta inversión tiene como objetivo incrementar las ventas y con ello sus ganancias.  José a su corta edad tiene metas a futuro muy prometedoras; comprar una casa y tener un local para ofrecer carne de cerdo.
texts.en:
Jose is 20 years old. He arrived at Barranquilla to start his own business selling pigs. In his native town of San Juan de Nepomuceno, located in the department of Bolívar, he dedicated himself to this activity from a young age. Today, he maintains his business relationships with suppliers and relatives in his town, who he pays in cash for his purchases. 

Jose offers pig meat to restaurants and residents of the neighborhood, in which he lives, located in the area of Riomar, two times per week. He has succeeded in increasing his clients thanks to references from his existing clients. Jose offers ease of payment to some clients. His capital is scarce to meet all of his orders. 

At present he is applying for a Kiva loan, which is first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest it in pig meat. He makes this investment with the goal of increasing his sales and his earnings. 

At his young age, Jose has very promising future goals. He wants to buy a house and have a location for selling pig meat.

loans.use: to invest in pig meat.

loans.name: Naciendo Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Naciendo con Esperanza está conformada por nueve integrantes siete mujeres  y dos hombres, madres y padres responsables de familia casados con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región.  Todos tienen diferentes actividades económicas por la cual lucha día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias. 
Gracias a sus ganas de salir  adelante la coordinadora es  Erika y  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, sal, jugos, galletas, fósforos etc. Ella dedica unas doce horas diarias a su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles. Naciendo con Esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y pises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Naciendo con Esperanza village bank is made up of nine members - seven women and two men, mothers and fathers responsible for the family, married with ten children under their responsibility. They are from Sauce, a place that's located in the northern zone of the region. All have different economic activities for which they fight day by day to get their families ahead.

Thanks to her eagerness to get ahead, the coordinator is Erika and she has a grocery store as an economic activity. It's a small store that sells edible products like: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, salt, juices, cookies, matches, etc. She works at her business some twelve hours a day so that in the not-so-distant future she can obtain better income. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business in the purchse and sale of edible products. 

Naciendo con Esperanza is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors provide to the people of scarce resources and downtrodden poor like in Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to buy edible products like: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, salt, juices, cookies, matches, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Emelina

texts.es:
Rosa, de 48 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela porque sus padres pensaban que estudiar no servia de nada; está  acompañada y tiene una niña de 9 años de edad y estudia quinto grado.

Rosa, trabaja como empleada doméstica en casas particulares desde que era muy joven.- 

Rosa, hoy en día quiere un préstamo para colocar su propio cafetín, en el cual pueda generar ganancias y asi poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar; su compañero de vida es motorista, ella planea colocar el cafetín enfrente de la unidad de salud de su comunidad.

El sueño de Rosa, es que su hija estudie una carrera universitaria, para que se pueda desenvolver en la vida laboral.- Por otra parte, pretende mejorar su vivienda con las ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old. She didn’t attend school because her parents thought that studying was not important. She is in a relationship and has a daughter, who is 9 years old and studies in fifth grade.

Rosa has worked as a domestic employee in specific houses since a young age.

Today, Rosa wants a loan to start her own café, from which she can generate earnings and, thus, help her husband with the household expenses. Her husband is a driver. She plants to establish the café in front of the health center in her community.

Rosa’s dream is for her daughter to go to university, so that she will be able to go beyond the working life. She also hopes to improve her house with her earnings.

loans.use: to start her own cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la reparación de aparatos electrónicos tiene 17 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, tiene muchos clientes por el buen trabajo, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como puede salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos para electrodomésticos  por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poder tener una mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Rafael lives in a house he owns with his wife.  He has worked repairing electronic devices for 17 years.  His good work has attracted many customers.  His income from this work supports his household expenses.  

He is requesting a loan to purchase parts for appliances at wholesale to be able to continue with his work, since it is the only source of income for his family and it will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase parts for appliances at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, items for parties, for the home, for personal use, among others.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is a 46-year-old rural woman who lives with her husband and two children (one daughter and one son) in a small village of Alipurduar.  Both of her children are studying in grade 9 and 10, respectively. Laxmi and her husband, Dipak, had received education till grade 6. 

Laxmi works as a nurse, but her husband runs a sewing business. He has a sewing machine. He stitches small clothing like shirts, frocks, trousers and ladies garments and sells them to his neighbors and people in the local area. Now Laxmi is interested in engaging herself in the business to help her husband because she knows if her husband works alone for the family, they will never be able to meet the growing household expenses and their children’s educational expenses. At this time, she is continually working hard with her husband to provide additional income for the family.

So Laxmi has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase necessary materials for sewing like reels of threads, fabrics, buttons, etc., in order to expand their business. She wants to meet the increasing demand of her customers. Her neighbors are her main customers.

She hopes to develop her family-run sewing business and dreams of giving a good quality of education to her children through all her hard work. 

She gives her thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for her existing family-run sewing business.

loans.name: Shefali

texts.en:
Shefali is a 38-year-old rural housewife from a small village, Palashbari in Alipurduar, West Bengal. She has two children (one son and one daughter). She and her husband, Shaymal, both have received education up to grade 7 and could not continue their studies further due to their families' financial problems. Their first priority is to provide a quality education to their children. 

Shefali's husband runs a business of repairing different types of vehicles in his garage. Prior to his business, her husband learned repairing work and gathered those experiences and opened his own garage where he repairs cycles, vans, auto rickshaws, cars, etc. But due to the competitive market, there are many other garages nearby, so it has become very difficult for them to run the business smoothly. 

Shefali requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase more modern tools and machinery so that her husband can do all types of repairing work to enhance their business. 

She hopes that this loan will give a boost to her husband’s business, as well as the lifestyle of her family, with the profit generated from this business. She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts and other modern machinery for her husband's garage.

loans.name: Basana

texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Basana is a married woman who lives with her husband and two daughters at Latapata village in Falakata. She is a housewife who looks after her two infant daughters and manages household chores. She is illiterate and able to sign her name only, while her husband completed his education up to grade 6. They have a small house made of mud and straw. 

Basana's husband cultivates seasonal vegetables and crops on his farmland. The major part of the region is covered with agricultural land. Basana and her husband are working hard, but the income of INR 7,000 from the yield is not enough to overcome her family’s anomalies. As Basana is very energetic, enthusiastic and determined to shape her future through sheer hard work and cooperation, she wants to increase the productivity and cultivate paddy now because it has a great demand in her area.

So she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds and other necessary farm supplies for paddy cultivation. With the profit generated by paddy cultivation, she hopes that she will be able to increase her family’s economic status and raise her standard of living. In the future, she wants to construct a concrete house.

She is very thankful to her lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and other necessary farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 21 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de la aldea madre mía.
Ana es una muchacha que trabaja  de sol a sol para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa, ella para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ya tiene seis años de realizar esta labor.
Para Ana hacer crecer su negocio siempre ha sido su mayor anhelo, pero a pesar de todos sus sacrificios esto no ha sido posible, es por eso que ahora solicita un crédito porque ella se ha dado cuenta que es la única forma de hacer su sueño realidad, con el préstamo Ana comprara cortes, blusas, fajas de diferentes colores, estilos y precios.
La otra meta de Ana es tener una casa de terraza, y tener un local para su venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman of 21. She is single, and lives next to her parents in a community of the Madre Mía village.

Ana is a girl who works from sunrise to sunset to help her parents with the household expenses. To obtain income, she works in the buying and selling of traditional clothes, and she has been doing this for 6 years.

To make her business grow has always been Ana's greatest wish, but despite all her efforts, this has not been possible. This is why she is now requesting a loan, because she realizes that this is the only way to make her dream come true. With the loan, Ana would buy traditional skirts, blouses, and belts of different colors, styles, and prices.

Ana's other goal is to have a terraced house and a shop in which to sell her clothes.

loans.use: To buy traditional clothing such as skirts, blouses, and belts.

loans.name: Filwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est responsable du groupe FILWENDE. Bintou se porte bien mais ne fait plus partie du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 14ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration depuis 14ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. 
Elle veut s’acheter 03sacs de 50kg de riz, 01bidon de 20l d'huile et 01 carton de tomates.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle désir épargné. Elle ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et construire sa parcelle.
texts.en:
Mme Fatimata is the representative of the group Filwende. Bintou [who used to be leader] is doing fine, but she is no longer in the group. Fatimata is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 14 years old. Two of the four attend school. 

Mme Fatimata has been selling cooked food for 14 years. She buys her supplies in the market in her district. She wants to buy  three sacks of 50 kg each of rice, one jerrycan of 20 liters of oil, and one case of tomatoes. With her profit, she desires to put aside savings. Her ambition is to improve living conditions for her family and build on her plot of land.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of 50 kg each of rice, one jerrycan of 20 liters of oil, and one case of tomatoes

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is a 27-year-old rural woman. She is married and lives with her husband in the village of Latapata in Falakata. Beauty has completed higher secondary education and could not study further because of the financial constraints of her family. Her husband, Tapas, has completed the secondary level education.

She is now a housewife who is young and active and assists her husband in agricultural activities. Her husband grows different types of vegetables and crops in his farmland. Now, her husband ventures to cultivate maize on his farmland to diversify his agribusiness. As the crop has a tremendous acceptability in the market, Beauty and her husband expect good revenue from it.   

So she is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner), as they have no working capital. Beauty will invest this new loan in buying high yield maize seeds, fertilizers and manure, which will ultimately help in generating more income and productivity as well. She hopes it will improve her family’s financial status for leading a smooth, secured life.

Beauty is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Bharati

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Bharati is a hardworking lady from Alipurduar. She lives in a small village, Palashbari in Alipurduar, with her husband, Swapan, and two children (one son and one daughter). She has completed her education up to grade 8, while her husband is illiterate, able to sign his name only. One of her children is now in grade 1, and the other one is too small for going to school. 

Being a homemaker, Bharati looks after her family and works tirelessly from dawn to dusk to raise her children. Her husband, Swapan, runs his auto repairing business in his local area. He repairs and renovates autos and sometimes also sells some auto spare parts like horns, tires, brakes, etc. But due to the competitive market, there are many auto repairing shops in his local area, so the upturn of the business depends on the availability of customers. 

As Swapan is the only income holder of the family, Bharati decided to enhance her husband’s business. So she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more auto spare parts, modern tools and machinery so that her husband can run the business smoothly.

She hopes that she will be able to enhance her husband’s business better with the outcome of profit from the business. Bharati is thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, tools and other materials for her husband’s auto repairing business.

loans.name: Christine Mary

texts.en:
Christine Mary owns a food stall in Pasay City, Philippines. She has been operating the business for almost four years now. She has two children and is married to Brian, who is also a vendor. Whatever income she gets basically from her chosen trade, she uses for helping her husband in covering the family expenses. 

Filipinos are fond of eating heavy meals. Unlike some of foreign countries where people are only used to eating bread for lunch or dinner, most Filipinos can’t afford to not eat rice with dishes during lunches and dinners. So it is a big help to most when there are food stalls at hand along the roads where they can eat  without going home to cook. Perhaps this is the reason why  Christine Mary has chosen to manage a food stall. Since food is always in demand, she earns good profit from this. 

However, Christine Mary still wants to expand her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000. She will use this to buy more raw ingredients needed for her recipes. She wants to express to you her sincerest thanks for your goodness and generosity until now. 

In the future, she wants her family to experience progress and improve as well in her current business, to be able to save money for a future house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients needed for her recipes.

loans.name: Maqabra

texts.en:
Maqabra is a 45-year-old married woman who has been running a milk-selling business for many years with the help of her husband. She sells milk to the people of her locality. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.

 For the improvement of her business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Gul Shad

texts.en:
Gul Shad is a 45-year-old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) runs a bakery business and makes and sells bakery items. He offers various bakery items and has become famous in his town for proving delicious bakery goods. He also takes orders from nearby shops and people of their community and earns enough to lead a decent life. 

Currently, Gul Shad has requested a Murabaha-type loan of 35,000 PKR for her husband’s business to buy a stock of flour and baking powder along with packs of oil and sugar at lower rates from the market. This would enable him to expand his sales which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy stock of flour and baking powder along with packs of oil and sugar at lower rates from the market.

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa is a 30-year-old rural woman. Unfortunately she was deprived of education in her childhood due to  her parents' lack of economic resources. She is married now. Her husband Jaganananda is engaged in agricultural activities. Champa is the mother of three sons; one of whom is in school in grade 6. The others are preschoolers. They live in Jogendrapur village in Falakata.
 
Champa's husband has a farm where he grows different vegetables in different seasons. He struggles hard to grow good-quality vegetables to satisfy his customers, but his earning is not as much as he expects. His land is very fertile and productive. So, he has decided to cultivate bitter gourd on the farmland. The main obstacle is capital.

Champa is also a very hardworking and enterprising lady. Though she is a housewife, she helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Now she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase agricultural supplies such as bitter gourd seeds, manure, etc. She hopes the business will be a lucrative one, as bitter gourd has a very good demand in the market; that is why they have chosen this crop to cultivate.

Her goals are to strengthen her family business and provide a better education to her sons. Her desire is to take a plot of land on lease for expanding their agricultural business.

She thanks her lenders for helping her financially.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for bitter gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Nazima

texts.en:
Nazima is a married mother of three children. Some time ago, her husband, who is also shown in the photo above, started a business driving a taxi. He earns a good income, though he needs some financial help to pay for the repair and maintenance of his taxi. 

Therefore, Nazima requested a murabaha-type loan of 30,000 PKR on behalf of her husband. She is hopeful that both her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Hasrat

texts.en:
Hasrat is a 50-year-old, hardworking woman who has six children; one of her son's is also shown in the photo. She has been providing a service of stitching clothes in her locality for many years. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. 

Hasrat’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good customer base. 

Currently, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and laces. 

She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and laces.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia, 27 years old, is a very enthusiastic person. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a general store. He offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, he needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. For this reason, Fouzia has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for her husband, who bought additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, he will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at his store and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to enable her husband to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en:
Neelam is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is motivated to provide all of the necessities of life for her family. Her husband, who is also shown in the photo, has been running a small mobile shop successfully for many years; he sells various items such as calling cards, mobile accessories, chargers, etc. 

 For the improvement of her husband’s business, Neelam has accessed a murabaha-type loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile batteries. Now her husband can meet the increasing demands of his customers and generate more revenue. Neelam wishes to utilize part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile batteries for her husband's bsuiness.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 49-year-old married woman. She has been running a beauty parlor business for about two years. The man shown in the photo is her son. 

Naheed offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hairstyling, facials, etc. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family's income. 

Now she needs to provide more customers with regular services. Therefore, she requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin care products, and creams for bleaching and whitening, in large quantities. 

She is confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin care products, and creams for bleaching and whitening, in large quantities.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; La socia sigue con su negocio de venta de papa, la socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de papa entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Los Angeles", which is located in the Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco.  Gregoria continues her business selling potatoes, is happy for the loan and is committed to making repayments on time.  She continues selling in one of the markets in the city of Cusco.

She wants to be able to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.  She is requesting the loan to buy potatoes and other goods for her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and other goods for her business.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en: Tengiz is a 28-year-old married man. He lives in the Batumi district with his wife and pensioner parents. Tengiz works at a local dental clinic as a dentist. He wants to open his own dental room and needs money. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 USD. With the received credit he will purchase all the special dental chairs and will open a dental clinic. He is a good dentist and hopes that he will have a good number of clients.

loans.use: to open a dental clinic.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Her greatest monthly expense is for domestic uses.

She has operated computer services for the past four years, serving the community. She mentioned theft and lack of capital as her major challenges in her place of operation.

With the loan she wants to purchase another computer for her business. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase another computer for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to cook and sell at her food stand.

loans.name: Buhari

texts.en: Buhari is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dutse Village. He joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Buhari will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This season, Buhari  has grand plans to harvest 100 bags. This will see him increase his household income significantly. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Buhari now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farm yields.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, 43 years old, is married to Stephen and supports a family of six members. She has been practicing small scale farming for the last seven years, earning an income of KES 9,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to improve her farming and raise more income to improve family living standards. Her plans are to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her farming activity. Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: To improve her farming and raise more income to improve family living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder to make tortillas.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers waiting too long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. She hopes this will enable her to get more produce to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest and meet both client and family needs after making sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Umbo Village. She joined Babban Gona to expand her farm and grow her agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Elizabeth will have access to the best farm inputs on the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Elizabeth now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farming yields.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is married with four children who attend school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a business selling khangas (wraps, worn by women), selling from home and door to door to neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (wraps, worn by women) for resale.

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es: “UNIDOS AL FUTURO” es un grupo  conformado por socios ansiosos por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Esilda  tiene 56 años de edad es soltera con hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas palta chirimoya y queso. Y a la vez se dedica al cuidado de niños. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas palta chirimoya al por mayor para luego expenderlos por kilos de manera ambulatoria. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Esilda viste polo de color turquesa.
texts.en:
"Unidos al Futuro" is a group made up of members who are eager to improve their families' quality of life.

Eslida is 56 years old, and is single with independent children.  She works selling fruits such as avocado and cherimoya, as well as cheese.  She also works in childcare.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of fruit bought wholesale which she will later sell by the kilo as a mobile vendor.  The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  Eslida is seen in the turquoise shirt.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as avocado and cherimoya.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her farming through adoption of modern farming techniques to boost her productivity.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 38 years old from Sagarejo, Kakheti region, East Georgia. He lives with his wife and three children. Ramaz is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a vineyard and produces wine to sell locally. Besides that, he has hens and the family sells eggs. Ramaz wants to expand his agricultural activities and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 5,500 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase piglets and will raise them in order to resell them at a higher price. This will increase his income and with the increased income Ramaz will improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, raise them and resell them at a higher price.

loans.name: Hilda Amalia

texts.es: Hilda de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración piñatas para fiestas de cumpleaños desde hace 7 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ventas que realiza ha logrado cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Doña Hilda esta solicitando por tercera vez un crédito para comprar más materiales como: papeles de todo tipo de colores, pegamento, alambre, papel de diario entre otras cosas que le sirven para la elaboración ya que le esta yendo bien con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Hilda is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her two children.  She works making piñatas for birthday parties.  She has had her business, which is located in her home, for 7 years.  The sales she makes have been able to cover the household expenses.

Hilda is requesting a third loan to buy more materials such as colored paper, glue, wire, and newspaper for her production since her business is going well.

loans.use: to buy colored paper, glue, wire, newspapers and other materials to make piñatas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Jyoti

texts.en:
Jyoti is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her husband Amal and four children (two sons and two daughters) in Singijani village in Falakata, West Bengal in their own kaccha house (made of straw and mud).  All her children are receiving a secondary grade education. She has received a grade four level primary education and her husband is illiterate and only knows how to sign his name. 

Her husband is a farmer. He has been in this profession for the last few years and owns a plot of land where he is cultivating a variety of food crops. Jyoti plays a major role in helping her husband in all his farm activities. The income they earn is inadequate for a six-member family. At present, they want to cultivate maize on their farm land. 

She wants to purchase the resources necessary to carry out sustainable agriculture with quality maize seeds, manure and other things. So Jyoti is seeking a loan from Kiva via BJS. This will help them to grow more maize. 

With the additional profit generated by maize cultivation, Jyoti hopes to build a concrete house for the future. 

She is happy and thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs like seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more primary materials, such as rice, chickens, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc., for her food stall.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Ana de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, Doña Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 57 years old and lives in her own home with her husband.  She has had a bakery for the past 8 years, which is located at her place of residence.  She has many customers because of the quality of bread that she makes.  Her earnings are able to cover the household expenses.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, jams, baking tins, etc. so that she can continue her work so that she can have a greater income and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, jams, baking tins, etc. for her bakery.

loans.name: Priyanka

texts.en:
Rabindranagar is a small village in Alipurduar district. Most of the residents of that village are engaged in small-scale home-based enterprises to run their families smoothly. Priyanka, 22 years old, lives with her husband and one son. Her son is a preschooler. Priyanka is a very dynamic woman. She looks after her son, does household chores, helps her husband in his business and after managing all these activities, she is pursuing her B.A. in Education.

Priyanka's husband is doing a business selling snack food. They mainly sell 'Chanachur' (called in Bengali language), which is a tiffin time snack and is normally eaten with puffed rice or taken with tea and other snack items. They purchase a bulk quantity of snack food items from the wholesale market and supply them to the local shops or to individuals. As they sell a good quality product, the demand for it is high in their locality. 

Now Priyanka wants to expand their business by taking a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner. It will help them to buy more stock of snack items. She expects a good return from the business by expanding it. She hopes to give her whole family a bright future through this loan.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for being so generous.

loans.use: To purchase more snack items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and farm implements so as to improve her farming activity and meet family needs and educate her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To lease land and plant grafted bananas to which she will add value for more income .

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married mother  of two children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a poultry selling business from home, selling to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for resale

loans.name: Marhamatjon

texts.en:
Marhamatjon is a consciencious woman. She was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1948.  She is a widow and has eight children. 

After the death of her husband she was responsible for the upbringing of her children alone. She does a business of selling dried fruits like apricots. She processes apricots and dries them.  She also grows corn and sells them in the big markets. 

From the income from her business, she supports her 8 children and feeds the family. Now she is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy more  apricots for drying. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy apricots for her dried business and to support her eight children on her own

loans.name: Ana Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana de 47 años de edad vive n casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, ella se dedica  a la venta de antojitos como: tostadas de tajaditas de papas, yuca y platanitos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar muy transitado cerca de su lugar de residencia, por esa razón posee mucha clientela, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: yuca, papa, plátanos, aceite, etc. todo por mayor para la elaboración de estos alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her husband who works as a bricklayer.  She works selling snacks such as: toasted potato slices, yucca, and fried plantain chips.  Her business is located in a busy area close to her home; for this reason, she has many customers.

She is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of raw ingredients such as yucca, potatoes, bananas, oil, etc.  In this way she will gain a greater income to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale ingredients to make and sell food.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a 51-year-old rural woman who lost her husband a few years back. She lives in Falakata in West Bengal, India with her two sons. They are now working as cultivators on their agricultural field.

Fatema's husband had been practicing farming. Since his death, she and her sons are managing the agribusiness. She is motivated to give financial sustenance to the family. So they work tirelessly to attain their goal. The land they work on is fertile to cultivate maize. The income for the family is being generated from the sale of maize in the market. Though a widow, Fatema is active and did not lose courage after her husband's death; rather, she kept supporting her sons to grow their family business. 

She is now requesting a loan from Kiva through BJS to improve her agribusiness, which will help her to improve her income by getting a high yield. With the loan, she will buy quality seeds and fertilizers to improve her maize cultivation.

She is thankful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva). She hopes to have a better future.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, manure and other agricultural supplies for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is 55 years old and supports a family of five members.
 
He has been a farmer for the last 13 years and earns KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizer and maize seeds for planting on his farm to get better produce when harvesting comes and meet client and family needs. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children to higher levels of education. 

His hope is to be financially stable and be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and maize seeds for planting

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 41 years old, married to Lydiah and they are blessed with six children. He does farming and has been in this business for the last 12 years. 

He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers to increase his farm produce and get more income to support his family.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and his future hopes are to expand his farming and make more income.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers to increase his farm produce and get more income to support his family.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a 38-year-old married woman from the village College Para in Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She lives with her husband and two school- going children (one son and one daughter). Namita is fortunate enough that she have had the opportunity of studying up to grade 11 in her childhood.  Her husband is a vegetable vendor, who has low income. Namita runs her own milk selling business for additional income. Her only concern is to provide education to her children. This determination and dedication acted as fuel in her life. 

She started this business few years back to help the family financially.  She has few cows, which gives real, delicious and ecologically pure milk to her neighbors & the local residents. There is a lot of demand for her cow milk and her numbers of customer increases day by day that is why she has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy another dairy cow. 

Namita relies on the good will of Kiva lenders and will be thankful to them for giving them a chance to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Rabeccah

texts.en: Rabeccah is a Babban Gona farmer from Umbo Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realize better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Rabeccah no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase her farmland. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, increasing her income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rabeccah now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To assist with paying for renovations, new shelving and some of her summer stock.

loans.name: Lungujja Group

texts.en:
Penninah is a married woman with two children and a member of the Lungujja group, a women's group. She runs a retail shop that she operates throughout the week to maximise profit. She has many customers since it is in a busy neighbourhood but also gets challenged by limited capital, where she cannot buy all the items demanded by her customers. 

She has therefore applied for a loan to meet that need. She is hard working and thanks his group members for standing by him and UGAFODE for meeting their financial needs.  They are hard working women whose goal is to succeed in life and educate their children.
Second left at the back is the UGAFODE credit officer in charge of the group loan.

loans.use: To boost her retail trade by buying more stock for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds and farm inputs for farming for high production.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he keeps cows which produce milk for sell. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of animal feeds. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy animal feeds. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds

loans.name: Jackton

texts.en:
Jackton is a married man and has 2 children. He describes himself to be loyal and honest. He operates a retail business where he sells spare motor parts. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spares. His business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of auto spares, to become a large supplier

loans.name: Kioko

texts.en:
Kioko is a single man. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes and has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
This is forty-three year-old Kumba.  She is single and has one child aged twenty-five. In 2005, Kumba established her cosmetics and toiletries business. She began her business because her elder sister assisted her with initial capital to start the business.  She wants to meet her child and her own personal needs. Her business is located in city center and her main customers are men & woman.  Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1080000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5000000 SLL.  Kumba requires a loan in order to buy additional cartons of mouth wash, tooth paste, body spray, Detol soap, baby powder, baby wipes etc. for resale.  She hopes that this loan will help to increase her stock and generate more income.  In the future, Kumba plans to buy a piece of land and became an international business woman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional cartons of mouth wash, tooth paste,etc.to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To put up a household toilet facility for his family and tenants

loans.name: Barau

texts.en:
Barau is a Babban Gona farmer from Bawa Wambai Vilage. Barau joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Barau will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. 

This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Barau would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona farmer.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields and enable him to buy more land

loans.name: Mansur

texts.en:
Mansur is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Yanoko Village. Mansur joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mansur will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Mansur now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields and enable him to buy more land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beauty products and cosmetics for use in her business and hopes this will enable her to attract more customers and make funds to educate her children

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en:
Usaini is a Babban Gona farmer from Kwankwarmi Vilage. Usaini joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Usaini will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. 

This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Usaini would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields and enable his kids to go to college

loans.name: Saffiatu

texts.en:
This is Saffiatu, she is married and has one child aged ten years. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to assist them in their education.  In 2005, Saffiatu established her sandals and slippers business for woman. She began her business because she received her capital from her mom and started doing business.  She wants to also assist in taking care of the home. 

Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are woman.  Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1225000 SLL every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of 5000000 SLL.  Saffiatu requires a loan in order to buy additional dozens of sandals and slippers.  She hopes that this loan will help to increase her capital.  In the future, Saffiatu plans to develop her piece of land and educate her child.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional dozens of sandals and slippers to help with educating her child

loans.name: Mutaaga

texts.en: Mutaaga is a single lady who is 50 years old and does not have any children. She owns and operates a small store, selling everyday goods such as snacks, drinks, freezers and much more. She has been doing this for two years. Mutaaga needs a loan to buy a variety of stock such as a bag of flour, bag of sugar, bags of rice, mutton flaps, snacks, drinks and more. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of stock such as a bag of flour, bag of sugar, bags of rice, mutton flaps, snacks, drinks and more

loans.name: Selesa

texts.en: Selesa is 25 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for two years. Selesa has requested a loan to buy a fishing boat, spears, goggles and a fishing net. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Selesa will save more for her children's education and for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, spears, goggles and a fishing net

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Her name is Dolores, 39, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Berlito, her business partner and they have five children, of which two are in High School, three are in Elementary Level in school. The couple works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her children to school. 

Dolores has a balloon business. She buys balloons from a maker and sells them in their community. Every time there is a party, family gatherings, special occasions in their town, people order balloons from her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1,500 a week. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 10000 loan which she will use to buy several balloons and threads for the coming graduation events and parties. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Dolores hopes to maintain her current business and have other businesses as additional source of income. She strives to hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for balloons and threads for balloons to sell and thus pay for her children's education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to create more business premise space, for storage for his store

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman, with 1 child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more fish and a frying pan. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more fish and a frying pan to improve her living standards

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 45 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Araceli works very hard to provide for them.

Araceli runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Araceli has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Araceli would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, eggs, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Nery

texts.en:
Nery is 40 years old and has thirteen children. With four children in school, Nery works very hard to provide for them.

Nery runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, personal product care and other groceries.

Nery has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Nery would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is an artisan from Peru who specializes in ceramic archaeological replicas. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including clay, pigments and brushes, as well as a new lathe.

Walter has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

Jose says, "Our ancestors crafted beautiful and complex pieces with only their hands as tools, without the kind of technology we have nowadays," Jose says. "Through their work they expressed all that they saw and wondered about, their thoughts and beliefs. I feel that Peruvian ceramic art is a way to communicate with our ancestors and to keep them alive. Believe it or not, some archeologists have been fooled by my work! That's because of the aging process I use with my pieces."

"My goal for this microcredit is to be able to craft new works that showcase the rich history of Peru's cultures."

Use the link below to view Walter's ceramic archaeological replicas on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/7284">http://www.novica.com/kiva/7284

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including clay, pigments and brushes, as well as a new lathe

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorna is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lorna has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy supplies for the maintenance of her business.

Lorna has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Yushau

texts.en:
Yushau is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kunkumi Village. Yushau joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve his yields. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yushau will have access to high quality farm inputs, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

This year, Yushau, has set high goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Yushau would like to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Gagaemalae

texts.en: Gagaemalae is a 58-year-old widow and mother of 2 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 5 years of experience in this business. Gagaemalae needs a loan to buy 2 bags of flour, a bag of sugar, an oven, a fryer, and some cooking oil. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies. Gagaemalae has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since March 2015.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of flour, a bag of sugar, an oven, a fryer, and some cooking oil.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. She has been a a farmer for the last 2 years.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase nappier grass and dairy feeds for feeding her dairy cows so as to increase the amount of milk produce. This will enable her to supply more milk to her customers and make more income which will enable her to educate her children.

Her future hopes are to add more dairy cows and supply more milk and be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feeds and nappier grass for feeding her dairy cows and increase her milk production as this will enable her to support her children better.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina makes and sells bibingka (rice cake). She has been engaged in food vending for 10 years. She is a 48-year-old married woman with four children from Alegria, Cebu. Her oldest child is 23 and the youngest is 9. Aside from food vending, she also raises and sells hogs for supplemental income. Her husband's occupation is a carpenter.

She  is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients and purchase pig feed.  These ingredients will be used in preparing rice cake which she will sell in her local community. With these, she will start to improve her both sources of income. Thus she could provide her children with healthy meals.

In the future, she dreams of being able to handle her existing sources of income to have a better living condition which is sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and purchase pig feed

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Her name is Josefina, 53, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Mario, a pensioner. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to meet their daily household needs and medical needs of her husband as well.

Josefina has a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Natasha. Dealers buy the products at a lower price shown on the catalogue of the customers and sell them at a profit.  Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php2500 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a Php 15000 loan which she will use to buy merchandise items and orders of footwear, clothing, toiletries and bags for her customers. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and for a good return of her investment for it is where she gets their daily sustenance and fund the medical needs of her husband.    

Josefina trusts that God will grow and proper her business. She prays that her husband will be completely healed from his sickness and that they may both enjoy their senior years together. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for footwear, bags, beauty and skin products and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a plot for farming in the area, to expand her farming and pay for her children's education

loans.name: Jenabelle

texts.en:
Jenabelle is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jenabelle is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jenabelle has a nipa-making business in the Philippines. Jenabelle requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc.

Jenabelle has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jenabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with 12 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Helen is 39 years old and has 12 children who are in school.

Helen has a nipa-making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc.

Helen has been in this business for six years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rhoda is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rhoda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rhoda requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rhoda has been in this business for six years. In the future Rhoda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Fatmata Medma

texts.en:
This is Twenty-five year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has one child, aged six.  She has two additional dependents, who live with her to be her foster kids.  In 2010, Fatmata established her provision sales business. She began her business because her husband gave her some amount of money to start the business, in order to be helping him with some domestic expenses. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are neighborhoods.  Working 6 days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about 1250000 SLL every month from this business.  

She would like a loan in the amount of 5000000 SLL.  Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy additional cartons of mayonnaise, powder milk, luncheon meat, sardine, bags of sugar and rubbers of cooking oil. She hopes that this loan will help to increase her capital. In the future, Fatmata plans to buy a piece of land, expand the business and provide better education for her child. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional cartons of mayonnaise, powder milk, luncheon meat, etc and to help with her child's education.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marissa is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marissa has a general store business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarettes, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarettes, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 36-year-old married woman with five children. She lives in a rural community on the island of Guadalcanal in the Solomon Islands.

She has a small business selling a variety of food items to her community and has been doing this for almost two years.

Grace has requested a loan to buy goods to restock her business. She hopes to pay for her children's school fee with the profit she makes and also to meet her family's daily expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, biscuits, noodles and other food items for her general store.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is a 52-year-old mother who was gifted with four children. To have additional income, she provides a pedicure and manicure service within their village. She aspires to continue and improve this business but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional of PHP10,000 to buy cosmetics, a nipper, a nail cutter and other materials she needs in providing her service. She is hoping that she will receive her loan so that she can improve the business and provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, a nipper, a nail cutter and other materials needed

loans.name: Oscar Rene

texts.es: Oscar de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Oscar is 49 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife. He has been growing corn and beans for the last twenty years. He sells his products in the different markets that are near his house. With the earnings from his sales he is able to cover some of his household expenses. 

He is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control etc. and to improve his land (which is shown in the photograph) in order to continue with his work and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control etc. and to improve his land.

loans.name: Tufa

texts.en:
Tufa is 58 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling biscuits, donuts, bread and buns in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Tufa has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, cooking oil, an oven, baking soda and shopping bags. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings Tufa will expand her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, cooking oil, an oven, baking soda and shopping bags.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells a variety of goods such as eggs, sugar, powdered milk, canned goods, condiments, soap, mosquito repellent and and many others. She is a 52-year-old married woman with five grown dependents. She lives in Badian, Cebu. She has been engaged in running a store for four years.

She is asking for a loan to buy groceries for the store, as well as piglets and pig feed. These will help improve the display of her store and attract buyers. She will be also raising hogs as supplemental income. With these, she will start to handle her finances and start to expand her business. 

Teresita hopes that her sources of income will become productive. She is hoping to be able to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 47 years old with one child in school. Charita works very hard to provide for them.

Charita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care and other groceries.

Charita has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Charita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn is 51 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 31 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Rosana works very hard to provide for them.

Rosana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Rosana has been in this business for four years now. 

In the future Rosana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 42 years old with one child in school. Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Liza has been in this business for eight years now. 

In the future, Liza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is a Mexican farmer who owns a few cows and hogs. He sells his cows' milk and fattens hogs to sell their meat, while also cultivating corn on a field close to his house, with which he feeds his animals.

He used to pile the manure up outside his farm, where it was emitting greenhouse gases and contaminating underground water sources. Through the purchase of the biodigester, Miguel will be able to treat his cows' and hogs' waste and take advantage of it to produce his own biogas and organic fertilizer.

His household will no longer rely on smoke-producing wood nor costly LP gas to supply the family with energy to cook and heat water. Furthermore, the bacteria inside the biodigester produce nutrient-rich organic fertilizer, which Miguel will apply on his field to increase the yield of his corn in a sustainable way. As he produces more corn and saves money by displacing fossil fuels, wood, and chemical fertilizers, Miguel will be able to buy additional animals to increase his milk and meat production, while protecting the environment.
