This loan represents 24% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Matta

texts.en:
Matta is an artisan from Thailand who specializes in hand crafted jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including stones and other accessories.

Matta has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

Thailand's Matta hails from Chiang Rai: "It is home to many ancient ethnic tribes.  I began to learn and develop a passion for  gemstones and I derive great joy from sharing my creations."

"This microcredit will really help me, as I will be able to obtain a much better price by purchasing in bulk. My goal is to be able to purchase enough materials to last me through the end of the year."

Use the link below to view Matta's hand crafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/2312">http://www.novica.com/kiva/2312

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including stones and other accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional five cartons of ink cartridges and four cartons of exercise books for resale.

loans.name: Seneuefa

texts.en:
Seneuefa is a 21-year-old married woman with only one child. She makes and sells buns in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Seneuefa needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, an oven, shopping bags and baking soda. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save for her children's education. 

Seneuefa has been a member of SPBD since April this year (2015).

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, an oven, shopping bags and baking soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventories for her shoes and handbag company

loans.name: Magali

texts.en:
Magali is the epitome of hard work, resolve, and creativity. Originally from the Dominican Republic, her son was diagnosed with mild autism and she needed a way to support herself and him while also meeting her child’s needs. She started her daycare to be able to take care of her son while earning an income, and soon, what started out as a necessary job turned into a passion. 

Magali is currently working to complete her college degree while running a daycare center and being a mother full time. Despite the challenges, she loves what she does. She feels a wonderful sense of success when one of her daycare children achieves something, such as tying his/her shoe, or walking for the first time. 

The purpose of this loan is to improve the physical appearance of her daycare, update the curriculum, and pay for training classes to renew her daycare license. In the future, she sees herself running a bigger program, and being able to offer quality care to many more children in her community.

loans.use: to improve the physical appearance of her daycare, update the curriculum, and pay for training classes to renew her daycare license

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
In January 2015, Jamila decided to pursue her vision of opening a clothing boutique. Her ultimate goal was to help people not only to look good on the outside, but also to cultivate beauty on the inside. She is a firm believer that “true satisfaction begins when you become satisfied with the you on the inside.” Her women’s clothing boutique, Belle Vie Boutique 25, offers women’s clothing, and is solely owned by Jamila.  She receives occasional help from her family and friends as she works to establish her store. 

Her business has not yet begun operations. However, she has received very positive feedback from her community when she released sneak peeks of her clothing lines. Jamila needs capital to invest in inventories and other business expenses to start operating her boutique. Her greatest difficulty has been securing a loan. 

With this loan, Jamila will be able to purchase clothing items and open her store. She is excited to expose customers in her area to new styles and even more excited to work with women in her community, helping them feel good physically, emotionally, and spiritually. In the future, she hopes to incorporate accessories and clothing for children and men. She also hopes to develop more interactions with her community besides clothing sales. She feels passionately about helping others improve their mental and emotional health, and hopes to create personal well-being workshops for her customers. “I believe,” says Jamila, “that there’s no amount of outside beauty that can make up for emptiness and loss inside. At my boutique, my customers will get the best of both worlds.”

loans.use: to purchase clothing items for her women's clothing boutique

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andre has always had a passion for technology. He started fixing computers in college, but for many years before that, he would disassemble computers and printers in order to build them back up, or fix issues with them.

He started his technology repair business in late 2008, and has a tremendous passion for his business. He loves helping people and solving problems. He doesn’t have any partners yet, but hopes to soon hire employees and expand his company.

According to Andre, his “greatest success is simply helping people fix or repair issues they have with their technology.” He loves when his work makes people happy. However, his greatest challenge has been obtaining sufficient cash flow. He lacks the newest technologies, and that limits what he can do. His business holds great potential that can be tapped with upgraded technology. With this loan, he hopes to improve his equipment and start advertising campaigns.

Check out his website at http://www.myprintersolutions.com/

loans.use: to upgrade equipment and expand advertising efforts for his technology repair business.

loans.name: Anderson Luiz

texts.en:
Originally from Brazil, Anderson decided to start his own auto parts removal company over two years ago to supplement his income. He is currently the sole owner and operator of his business, and lives with his wife and children.

According to him, his greatest success was when he bought his first truck and saw his business through to the second year of operations. However, to expand and improve his business, he needs access to capital, for example, via business loans. Accessing that capital has been his greatest difficulty.

With this loan, he will be able to buy a better truck and improve the capacities of his auto parts removal company. In the future, he hopes to build his company and be able to support himself and his family with his company alone.

loans.use: to purchase a new truck for his auto parts removal company.

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en:
Wenifreda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Wenifreda is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Wenifreda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Wenifreda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Wenifreda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future Wenifreda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 45 years old with two children. Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, condiments, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Rowena has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future Rowena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, condiments, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional clothing and accessories for her store, and increase her marketing efforts

loans.name: Grupo Xoljuyup 1 Group

texts.es:
Tomas (el primero del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) es un padre de familia de 52 años de edad, es soltero tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 20 y 25 años, esta humilde familia vive en el caserío Xoljuyup.
Tomas es un padre de familia que su prioridad de su amada familia es por ello que para generar sus ingresos se dedica a la venta de granos básicos.
Tomas ahora está solicitando un préstamo que lo necesita para invertirlo en su  negocio pues ahora los granos básicos tienen un precio un poco más elevado  por lo que con el capital que él cuenta ya no le es suficiente para comprar frijoles, maíz por quintal.
El gran sueño de Tomas es poder comprar un terreno y construir una casa, así también comprar un carro para poder movilizar su producto.
texts.en:
Tomas (the first on the left in the photo) is a father, 52 years old, single, and has a lovely family of four children between the ages of 20 and 25. This humble family lives in the village of Xoljuyup.

Tomas is a father whose priority is his beloved family. It is for this that he generates his earnings working selling basic grains. Tomas is now asking for a loan that he needs to invest in the business since now the basic grains have a little higher price so that the capital that he has isn't enough to purchase beans and corn by the quintal [approximately 100 pounds].

Tomas's big dream is to be able to purchase land and build a house, and also to buy a car to be able to move his product.

loans.use: to buy and sell basic grains by the quintal [approximately 100 pounds] such as corn and beans.

loans.name: Numia

texts.en:
Numia is 38 years old and a married woman with four children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Numia has requested a loan to buy goggles, fishing net, torches, spears, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Numia will hope to buy a new boat for her business .

loans.use: to buy goggles, fishing net, spear, torches, etc…

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal JUNTOS PODEMOS.
La socia Lourdes alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de artesania,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas de alpaca entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She is a member of the JUNTOS PODEMOS communal bank.

Lourdes has a handicrafts business and she has been doing this for some time.  Things are going well for her, thanks to the dedication she puts into her business.  She wants to be able to continue working in this way, and is asking for this loan to buy alpaca sweaters and other things.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters.

loans.name: G.s Milagro De Jesus Group

texts.es:
EL G.S MILAGRO DE JESUS  ESTA CONFORMADO ESTA CONFORMADO POR CONFORMADA POR TRES INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS CON SEIS HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO EN PRIMARIA. SON ORIGINARIAS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES  MAURA  Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE CUAJADA EN SU CASA DE  HABITACIÓN Y DE FORMA AMBULANTE,  ELLA TIENE CINCO AÑOS DESEMPEÑÁNDOSE EN EL NEGOCIO, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO E INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE QUESO Y LECHE PAR LA VENTA Y DE ESA FORMA HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO Y SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES, Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS.  G.S. MILAGRO DE DIOS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Milagro de Jesus solidarity group is made up of three members who are single mothers with six young children in their care who are primary school students. They are from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern zone of the region. They are characterized by being hard-working, responsible, with desire to improve themselves. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources, they couldn't go to school and they had to work at a young age to help with the household expenses. 

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Maura and she sells curd from her house and as a street vendor as her economic activity. She has been working in this business for five years. The objective of the loan is to increase her working capital and invest in the purchase of cheese and milk to sell and in this way make her business grow and satisfy her customers' demand and, in a not-too-distant future, get more earnings. The Milagro de Dios solidarity group is grateful for the help the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to be able to have a respectable means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital in the sale of curds.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS MECEDES DE KATAÑIRAY, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Julia tiene 53 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la ganadería, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este su negocio el cual el va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
She is a member of the LAS MECEDES DE KATAÑIRAY communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province, and region.

Julia is 53 years old, married, and raises livestock.  She has been doing this for some time and things are going well for her, thanks to her daily dedication to her business, and she wants to continue working this way so she can support her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy a cow.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments on time

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is 39 years old and a divorced woman with four children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, cucumbers, beans and coco samoa in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Eseta has requested a loan to buy seeds, chemicals, bush knives, rake, spade, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Eseta will hope to support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemicals, rake, spade, bush knives, etc..

loans.name: Solonaima

texts.en:
Solonaima is 47 years old and a married woman with three children. She has a small plantation selling beans, tomatoes, eggplant, etc in her community and has been doing this for four years. 

Solonaima has requested a loan to buy seeds, chemicals, bush knives, rake, spade, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Solonaima will hope to built up a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemicals, rake, spade, bush knives, etc..

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
It was a long-time desire of Diane’s to have her own business and provide economic assistance to others whenever possible. She learned about contracting with the United States Postal Service, and eight years ago, founded her own courier service that provides pick-up and delivery services for businesses. What started as one small delivery contract soon boomed into four business contracts in five years. Currently she has 13 part-time employees and two consultants. 

Before becoming president and founder of her company, Diane had over 10 years of management skills and experience maximizing business innovation and efficiency. Some of her past work includes humanitarian and activist work. She volunteered for the Front Porch Alliance, which sought to bring about community revival via faith based and other private agencies. She provided benefits to family and children, carried out activities for youth, coordinated a job fair, and helped to significantly decrease crime in eight targeted neighborhoods. 

Diane’s company prides itself on punctual, cost-effective, and efficient services. However, her largest difficulty has been working in a network of companies and organizations where delays by one party can delay services to many other parties. She has also had difficulty making weekly and bi-weekly payments and payroll when company revenues only come in monthly. 

The purpose of this loan is to help with employee payroll. In the future, Diane plans to expand her company, maximize efficiency and customer satisfaction, and expand the services offered by her business. She also hopes to transition to environmentally friendly vehicles to minimize her company’s environmental impact.

Check out her website at www.keydeliveryservice.com

loans.use: to help with employee payroll for her courier services company

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gasoline, sprocket, wheels and other spare parts needed

loans.name: Guiselle Johana

texts.es:
Guissell tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa y joyas, además de trabajar por otros medios.  Así  ha podido aportar a la economía de su hogar,  y gracias a los financiamientos de MiCrédito, ha  aumentado su mercadería y generado más clientes. 

Por ello, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar jeans, camisas, faldas, shorts, relojes, collares, pulseras, aretes. Lo cual le será de gran utilidad, porque podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos. Ella espera incrementar sus ventas y abrir una tienda para dedicarse de tiempo completa a su negocio.
texts.en:
Guissell has been selling clothing and jewelry for more than five years, as well as working in other areas, and has been able to support her household in this way.  Thanks to the loans through MiCredito, she has increased her selection of merchandise and brought in more customers.

She is asking for a new loan to buy jeans, shirts, skirts, shorts, watches, necklaces, bracelets, and earrings.  This will be very helpful to her because she will be able to offer a greater number of products.  She hopes to increase her sales and open a store so she can dedicate herself to her business fulltime.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Estudiar una carrera universitaria no es suficiente para salir adelante en la actualidad, esto Miguel lo sabe, pues es ingeniero agrónomo. Él es un joven perseverante y soñador,  que se esfuerza día a día por prosperar junto a su familia, que se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, una de las razones que lo motivo a estudiar esa agronomía.

 Por ello, solicita un crédito para el pago de un curso de inglés, que le ayudará para desempeñarse como profesional y así podrá abrirse nuevas oportunidades de negocio e inversión.
texts.en:
Studying at university is not enough to get ahead these days.  Miguel knows this; he is an agricultural engineer.  He is perseverant and a dreamer who works hard each day to prosper with his family, who raises basic grains.  This is one of the reasons he wanted to study agriculture.

He is asking for this loan to pay for an English class that will help him as a professional and open more business and investment opportunities for him.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking and devoted mother of five children. She currently works as a dispatcher, and has been employed at the same job for many years. When Jennifer’s mother passed away, she left an inheritance that was just enough to buy the modest home where she now lives with her family.

Jennifer’s goal is to provide a safe and healthy environment for her children. Two of Jennifer’s children have developmental disabilities, and caring for them is a full-time job in and of itself, but despite the many challenges, Jennifer has managed to find a balance between working full-time and tending to the needs of her children. Jennifer has lived within her means and continually lives up to her financial obligations, but due to falling behind quite some time ago while going through a family crisis, her credit score declined.

This issue has hindered Jennifer in financing a new roof that she desperately needs for her family’s home. Their current roof has severe leaks, and is currently the source of mold growth within their home. There is also fear that the roof may collapse if water continues to collect within the sinks of the old roof.

Jennifer is hoping that SELF and Kiva will help her fund a new roof so that her home will be safe for her children. Not only will Jennifer’s loan replace her roof and provide a safe living environment for her family, but she will also rebuild her credit by making payments on time.

Jennifer will use her Kiva loan to pay for a new roof so that her family can live safely and healthily in their home.

loans.use: to pay for a new roof so that her family can live safely and healthily in their home.

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is the age of 55, living with her family, including four children, in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a weaver and knitting blankets at home. Wool is used in making the knitted blankets. 

Her husband is very expert and knits very fine blankets. This is very slow and time gaining procedure; he knits blankets over night. The demand for fine blankets has been increasing over time.

Her husband wants to buy more raw materials for knitting blankets, but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. 

Therefore, Mukhtaran requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy wool for knitting blankets and it could cause an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's blanket sale business

loans.name: Nofo

texts.en:
Nofo is a 23-year-old woman who is married with one child. She has a small business of painting and selling elei and paintings in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business.

Nofo needs a loan to buy paints, fabrics, a brush, pencils, elei boards, and a spray gun. She will use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. Nofo joined SPBD in April 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, fabrics, a brush, pencils, elei boards, and a spray gun

loans.name: Tapatele

texts.en:
Tapatele is a 70-year-old woman who is married with five children. She runs a business selling daily consumable goods, such as snacks, drinks, freezers and more, in her community. She has more than 10 years of experience with this business.

Tapatele has requested a loan to buy a freezer, snacks, bags of sugar, bags of rice, bags of flour, a bag of salt, a sack of chicken legs, and more. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, snacks, bags of sugar, bags of rice, bags of flour, a bag of salt, a sack of chicken legs, and more

loans.name: Belimbing Group

texts.en:
Belimbing is a group of 5 women. This group is led by a 31 year old woman Novelia (who is wearing a black shirt).  She is married to Elvrit with a lovely daughter named Kristiani.  Currently, Novelia has a business selling fruit ice (smoothie) and the business prospect is very good because so many people want to buy from her. 

Due to a lack of ingredients stocks, Novelia can only produces 15 up to 20 cups every day. Novelia then got information from TLM Account officer on the group loan product; along with four women they formed a group to receive loans from Kiva through TLM Cooperative.  

Novelia is requesting a loan of amounting IDR 2,000,000 to buy more fruit such as papaya, apple, milk, syrup, as well as to buy phone cell credit. The other group members are also requesting the same loan for their own business. They hope the loan product provided by TLM will help them to get a better future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of different fruits for their fruit ice (smoothie) business

loans.name: G.s Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es:
G.S BENDICIÓN DE DIOS ESTA CONFORMADA POR  TRES INTEGRANTES  MADRES SOLTERAS  CON SEIS HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, ORIGINARIAS DE LEÓN LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE OCCIDENTE DE LEÓN, ESTAS PERSONAS SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD, PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DÍA A DÍA PARA SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS Y BRINDARLES UN FUTURO MEJOR.
GRACIAS A S SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES MARTA REYNA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULPERIA, ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA CON PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES EN CANTIDADES PEQUEÑAS COMO: ARROZ, AZÚCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, DETERGENTE, PAN, QUESO, CUAJADA, FÓSFOROS, CIGARROS, HIELO, ETC. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN. ELLA DEDICA A SU ACTIVIDAD UNA DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA CON MUCHO GUSTO YA QUE ES EL SOSTÉN DE SU FAMILIA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS, Y SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES. G.S. BENDICIÓN DE DIOS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Bendición de Dios solidarity group is made up of three members. They are single mothers who are responsible for six children. They are from León which is located in the western part of the department of León. These people are hard working and responsible, with the will to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were unable to go to school. They found themselves having to go to work at an early age to help with the household expenses. Currently they struggle day-to-day to help their children get ahead and to offer them a better future.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, Marta Reyna is the group’s coordinator. As her business she has a “pulperia”, which is a small store with small amounts of edible products such as rice, sugar milk, bread, eggs, detergent, cheese and cheese curds, matches, cigarettes, ice etc.  The business is in her home. She works twelve hours a day every day, offering her products. She takes great pleasure in her work, and it supports her family.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in work capital and to stock her business buying and selling edible products so that in the not very distant future she might earn a better income and satisfy her customers’ needs. The Bendición de Dios group thanks the Kiva investors for the help that they give to people of few resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, so they may have a dignified way of working.

loans.use: to invest in her small store buying and selling products such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent,cheese, cheese curds, matches, cigarettes, ice etc.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal JUNTOS PODEMOS.
La socia Hilda alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de libreria,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuadernos, fólderes, plumones entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She is a member of the JUNTOS PODEMOS communal bank.

Hilda has had a bookstore for some time and things are going well for her, thanks to the dedication she puts in each day.  She wants to continue working this way so she can continue supporting her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy notebooks, folders, markers, and other things.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has three children. She has experience working at  a farm as a milkmaid person. After closing the farm she started to learn and work as a weaver of woolen socks and hats from fabric. She learned how to weave and for almost two years she has sold her ready-made woolen products at the domestic market. 

Beside sewing woolen socks, she does a business of selling and buying wool collars for coats. She has permanent clients in the domestic market and also customers come to her house to place orders. 

She appealed to IMON asking for a help to buy wool to sew socks and wool collars. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy wool to sew socks and wool collars

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fund website development, marketing, and startup costs for the first six months of business operations.

loans.name: Latisha

texts.en:
Ever since she graduated college, it was Latisha’s dream to start her own business. Since then, she has worked against all odds to become a successful entrepreneur. She quickly learned the ins and outs of the trucking industry, while simultaneously raising a daughter on her own. Through her inspirational hard work and perseverance, she has become a well-known figure in her local trucking community.

Latisha is a very social and amiable person, which, she believes, has helped her succeed in her independent entrepreneurial initiatives. “My motto has always been to provide excellent customer service,” she says, “which in this industry means to be courteous, professional, and loyal.” She currently runs her trucking company on her own, but hopes to expand her business by purchasing another truck and hiring a driver. 

Her greatest success, she claims, was her ability to learn quickly in the trucking field and gain her extensive knowledge in diesel machines. She “went from not knowing a thing about any type of truck to diagnosing problems and fixing it myself”, and she is now fully confident in her abilities to assess and purchase vehicles for her company. 

Latisha is originally from New York and lives with her daughter, whom she supports financially. Her personal goal is to raise her daughter be a respectful and successful woman. Additionally, she plans to expand her company and hopes that it will open doors for more successful ventures. With this loan, Latisha will upgrade her truck and improve the services and capabilities of her business.

loans.use: to upgrade her truck and expand her trucking business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photograph is Daniel.He is seventy four years old, married and a father of five children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to learn more skills on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped him to improve his knowledge in business management. He is a maize, beans and banana farmer. Part of the produce is used for family consumption and the rest is for commercial purpose. 

He has applied for a loan to purchase farm inputs, fertilizer and seeds.  He hopes that this will assist him to boost his business thus increase in income. This will enable improve the living standards of his family which includes quality education for the grand children and a better house.

Daniel is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will help improve income thus uplift living standards such as quality education and modern housing.

loans.name: Menu

texts.en:
Menu is a 20-year-old married woman with no children. She makes and sells buns in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business.

Menu needs a loan to buy an oven, a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, baking soda, and shopping bags. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to transform her business into a store. Menu has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy an oven, a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, baking soda, and shopping bags

loans.name: Irenessa

texts.en:
In December 17, 2012, Irenessa founded Eco PakTrak, a convenient, comprehensive source for sustainable food and material packaging/shipping products, and non-toxic restaurant, janitorial, office, and healthcare cleaning supplies. Her focus is on promoting sustainable consumer goods and practices at affordable prices. Her business has recently has experienced a large boom, receiving an award by Ceres Unified School District, and gaining many new clients, including Sac State University and a few restaurants. Irenessa now needs to expand to an office and warehouse.

Before starting her own business, Irenessa worked for her family's shipping business. She started as a novice in the business, but, through her hard work and acuity, soon became the Director of Supplier Diversity.  Over the course of 14 years, she learned how to run a company and its operations.  

Irenessa is originally from the Philippines, but grew up in Hawaii. She is the sole owner of her business and has one employee. She is proud of her business mission to educate people on the importance of being a good steward of the environment. She is also one of the first woman- and minority-owned businesses to focus on non-toxic cleaning products that help reduce consumer waste and improve human and ecological health. 

One of her greatest challenges has been a lack of funding, which is limiting the number of customers she can attract. The purpose of this loan is to develop a website and help her store become certified as a minority and woman-owned company. Her vision is to grow her client base nationally and possibly globally. She plans to add a Green Consultant, and have her company become green certified. In the long run, she hopes to inspire younger generations to protect and improve the environment and to live more healthfully.

loans.use: to develop a website and help her environmentally sustainable products and services store become certified as a minority and woman-owned company

loans.name: Alasa

texts.en:
Alasa is 38 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling buns, donuts, and bread in her community and has been doing this for three years.

Alasa has requested a loan to buy an oven, bags of flour, a bag of sugar, cooking oil, and baking soda. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Alasa will save more for her children's education and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy an oven, bags of flour, a a bag of sugar, cooking oil, and baking soda.

loans.name: G.s Comerciantes De Nagarote Group

texts.es:
EL G.S LOS COMERCIANTES DE NAGAROTE ESTA CONFORMADA POR TRES INTEGRANTES  DOS  MUJERES Y UN  VARONES  PADRES Y MADRES CON SIETE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS  DEL NAGAROTE, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE OCCIDENTE DEL PAIS , TODOS TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONOMICAS UNOS VENDE ROPA OTROS PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES Y QUESO Y  SE CARACTERIZA POR SU COMIDA Y  ARTESANIA COMO ADORNOS DE BARRO, Y QUESILLOS Y TISTE.  ESTOS SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPANIA DE SUS  HIJOS. 
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA   CORDINADORA ES LILLIETH  Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULPERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES EN CANTIDADES PEQUEÑAS COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZUCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, DETERGENTES, JABON, JUGOS, GALLETAS, CAFÉ, HIELO, ACETIE, ETC. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION,  ELLA DEDICA A SU ACTIVIDAD UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. PARA MANTENER SU CLIENTELA Y  SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. G.S LOS COMERCIANTES DE NAGAROTE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE
texts.en:
The Los Comerciantes de Nagarote solidarity group is made up of three members, two women and a man, parents with seven children in their care. They are from El Nagarote, a place that is located in the western zone of the country where all have different economic activities. Some sell clothing, others sell food products and cheese and it is characterized by its food and crafts such as clay ornaments, and quesillos [tortilla with cream cheese filling] and tiste [drink with a base of cornflour]. They are characterized as being hard-working, responsible with the desire for personal improvement. In their free time they like to enjoy the company of their children. 

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Lillieth and she has a grocery store as her business. It is a small store that sells food products in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, juice, cookies, coffee, ice, oil, etc. She has the business in her house. She works some twelve hours per day selling her products to maintain her customer base and satisfy the demand and in a not-too-distant future be able to get more income. The Los Comerciantes de Nagarote solidarity group is grateful for the help the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and poor countries.

loans.use: to invest in food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, juice, cookies, coffee, ice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Aisalkyn

texts.ru: Айсалкын, 41 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование у нее среднее. Айсалкын занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 2 лошади, корова, 20 овец. На 1,40 Га земли выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). Айсалкын обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и овец. Айсалкын является участником группы "Ак-Тилек 2013", всего в группе 3 человека. Свои доходы она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Aisalkyn is 41 years old, married, with three children.  She has a secondary education and works in agriculture.  She has two horses, one cow and 20 sheep on her farm.  She also grows beans on 1.4 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  Aisalkyn has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow and some sheep.  She is a member of the "Ak-Tilek 2013" group, which comprises a total of three people.  She is planning to reinvest her earnings into further improving her business.

loans.use: to buy one cow and some sheep in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, tortillas y productos de uso personal dedica a esta actividad desde hace 11 años, vende sus productos de manera ambulante, con lo que obtiene su trabajo con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana, 41 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their two daughters. She works selling pupusas, tortillas and personal products. She has done this work for 11 years. She sells her products as a street vendor; with what she earns with her work she helps her husband and they manage to cover some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant, etc., all in bulk, and in this way be able to continue with her work to have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant, etc., all in bulk.

loans.name: Awake

texts.en:
Awake is 34 years old and a married woman with 7 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as chicken, flour, salt, sugar, snacks etc. She has been doing this for 6 years. 

Awake needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, corned beef, beer, toiletries etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her store. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, tinned fish, corned beef, beer,etc

loans.name: Maselina

texts.en: Maselina is a 38-year-old, separated mother of 4 children. She runs a small business preparing and selling chips, pancakes, and peanuts in her community, and has been doing this for 3 years. Maselina has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, and a fry pan, etc. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Maselina hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, and a frying pan, etc.

loans.name: Maria Santiaga

texts.es:
María, está necesitando de más capital para comprar maíz para elaborar la venta de tortillas, también invertirá en cerdos y concentrado para alimentar a sus animales, su idea es fortalecer su negocio para mantenerse trabajando y generando ingresos importantes para subsistir con su familia.
El crédito anterior ha tenido un impacto positivo en su negocio, actualmente cuenta con nuevos clientes y mejores ingresos, permitiéndole tener nuevas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María needs more capital to purchase corn to make and sell tortillas and will also invest in pigs and concentrated feed to give to her animals. The idea is to strengthen her business to continue working and generating significant income to survive with her family.

The previous loan has had a positive impact on her business. Currently she has new customers and more income, allowing her to have new living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase corn to make and sell tortillas, and also she will invest in pigs and concentrated feed to give her animals.

loans.name: Ifra

texts.en:
Ifra’s is 46; she is married, mother of two sons and two daughters and living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a clothing sale shop in the market. He purchases garments articles from a market at low prices and sells them on at a profitable price from his shop. The ladies, especially, in the town, like his garment collection and selection a lot. 

Now the summer season is going to start, he wants to buy the garments to sell. But he does not have the funds, due to household expenses. Therefore, Ifra requested a loan so that her husband can buy garments for the summer season to fulfill the demand. 

Ifra wishes for a bright future for her children and her dream is to provide a better education to them. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more garments to stock her husband's business and be able to afford school fees

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
Farzona is a skillful girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers in 1994. She is living with her parents. She is single and does business herself. Recently she became a tailor and sews traditional women dresses. For a year she learned how to sew and then started to do business. Originally she was faced with difficulties to attract customers for her dresses and aimed to work hard in order to help her parents with finances. She saved up money and bought a sewing machine to start doing business. 

In order to decorate and do designs on her dresses, she goes to her tutor to use her computer sewing machine. She appealed to IMON and Kiva asking for help to buy a computer sewing machine. It would help to her work efficiently and support her parents more. She awaits Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy a computer sewing machine to produce better quality dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nail polish, cosmetics, cuticle cutter, brush and a nail cutter

loans.name: Sector Xecotache Group

texts.es:
María es una joven de 23 años de edad, es soltera, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
María (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) es una joven que con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con  los gastos de casa se dedica a la venta de café, esta labor lo tiene ella desde hace cinco años.
Para María trabajar en el campo es una bendición pues gracias a ello gana su pan de cada día, ella ahora solicita un préstamo para poder darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, pues esto requiere de mucho capital para poder pagar la mano de obra y compra de fertilizantes.
El gran sueño de María es poder comprar más terrenos para aumentar su cultivo de café.
texts.en:
María is a 23-year-old young woman, single, who lives with her parents in a community in Sololá.

María (the first on the right in the photo) is a young woman who, with the desire to get her own income and support her parents with the household expenses, works selling coffee. She has been doing this work for five years.

For María, working in the countryside is a blessing because, thanks to it, she earns her daily bread. She is now asking for a loan to be able to care for her coffee crop, since it requires a lot of capital to be able to pay labor costs and to purchase fertilizer.

María's big dream is to be able to purchase more land to increase her coffee crop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
María, vive felizmente con su esposo y sus hijos, como en su familia los gastos iban incrementando ella decidió instalar una tienda de productos varios en su vivienda, la cual está funcionando desde hace 6 años, atiende a sus clientes de siete de la mañana a seis de la tarde.
Pensando en fortalecer mejor su negocio opta por solicitar un crédito en Padecomsmcredito para comprar bebidas, huevos, boquitas, cereales, productos enlatados y otros productos con los que mantenga satisfechos a sus clientes, espera sobresalir en su localidad por el buen servicio y buenos precios.
Los sueños que María tiene son lograr establecer un minisúper para tener un patrimonio con el que pueda disminuir las necesidades familiares y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
María lives happily with her husband and their children. As in her family the expenses were increasing, she decided to open a store with various products in her house, which has been running for the past 6 months. She serves her customers from seven in the morning until six in the evening.

Thinking of strengthening her business better, she chose to ask Padecomsmcredito for a loan to purchase drinks, eggs, snacks, cereals, canned goods, and other products with which to keep her customers satisfied. She hopes to improve in her retail space due to her good service and good prices. 

The dreams María has are to manage to establish a mini supermarket to have a legacy with which she can reduce the family needs and pay off her debts.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, eggs, snacks, cereals, canned goods and other products with which to keep her customers satisfied.

loans.name: Edys Matilde

texts.es:
Edys, se siente satisfecha por los buenos resultados que ha tenido al utilizar créditos para el fortalecimiento de la venta de pan, su clientela ha crecido y puede mantener el apoyo que le brinda a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
Solicita un nuevo crédito debido a que de esta manera puede mantener surtido su inventario, estará comprando pan dulce en mayor cantidad cada vez que sea necesario, de esta manera cubrirá las demandas de sus clientes y respaldara el pago de la nueva deuda.
texts.en:
Edys is satisfied with the good results that she has had using loans to strengthen her bread sales. Her customer base has grown and she can maintain the support that she offers her husband with the family expenses.

She asks for another loan because in this way she can keep her inventory varied. She will be purchasing sweet bread in a larger quantity each time it is necessary; in this way she will meet her customers' demand and it will support the payment of the new debt.

loans.use: to purchase sweet bread in a larger quantity each time it is necessary.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, appearing in the photo is forty years old, married and the mother of four. 
She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in March 2014 and has received training on enterprise management and financial planning. This training has equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise of maize and beans farming.

Janet requires a loan in order to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. This will assist her increase her proceeds and thus boost her income. She will therefore be able to improve the overall living standards of her family such as better medical care and quality education for the children. 

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to make all payments on time.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds to boost farm output which helps increase income and enable her to afford better medical care and education for her children.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Mary. She is 63 years old, married and has eight children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and the training has enabled her to be able to manage her enterprise of maize, beans and tomatoes farming in the village where she lives. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds. She hopes that her income will increase and she will be able to provide for the family's needs like clothing and educating her children.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and promises to repay the loan well.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer that will help boost farming and thus meet family needs.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is aged 38, the responsible mother of four sons and two daughters, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She owns a small business for beauty products sale. She contributes her full income for household expenses as well. She always tries to establish her business through offering the latest cosmetics products. Nowadays the latest cosmetics products introduced into the market is very demanding and expensive as well.

Saima requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; she will use the full amount for her business, so that she can buy the latest cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kits, lipsticks, nail polish etc. She hopes that through this amount, she would be empowered to enhance her business. 

Saima is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to enhance her own cosmetics sales business and be empowered to succeed and help her family financially

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Philis. She is fifty-eight years old, married, and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.

Philis does maize, beans, poultry, and dairy farming. She benefited from the HiH EA enterprise and financial development training, by acquiring skills that help her run and manage her business.

She is taking a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and seeds that will help increase the quantity and quality of her yields and thus maximize her profit. Income from this enterprise will help take care of her family's basic needs, education, and medical care.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will increase the quantity and quality of yields.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en:
Dilafruz is a talented woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1989 and is living in a small town with her family. She is divorced and has one child. After the divorce, she started to do business in order to feed her family. 

She does a business of sewing national women's dresses. In order to do business she went to learn how to sew. Now, she knows her how very well and has permanent clients. Separately, she sews traditional mattress and pillows. 

She likes her job and appealed to IMON to have a loan to buy a sewing machine and the necessary items for  sewing, like textiles. She hopes her business will be successful and she can feed her family. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and necessary items for sewing

loans.name: Liliana Isabel

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus dos hijas en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domiilio, realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto aumentará su nivel de ventas lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a permitirle tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liliana is 32 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives in her own house with her spouse and two children in a community that is dedicated to agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. It is located in the district of Zaña in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru.

She works selling groceries like rice, sugar and noodles amongst others. Her business is located in her house. She has done this for 3 years so she has experience and good references from her neighbors. She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of merchandise like rice and sugar, amongst others to increase the stock of her business. This will increase her level of sales and generate more income which will allow her a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise like rice and sugar, amongst others to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, se dedica a la crianza de pescado, oficio que aprendió con ayuda de su familia y lo práctica desde hace doce años, no cuenta con horario establecido; Manuel convive con su esposa y sus hijos, en total son tres personas que dependen económicamente de él, no tiene otro ingreso más que el que genera con su negocio.
Necesita de un financiamiento para poder comprar alimento para peces, redes y otros materiales que le sean de ayuda para aumentar la productividad de peces y tener mejores ganancias, espera mejorar su situación financiera y cubrir todos sus compromisos.
Sus sueños son comprarse un vehículo que utilizara para salir a pasear con su familia y también pare trasladar materiales que necesita en su negocio
texts.en:
Manuel works raising fish, a business he learned with the help of his family.  He has been practicing in this field for 12 years.  He does not have a set schedule.  He lives with his wife and his children.  Three people depend on him economically.  He does not have any other sources of income other than what he generates through his business. 

He needs a loan in order to be able to purchase food for his fish, nets, and other materials that will help him increase productivity for his fish and thus receive better income.  He hopes to improve his economic situation and cover all of his obligations. 

His dream is to buy a vehicle that he will use to travel about with his family and also to transport materials that he needs for his business.

loans.use: to purchase food for his fish, nets, and other materials that will help him increase productivity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her husband's business

loans.name: Hugoberto Lusis

texts.es:
Hugoberto tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad pequeña dedicada principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con terreno agrícola en el cual cultiva café variedad catimore, las cuales se encuentran en buen estado, cuenta con bastante experiecia en el rubro y presenta muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito es para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que mejorará su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hugoberto is 38 years old, and lives with his wife and their two children in the district of Pucará, a small community engaged primarily in agriculture and cattle raising.  It is located in the province of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works in agriculture.  He has some agricultural land on which he grows the Catimor variety of coffee.  His crops are in good condition.  He has a good deal of experience in this line of work, and he has very good personal and work references in his district.  The purpose of the loan is to buy compost and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.  With this, he hopes to offer a better product to his customers, which will improve his income level and, therefore, his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Being a responsible mother, Marjorie supported her husband in gaining income by operating their motorcycle transport business. She is 33 years old and has two children. She and her husband aimed to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better living. To continuously operate the motorcycle, she would like to avail an additional PHP 5,000 to buy the needed gasoline, wheels and spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels and spare parts

loans.name: Ricieri Gavino

texts.es:
Ricieri tiene 31 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que esta ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 12 años y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ricieri is 31 years old and lives in his own home made of rustic material. He lives with his life partner and his two young children in the district of Pomahuaca, a community dedicated to agriculture and livestock that is located in the province of Jaén, the region of Cajamarca, on the northern coast of Perú.  

He works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee.  He has 12 years of experience in this field and he has good personal and work references in his district.  The loan that he is requesting will be used for agricultural labor, applying and incorporating fertilizers, pesticides, and also manual labor for his crop.  This will help the growth and production of his crop, as well as to have a timely crop that will offer the highest yield and best quality.  In this way he will not have trouble selling his crop and it will help him generate income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To pay for applying and incorporating fertilizers, pesticides, and also manual labor for his crop.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Margret has operated a tailoring business for the past seven years, making women’s and gents suits for sale at home. She cites seasonality and competition from other tailors as a major challenge in her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, esta preparando todo para la próxima temporada de siembra y para tener todo a su disposición necesita de un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y  pagar obreros que le ayudaran a realizar los trabajos de limpieza en el terreno y a sembrar maíz, otra parte le servirá para comprar concentrado para alimentar a su ganado y así mantenerlo robusto y saludable.
Con el financiamiento anterior ha mejorado sus cosechas de granos básicos y fortalecido la crianza de ganado, se ha mantenido trabajando sin dificultades y tiene mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Lucio is preparing everything for the next sowing season.  In order to have everything at his disposal, he needs a new loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay workers who will help him carry out the work of cleaning the land and sowing corn.  Another portion of the loan will go to buy animal feed to feed his cattle and thus keep them strong and healthy.

With previous funding, he has improved his harvests of staple grains and has strengthened the raising of his cattle.  He has kept working without difficulty, and he has greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay workers who will help carry out the work of cleaning his land and sowing corn.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro is a wise woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1960. She is living in village with her family and is married with five children. Recently, she is doing business in agriculture. She likes her business and knows her activity very well. Each year her business is growing and now she has two cows and six sheep. She is goal oriented, a brave and kind person. 

She is planning to install plastic doors and windows and live in better conditions. She wants to have a better standard of living. She appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking for help to get a loan to buy plastic doors and windows to install in her house. She is hoping to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy plastic doors and windows to install in her house

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora hails from the town of Alegria, Cebu. She is 41 year old, a married woman with eight children ages 3-21 year old respectively. She makes and sells chicharon(is a dish generally made of fried pork rinds). She has been engaged in that kind of business for 5 years now. Aside from that, she also does farming, as additional source of income.
  
She is asking for a loan buy ingredients like pork skin. These ingredients will be used in preparing chicharon. Wit these, she will be able to augment her income and able to handle her finances.  She will be able to provide her family with nutritious diets. She will be able to continue send her children to school.

Leonora hopes that her business will become successful and sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like pork skin to make her business successful and sustainable

loans.name: Ortikjon

texts.en: Ortikjon is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has three children. She has 19 years of experience doing business in agriculture. She keeps livestock, feeds them and then sells them in the domestic market. She started with two livestock in her business.  For years, her business was successful and now she has three heads of livestock. She likes to do business in agriculture and she takes care of her livestock. She is planning to do an event for her birthday anniversary and appealed to IMON asking to get a loan to do this event. She hopes to be supported and meet with her friends and relatives. The money that she will receive would be spent to buy food and tablecloths.

loans.use: to get a loan to do a birthday event

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariano, mantiene su negocio de cultivo de granos básicos y ganadería con vida gracias a la ayuda de créditos y buena administración de los mismos, su familia se mantiene y los ingresos están mejorando.
Nuevamente requiere de un crédito para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes y pagar los gastos que se generan al preparar la tierra en que se dispondrá a sembrar maíz, espera continuar teniendo buenos resultados y cancelar su deuda sin problemas.
texts.en:
Mariano maintains his business growing basic grains and raising livestock thanks to the help of loans and his strong organization and management.  His family is able to support itself and this income is growing.  

Once again he requires a loan in order to purchase fertilizer, seed, feed, and to pay for expenses that are generated when preparing the land and planting corn.  He hopes to continue with good results in order to pay back his debt without problems.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed, feed, and to pay for expenses that are generated when preparing the land and planting corn.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 58-year-old woman. She lives with her family including one son and one daughter in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a mobile shop for the past 10 years. He sells new mobiles and mobile accessories such as chargers, batteries, hand frees, blue tooth devices, etc in his shop. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built very good relations with his customers. 

Therefore, Farhat's son requested a loan so that he would be able to buy more stock of new mobiles as well as accessories such as batteries, chargers, hand frees, and blue tooth devices to increase his business, but due to insufficient financial means, he was unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Farhat has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her son will be able to purchase relevant items for his business purposes so that he can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Farhat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new mobiles and accessories such as batteries, chargers, hand frees, and blue tooth devices for her son's mobile shop
